column8: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
column12: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017
column12: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
column12: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

column12: I had been using CBD oil for sleep and mild pain control. I found it worked on and off. I switched over to the California Poppy after doing some reading - I had fantastic results right away. It is a bit strong on it's own as far as flavor. I was waiting for about 45 mins with the CBD oil to feel the calming - the CA Poppy was within 10 mins. I found that my sleep was much deeper as well with the CA poppy. I have not used it for pain as of yet - just sleep. My Son was using Melatonin and I asked him to try this. He also said his sleep was deeper with CA Poppy and he did not feel groggy the next day. Also his anxiety has calmed down as well. I would recommend this for anyone  looking for better sleep and something to give a relaxing state, not for pain relief.

column8: "California here I come right back wher I started from"
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
column12: I picked this product because the  California Poppy is my favorite flower and I never knew that I could ingest them.  I grew up with them growing prolifically in our back yard in northern California.  If I knew then what I know now, I would have a  a real great buildup in my system and may have never needed tranquilizers. I take two droppers half full in a glass of liquid before I go to bed and  I can say that i am no longer taking ZQuil., at least..  This seems to be a much more effectual sleep aid.  I cannot say, like the other reviewers, that I wanted a mystical experience or to get "high' on this product.  I am already a "heavy dreamer". I just want to stop taking chemicals to get me to sleep which is VERY DIFFICULT.  I am going to continue to buy this product.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
column12: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

column2: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
column3: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
column4: This listing is for 1 - 4 ounce package of Organic California Poppy Herb. California Poppy Herb, or Eschscholzia californica, consists of the parts of the plant that grow above the ground, i.e., the leaves, stems and petals. These bulk herbs (which are really leaves and petals) are then dried and can be used as an infusion (as in tea) or an herbal tincture. A perennial native to the interior valleys of southern Oregon and California and ranging into the deserts of Nevada and Arizona, bulk California Poppy Herb has been used for several thousands of years by the Yokut and Pima Indians for its mildly sedative properties. Warning: Not to be used during pregnancy.

column12: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower. Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column8: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
column12: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called “glutamate” which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don’t feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you’re increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I’ve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
column12: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I’m not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you’re too wound up to sleep.

column8: Feel benefits to relaxing for sleep.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
column12: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

column12: I was looking for something all natural for anxiety and sleep other than melatonin and kava kava. I was intrigued to try the California Poppy supplement as I've never considered it before.It arrived sealed and I checked the expiration date and it had a good year and a half or so before expiration.I used it for a week straight just at bedtime. It seemed to work most of the time. Then I decided to try one on a Saturday morning around 10am to see how it helped with anxiety. It didn't seem to have much of an effect,if any. However, that's not to say they won't work for someone else. I did continue to use it AM and PM for a couple of weeks and for me, it doesn't seem to have much of an effect during the daytime that I could tell. But for sleep, it helped most of the time.

column3: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
column4: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue’s scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
column5: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

column8: Kava Can Be Addicting, That Should Be on the Labeling
column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
column12: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column8: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
column12: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.

column8: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)
column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2015
column12: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.

column8: Works well for minor pain or sleep problems
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2013
column12: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

column8: Was surprised by Poppy Extract effectiveness.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2013
column12: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column12: I wouldn't buy my tinctures from any other source, they are caring and their quality is top notch, I have tried several other brands and even bought for awhile from a person who makes her own, (not advisable bc of hygenics)...  Hawaii pharm has this down pact!!!From a hopeful, personal point of view...I successfully weaned myself off of opiates with the use of California Poppy..I was taking 4 pills a day for over 8 years!!..I decided to try it on the advice of a local Herbalist who'd owed a store for many years, I tried it, it took a couple weeks to adjust and make allowances for "extra pain" I didn't experience with the opiate, BUT, it is worth giving up more physical activity to not be controlled by a substance that 1) "knocks you out"..2) causes organ damage,sleeplessness, trauma (such as sweats, diareah ,constipation, vomiting if you cannot get it)...It is more like a "whole " body pain relief, not so generalized..and no negative side effects.( and my doctor is on board with it!!)

column12: These California poppy supplements do make me feel a bit relaxed and chilled out, but it's quite subtle, you almost don't notice it unless you're really paying attention to how you're feeling. I took two the other day and the feeling was a bit more pronounced, but still not too strong. It did help me fall asleep and I think it helped me stay asleep too, although I did feel a bit groggy when I woke up the next day. Overall I'm pretty satisfied, it's nice to take a little edge off every now and then.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
column12: Because I don’t sleep well and have a difficult time relaxing this supplement caught my attention.  It is a 30 day supply (assuming 1 tablet a day but the bottle does say you can take up to 4) for under $10 (at the time of this review). I am never used poppy before so I don’t know exactly how I should use it and wish they provided better direction.  It doesn’t say to use it before bed and doesn’t warn about using it while driving or doing other things that require your attention.  I am taking one in the morning and it is too soon to see if I feel more relaxed during the day or sleep better.  I put a photo against another bottle to show that it comes in a bottle about half the size of other bottles.  I applaud the company for this as too often you get a lot of unnecessary packaging and this company seems to be sensitive to that issue.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column12: As a practicing herbalist for many years (for personal use, not as a professional) and an advocate holistic practices I've found that Gaia herbs has always had quality products and I was happy to find this one available here on Subscribe and Save.  My family has been taking both formulas of the Black Elderberry syrup (the standard version and the Nighttime) as a supplements throughout the cold and flu season with excellent results.It's concentrated. You take one teaspoonful once a day, twice only if needed. I've found that it's not overly sedative which is a plus.  It has something of a mild relaxing effect keeping in mind that your mileage may vary.  The potency of the formula is focused in the immunity support that the Black Elderberries provide. It's manufactured in Italy where it's a traditional medicine with these additional organic ingredients:  Acerola, California Poppy, Lemon Balm, Grindelia, Sugar Cane (4g of sugar per serving), water, and Lemon Juice. I've come to really like this product and will be sure to keep a bottle of each formula on hand all year round, so I recommend it highly.

column12: My children were hit with a serious cold/flu thanks to flu vaccinated grandparents "shedding". I know this was the source because I homeschool and my children don't go to daycare. My parents went to the doctor to get antibiotics but my children were given Black Elderberry Syrup, Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup, vitamins, tea (lemon, honey and a little salt) and a small spoonful of diced garlic and honey. My children recovered within two weeks (that's how nasty the bug was) my parents were sick for nearly a month with the cough lingering even longer.I used this product sparingly at night to give relief from the nasty cough and put an oil diffuser in their room to help with nasal congestion.

column12: Broadcast a palm full of the tiny seeds across the surface of my raised bed garden with a high peat based soil did minimal covering several days of sun and rain resulted in ferny plants emerging forming a "grass" each sent up a second offset set of ferny leaves and kept waiting for a second stem to appear between them which never happened was concerned about trying to thin this dense carpet of plants, then overnight a yellow flower and pink flower appeared the yellow opened up to a flat daisy like appearance guess I was expecting more of a oriental poppy, so was surprising to me this is the first seed planted flower to bloom ( s hollyhocks, etc) so very pleased about things can't wait to see all the wonderful colors.

column12: I am a very light sleeper with a racing mind. My biggest issue is not falling asleep, but staying asleep particularly in the morning hours. My brain is so active that I can "worry myself awake". Very frustrating!The tried-and-true supplement I rely on is RidgeCrest Herbs DreamOn Zen formula. I take TWO doses because of my mind's ability to bust through the herbs and think myself awake anyway.BUT with this, I took two doses and slept very very soundly through the night AND morning! Yay! And I have vivid long dreams which I LOVE.The only potential negative, which I do not care about and do not personally consider to be negative, is that compared to the DreamOn Zen, it doesn't help me fall asleep. I don't have issues falling asleep, but I do notice now that something about DreamOn Zen helped make me feel sleepier and go to sleep faster.My new plan is to take one dose of this plus one dose of DreamOn Zen instead of two doses of either one separately.So if your brain situation sounds like mine, try this. And honestly I also highly recommend trying DreamOn Zen too.

column12: I have trouble sleeping and know that what may work for others sometimes may not work for me. However, the Secret of the Tribe’s promise of full refund is what makes it a scam. After trying their product and finding that it did nothing for me, even after more than doubling the recommended dosage I tried to return it and ended on a chat that supposedly approved my return, but could not tell me where to mail the product. It told me to use the rerun address in my confirmation email, but there was no return address in said email. Then I was directed to call the customer service line, but when I did what I got was a recoded message selling me new products and subscriptions. And though I said I wasn’t interested I was transferred to said promotions, since it was a non interactive recording, which transferred to the promotional line regardless of my response. There was no life person to talk to. In other words I got approval to return, but was given zero directions or guidance on how to make said return.I call that a scam.

column8: Non-native seeds sold as California Wildflowers
column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
column12: This seed mix is described as California Native plants but when seeded it contains mostly non-native species (flower bed dominated by Calendula officinalis, Lobularia maritima (sweet Alyssum), and Cynoglossum amabile (Chinese forget-me-not), with some Centaurea cyanus (cornflower), Consolida ajacis (doubtful knight's spur), and common poppy. Of 8 species the only 2 native species are California poppy (many seeds) and Clarkia unguiculata (very few seeds). This is especially bad when you have a garden with otherwise only native plants since many of these species are spreading very easily (and have become introduced in many places in North America).

column8: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
column12: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
column12: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

column2: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) Liquid Extract Tincture 4 Oz (120ml)

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15’ tall with glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
column12: If you have liver problems, don't use it as it has Kava Kava. Don't use it every day either. With that said, I have to say that this extract is amazing. I put it into water and it turns into a cloudy white color. The taste isn't bad, but very herbal. Usually within 20 minutes of taking a dose, I feel very tranquil and relaxed and ready for sleep. It is really good for when I have to wake up early the next morning and can't seem to wind down early enough for bedtime. Before, I would lie awake for hours staring at the ceiling until the first sunlight started coming through the window, knowing I'd have to get up in an hour or so. Now when I need it, I can lay down and fall asleep peacefully. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs an occasional herbal sleep aid.

column12: I've had amazing successes  with kava/poppy. My recent experiences were related to playing solos and juries (end of the semester tests/reviews before the music faculty) during my undergrad education--I majored in music. At this time, my anxiety was just starting to emerge into a problem. I took the recommended dose, on the low side, and found it did wonders to "take the edge off" and allow me to automatically relax my breathing and heart rate and not follow any negative trains of thought. It had a tranquil, peaceful emotional effect as well. But subtle.  One final note, I've noticed a more immediate and profound effect from Sense herbal mix tincture than from taking these herbs earlier in any form separately. Weird. May be this is because they were grown in Hawaii?

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15’ tall with glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2023
column12: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. Even a little fuzzy, which is not a great description for some people but it explains how I feel. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I’m enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.

column8: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
column12: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
column12: It’s a Friday night, and I’m staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I’d tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different—a bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I’d heard these were supposed to be nature’s way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn’t paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity—who knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I’m not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I’d hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn’t feel groggy or out of it—just calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

column12: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. 🙂)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

column12: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me. I sleep better now and that helps immensely!  I'll be back for more!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
column12: This Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract offers a high-potency blend designed to support relaxation and aid in sleep. Each bottle contains 120 capsules, each packed with a potent combination of wild lettuce and California poppy seed extracts. This formula is tailored for those seeking natural relief from discomfort and enhanced relaxation.The capsules feature a strong dosage, with each serving providing 560 mg of wild lettuce extract and 40 mg of California poppy seed extract. The use of extract forms of these herbs allows for a higher concentration of their active ingredients, which can enhance their effectiveness compared to standard forms.Wild lettuce is well-regarded for its soothing properties and is commonly used to help alleviate discomfort and promote better sleep. Its calming effects make it a popular choice for those struggling with restlessness or minor discomfort that disrupts their sleep.California poppy, on the other hand, has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its ability to promote physical and mental relaxation. It can help in enhancing mood and providing relief from physical discomfort, making it a valuable addition to the formula for overall well-being.From my experience with these capsules, I found them to be somewhat effective in promoting relaxation and aiding in sleep. The high dosage of wild lettuce and California poppy seemed to work well in calming the mind and easing discomfort, which contributed to slightly better sleep quality. The vegetarian capsules were a bonus, ensuring that the supplement aligns with plant-based preferences.The capsules are manufactured in the USA in a GMP-certified facility, ensuring a high standard of quality and adherence to strict policies.Overall, Parker Naturals’ Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract Capsules offer a potent, natural option for those seeking enhanced relaxation and sleep support. The high concentration of active ingredients and the vegetarian formulation make this a noteworthy choice for addressing discomfort and promoting restful sleep. It helped me a little, but not enough to purchase more. Others may see more pronounced benefits as everyone is different.Consulting a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement is advisable. Keep well (:

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Blue Vervain (Verbena hastata) is a flowering plant in the vervain family, Verbenaceae. It is a herb with opposite, simple leaves which have double-serrate margins, borne on stiffly erect, branching square stems. The purple flowers appear in summer. Passionflower is a grassy vine that has adapted to the climbing lifestyle with the help of antennae. Flowers are of an unusual structure, large, regular, bisexual, 5-membered, are found in most cases in suprachromic or bococcus inflorescences, while they seem to be solitary, since they are surrounded by rather large bracts at the base.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Blue Vervain (Verbena hastata) is a flowering plant in the vervain family, Verbenaceae. It is a herb with opposite, simple leaves which have double-serrate margins, borne on stiffly erect, branching square stems. The purple flowers appear in summer. Passionflower is a grassy vine that has adapted to the climbing lifestyle with the help of antennae. Flowers are of an unusual structure, large, regular, bisexual, 5-membered, are found in most cases in suprachromic or bococcus inflorescences, while they seem to be solitary, since they are surrounded by rather large bracts at the base.

column12: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

column4: Herb Pharm Ashwagandha Extract is a calming Ayurvedic herb traditionally used to promote a balanced response to stress and to support energy and vitality.* We prepare Ashwagandha extract from the root of Certified Organic Withania somnifera plants. The root is harvested at the peak of readiness, and carefully shade-dried to retain its full color and aroma. Then it is thoroughly extracted. It may be added to water or other liquid for taste and is easily absorbed into the bloodstream. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
column12: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It’s got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can’t speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
column12: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don’t travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I’m taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I’ve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I’m a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there’s still some energy to spare. I’m very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It’s very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I’m often working double shifts a day and I’m feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it’s not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I’m in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I’ve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

column12: I got the one with alcohol, which was maybe my downfall. I’d already been taking Ashwagandha supplements as capsule and decided to try the tincture since my experience with the Lemon Balm was so pleasant. But that’s where I was wrong. The taste is so repugnant and lingers for minutes after unless you eat something super tart. If you try this I’d recommend chasing with a super tart lemonade or going with the non-alcohol version. I seriously don’t know if I can finish this product, as the thought of having to endure another round of this makes me vomit in my mouth a little.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
column12: It sincerely hurts me to write a negative review of this product. A few months ago it was a lifesaver. So much so that I spent $100+ this time around to get two 4 oz Red Root tinctures and two 4oz Astragalus tinctures. I overlooked the first mishap during my first reorder when they sent me two glycerine-based Red Root tinctures instead of the alcohol-based tinctures I had ordered. But the second mishap is irredeemable, as I have been sent an unusable product with diluted health benefits.I was suspicious when I opened the Astragalus (first time ordering), since it was much lighter and strikingly clearer than past Astragalus tinctures I have taken. It also did not have that signature, and unmistakable, Astragalus scent. However, when I opened the Red Root, my heart sank, because I knew then the worthlessness of what I'd received. When I first ordered this product, the Red Root was a vibrant deep, rich red color and an extremely strong extraction. Now, it is indistinguishable from water...even the "alcohol" content appears to be much less than the bottle states, as the taste is more watery than anything else--certainly a far cry from what I'd first ordered. I've uploaded a photo of what the new tincture alongside the little bit I have left of the glycerine-based tincture (photos taken in the same place at the same time of day). There is zero chance that it holds anything close to the amount of plant material it claims to hold on the bottle. And the health benefits I've received from this new batch are zero to none, which is the hardest part to face about this. These are trying times, and to be fleeced like this in the middle of a pandemic when I cannot afford to simply purchase another bottle from a more reputable company, only twists the knife in more. Sadly, I can no longer trust this company, and I would urge others to stay away until this shady business practice has been resolved.

column2: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 2 oz
column3: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 2 oz
column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August.The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

column12: I normally don’t write reviews for health related/nutritional products but I feel the need to do so. It’s been a long journey finding something that works for anxiety. I’ve been on anti-anxiety and benzodiazepines for years. My doctor finally tapered me down to a minuscule does of a benzo that I was on for a year before a new doctor tapered me off completely. I’ve been benzo free for months and not okay. My anxiety is getting better because I’m finally learning to cope through the situational anxiety, however, even when I’m not faced with those situations my anxiety arises. I’m easily startled, my heart jumps, and it’s just something I’ve learned to live with without benzos. I’m on an antidepressant that was given to help with the anxiety. Does it help? I don’t think so because I still have pretty bad anxiety. I tried every herb and natural remedy you can think of. Finally, I found a CBD tincture that contained lavender oil. For the first time ever, it soothed my anxiety just like a benzo. I was amazed because cbd never worked for me. After some homeopathic experimentation I’ve found that it was the lavender oil ( not cbd) that made me feel anxiety free. I received this tincture today and have had some of this in my system for a couple hours. I will be buying more to keep in my purse, car, home. Finally, a natural way to keep me calm and feeling normal that I’m so grateful for.

column12: I bought this as well as the Passion flower oil from herb pharm. My friend who is a naturopathic doctor recommended me to pour three squeezes of each into my water/preferred beverage- she said 4 squeezes should be the maximum amount I use though. I decided to give this product four stars because for whatever reason, it does not calm my anxiety down ALL the time. Sometimes I feel as if it made absolutely no difference, whereas other times I DEFINITELY DO feel that it’s kicking in and working. That to me right there says a lot, because I have tried TONS of natural supplements before in the past to help cope with my anxiety, and NONE of them did a single thing for me & I'm not one to fall for placebos. I’m very satisfied with Herb Pharm’s lavander & Passion flower oils- I just wish they worked ALL the time. I feel like when I don’t take it after 2-5 days they work better. However, if I’m using it everyday, I don’t feel like the results are as great. Either way, something is better than nothing- definitely recommend! Lol

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
column12: I've drunk chamomile tea for a long time, used dried chamomile, had another brand of chamomile extract. I am very familiar with the taste and smell of chamomile. This bottle doesn't smell of chamomile. It smells a little of preservative and that's it. It also doesn't taste like chamomile. The other brand of extract that I bought was good. It smelled and tasted like chamomile and had the same medicinal action as chamomile tea. The other brand extract at near the same concentration is brownish liquid. This one is clear and I can't confirm any medicinal action. I'm not sure what it is, but I can't say if there's any chamomile in it, so it seems like a waste of money.

column2: Hawaii Pharm Passion Flower Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Organic Passion Flower (Passiflora Incarnata) Dried Herb Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement, USA 2 fl.oz
column3: Hawaii Pharm Passion Flower Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Organic Passion Flower (Passiflora Incarnata) Dried Herb Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement, USA 2 fl.oz
column4: Passion Flower (Passiflora Incarnata) is a grassy vine with a climbing stalk up to 9 m long. Long horizontal rhizomes develop under the ground. The leaves are alternate deeply tripartite with a finely serrated margin, up to 20 cm in diameter, sitting on long petioles. The flowers are large, single, up to 7–9 cm in diameter. The sepals are lanceolate, leathery, with prickly outgrowths at the apex. The corolla consists of five free petals and a “crown”, consisting of two rings of filiform fringes, as well as petals that have a bright purple color. The fruit is a greenish-yellow berry that falls when ripe.
column5: Passion Flower NON-Alcohol liquid extract contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality Passion Flower NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | Super concentrated Passion Flower NON-Alcohol extract: dried material / solvents ratio is 1:3! | We strictly use Only Certified Organic or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST Passion Flower herbal glycerite on market! Made with love for plants and respect for Nature!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
column12: Thank you Hawaii Pharm for making a non-alcohol passionflower tincture. I am not able to drink alcohol and take this tincture in the middle of the night when I wake and my head is filled with thoughts. Within a few minutes of taking a few drops, I am falling gently back to sleep only to wake again in the morning. I live in a fabulous community in northern California where lots of folks make Plant medicines but no one makes a passion flower glyceride. I am so grateful. This is ***** star. I highly recommend!

column4: Passion Flower (Passiflora Incarnata) is a grassy vine with a climbing stalk up to 9 m long. Long horizontal rhizomes develop under the ground. The leaves are alternate deeply tripartite with a finely serrated margin, up to 20 cm in diameter, sitting on long petioles. The flowers are large, single, up to 7–9 cm in diameter. The sepals are lanceolate, leathery, with prickly outgrowths at the apex. The corolla consists of five free petals and a “crown”, consisting of two rings of filiform fringes, as well as petals that have a bright purple color. The fruit is a greenish-yellow berry that falls when ripe.

column12: I still use as I wrote here.  It's not meant to be the only product that puts you to sleep.  For that you need a sleeping pill.  I recently added CBD oil.  I take 5 half-droppers of passion flower with a little hot water.  Then I take a dropper of cbd and let it absorb under my tongue for 30 seconds.  The timing is important.  I do this right before I get in bed.  I read for 10 minutes and i'm asleep.  I spell this out for those who struggle with falling asleep.  If I wake up 4 hours later,  I take a dropper of either product especially cbd.

column4: Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) is a perennial herb, reaches a height of 1.5 m. The rhizome is short, thick (up to 4 cm long, up to 3 cm thick), with a loose core, often hollow, with transverse septa. The roots are often separated from the rhizome. The color of the rhizome and roots on the outside is yellowish-brown, at the fracture - from yellowish to brown. Stem is up-straight, furrowed, with branches closer to the inflorescence. Flowers are small, up to 4 mm in diameter, white, pale purple or pinkish, collected in large apical and axillary corymbose or paniculate branched inflorescences. Valerian blooms from the second year of life almost all summer.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2018
column12: I have tried a variety of herbal tinctures to help me sleep, including valerian, California poppy, skullcap,l and lemon balm. All of them helped somewhat, but a few made me groggy the next day, or didn’t seem to help enough. I have been using this hops tincture for about a month, maybe a bit more, and I am actually really impressed with it. Much less sleeplessness and I can generally go back to sleep easier. I use about 10 drops, rather than the recommended dropperfull. I sometimes combine with California poppy, and have been happy with the results. The taste is very strong and quite bitter, I add to a small amount of water and drink quick. Highly recommended, and Herb Pharm is my favorite brand for tinctures.

column8: Still looking for wilderness substitute for that refreshing beverage
column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2013
column12: NOTE: I see this review was hidden by a "sensitivity filter." In the hope of helping others who may be looking for a substitute for their favorite hop-based cold beverage, I have edited the review to eliminate any mention of the beverage's name. I was not aware that this beverage was inappropriate to discuss, since I see it on the shelves in family-friendly places in my very conservative home town. Maybe there is some other problem with my review. Anyway, here goes.My husband and I joke about inventing a dehydrated brew to carry on our wilderness backpacking trips. I bought this extract and Alka-Seltzer Gold, hoping to come up with a recipe that would combine the fizz, the hop flavor, and a cup of spring water into an acceptable beverage.I tried several combinations of water, Alka-Seltzer and hops. Finally one effort produced something that didn't leave me wanting to rinse my mouth, but it wasn't good enough to finish the glass. No way would I carry the extra few ounces to drink it.When added to a cup of herbal tea, this adds a relaxing quality and the bitter flavor is not unpleasant. For now I'll enjoy it that way, until I find a portable lightweight solution to the need for carbonation. Suggestions, anyone?

column8: Off label use here, it is the best beer substitute I've found
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2015
column12: Off label use here, it is the best beer substitute I've found, also a cheap beer flavor enhancer and a way to make tasty light beer out of your favorite regular beer.  Combining it with seltzer water makes a very satisfying and flavorful beer like drink, just a squirt or 2 does it better then any non-alcoholic beer I've tried - I believe the final product comes out less then 0.5% alcohol which qualifies it as non-alcoholic.  Add a squirt to any el-cheapo beer and see a vast improvement in flavor.  Combine your favorite beer with seltzer water (50:50) with a squirt makes some of the best light beer.  Great hoppy floral taste/aroma.If it also helps me sleep, all the better.

column8: No need for a chill pill here!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
column12: I found out about this through an article I came across regarding natural alternatives to pharmaceutical anxiety meds.  It’s chammoile and I drink that kind of tea already so I figured since the price is great, why not give it a try. I am so glad I did!! It tells you to dilute a dropper full in some water. No the taste isn’t absolutely fantastic but who cares, it’s just a tiny bit and is not horrible. I can say this works FANTASTIC!!! It calms my anxiety and stops the racey heart feeling I get. I feel calm cool and collected - most importantly aware and fully present unlike the pharmaceutical prescription anxiety pills which are known to make you feel drowsy, out of it or spacey feeling. No thank you that is not how I want to be nor put that junk in my body. I prefer all natural and highly recommend you give the chamomile a try!!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
column12: I have problems sleeping and this is my second bottle of chamomile.  I drink it in some water at night.  Other things like valerian root and ashwaganha have effects on the kidneys and I don't use them anymore.  I noticed that chamomile doesn't.  It is a very slight relaxation in the night.  But it really does not help me to sleep.  But it slightly helps without having effects on my kidneys as others do have.  Not a big bottle so I don't feel that it's the best value for the money.  It really doesn't taste so bad when mixed in water.  It doesn't make you sleepy but it has more of a very slight calming effect.  But not really worth the money for a tiny little bottle.  So just 4 stars.

column2: HawaiiPharm Chamomile Liquid Extract, Organic Chamomile (Matricaria Recutita) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
column3: HawaiiPharm Chamomile Liquid Extract, Organic Chamomile (Matricaria Recutita) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
column4: Chamomile (Matricaria Recutita) is an annual herbaceous plant. The plant is widespread in Eurasia and North America.The root is rod, slightly branched, light brown. The stem is up-straight, 15 to 60 cm high. The leaves are alternate, sessile, somewhat widened at the base. Marginal flowers are with white bent tongues, having a length of 8 to 14 mm and a width of 2.5 to 3 mm; at the end of flowering, the tongues bend down. The inner tubular flowers are golden yellow, much smaller than the reed ones, with a five-lobed nimbus. The fruits are cylindrical, blunt, slightly bent small achenes.
column5: Highest Strength, Super concentrated Chamomile liquid extract! | Chamomile tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients! | Not filtered Chamomile liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | The highest quality Chamomile extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature! | Made in Hawaii with Aloha! We strictly use only organic or ethically sourced wild harvested material, highest quality alcohol, vegetable glycerin and crystal clear water!

column3: HawaiiPharm Chamomile Liquid Extract, Organic Chamomile (Matricaria Recutita) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
column4: Chamomile (Matricaria Recutita) is an annual herbaceous plant. The plant is widespread in Eurasia and North America.The root is rod, slightly branched, light brown. The stem is up-straight, 15 to 60 cm high. The leaves are alternate, sessile, somewhat widened at the base. Marginal flowers are with white bent tongues, having a length of 8 to 14 mm and a width of 2.5 to 3 mm; at the end of flowering, the tongues bend down. The inner tubular flowers are golden yellow, much smaller than the reed ones, with a five-lobed nimbus. The fruits are cylindrical, blunt, slightly bent small achenes.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
column12: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
column12: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

column2: Hawaii Pharm Valerian Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Organic Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Dried Root Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement, USA 2 fl.oz
column3: Hawaii Pharm Valerian Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Organic Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Dried Root Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement, USA 2 fl.oz
column4: Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) is a perennial herb, reaches a height of 1.5 m. The rhizome is short, thick (up to 4 cm long, up to 3 cm thick), with a loose core, often hollow, with transverse septa. The roots are often separated from the rhizome. The color of the rhizome and roots on the outside is yellowish-brown, at the fracture - from yellowish to brown. Stem is up-straight, furrowed, with branches closer to the inflorescence. Flowers are small, up to 4 mm in diameter, white, pale purple or pinkish, collected in large apical and axillary corymbose or paniculate branched inflorescences. Valerian blooms from the second year of life almost all summer.
column5: Valerian root NON-Alcohol liquid extract contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality Valerian root extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | Super concentrated Valerian root NON-Alcohol extract: dried material / solvents ratio is 1:3! | We strictly use Only Certified Organic or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST Valerian root herbal glycerite on market! Made with love for plants and respect for Nature!

column4: Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) is a perennial herb, reaches a height of 1.5 m. The rhizome is short, thick (up to 4 cm long, up to 3 cm thick), with a loose core, often hollow, with transverse septa. The roots are often separated from the rhizome. The color of the rhizome and roots on the outside is yellowish-brown, at the fracture - from yellowish to brown. Stem is up-straight, furrowed, with branches closer to the inflorescence. Flowers are small, up to 4 mm in diameter, white, pale purple or pinkish, collected in large apical and axillary corymbose or paniculate branched inflorescences. Valerian blooms from the second year of life almost all summer.

column12: I bought this to use as a DIY hair detangler for 3yr old girl with 3c hair. This DIY detangler took it down to 6 minutes after the shower with nothing else in her hair and just a regular wet brush.  I didn't comb her hair for 3 days. column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
column12: In the description it claims to be organic "alcohol free" which is why I got it, since it's for my cat. But the label specifically shows alcohol as the ingredient. My fault I guess for not zooming in on the label picture out here but I didn't think I needed to since the main description says "alcohol free." I'm glad I decided to check the bottle before I gave it to my pet. I'd used another brand before but I've found this brand to be good, and it's a little less expensive, so I decided to go with this one. But not less expensive after all since I've just thrown away $13 for something I can't use and that can't be returned.

column10: Reviewed in France on August 16, 2021
column12: Je connaissais les bienfaits du Bacopa mais je n'avais jamais testé. Ces derniers temps, en raison d'une forte fatigue, j'avais plus de mal à me concentrer sur mon travail. Comme par ailleurs je prends pas mal de poudres (guarana, ashwaganda, lait d'or, cannelle), je voulais essayer une forme en teinture mère. Ce produit répond pleinement à mes attentes, et j'ai vu très rapidement de bons effets (j'ai retrouvé ma concentration, malgré la persistance de la fatigue, liée à bien des facteurs).

column12: Ho notato questo prodotto x caso. Ha dei risultato strepitosi su di me. Ho fatto una piccola sperimentazione su me stesso in quanto da manuale sembra sia controindicato per chi soffre di tiroide. Quindi parlarne con il proprio medico prima di assumerlo. Ho chiesto dettaglo al produttore in quanto la tintura madre deve avere una certa purezza. In ogni caso eccellente x tutte le problematiche che risolve la bacopa! Da valutare persona x persona in quanto cio che va bene x me non va bene x altri. Non sono un medico...
