column10: Reviewed in Spain on May 22, 2021
column12: No quiero ser injusta porque sólo llevo tomándolo una semana y tal vez se necesita más tiempo, pero de momento no noto efectos sobre memoria o concentración.Lo que sí puedo decir, es que para el precio el frasco es grande y dará para bastante tiempo. No lleva alcohol como otras tinturas, lo que es relativamente bueno porque puede tomar toda la familia, pero sin alcohol la tintura tenderá a conservarse menos tiempo. Yo por eso la meteré en la nevera para que el rango de vida se alargue.En cuanto al sabor no es horrible y la tintura viene bien precintada y cerrada, lo que impide su contaminación. En definitiva, seguiré tomándola para ver si noto efectos. Si los noto, me parecerá muy buena compra puesto que como decía la cantidad es abundante.

column2: Herb Pharm Nervous System Tonic Liquid Herbal Formula to Strengthen and Calm the Nervous System - 4 Ounce
column3: Herb Pharm Nervous System Tonic Liquid Herbal Formula to Strengthen and Calm the Nervous System - 4 Ounce
column4: Strengthen and calm the nervous system with the herbs in Nervous System formula from Herb Pharm. The herbs used to prepare this compound are Certified Organically Grown or they are Sustainably Wildcrafted in their natural wild habitat. They are hand-harvested at their optimal potency, and are then promptly extracted while still fresh & succulent or after being carefully shade-dried. All of the herbs in this formula are individually extracted to ensure a broad spectrum of therapeutic plant compounds. Caution: Seek expert medical advice before taking during pregnancy or with medical drugs.
column5: Traditional support to strengthen and calm the nervous system. | Expertly formulated with Skullcap, Oat seed, St. John's Wort and other rapidly absorbed liquid herb extracts. | Gluten-free and non-GMO. | Each herb individually extracted to ensure a broad spectrum of therapeutic plant compounds. | Herb potency assured through High Performance Thin Layer Chromatography (HPTLC) analysis.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
column12: My nervous system isn’t in the greatest shape… I don’t have anything diagnosed but my right hand goes numb on a regular basis and it’s not a blood flow thing.So I got a hold of this stuff to see if it helped with that and also potential sleep issues. I didn’t notice any shockingly amazing results but when I really considered my experience, I did see a solid decrease in numbness issues in my hands, and noticed it came right back when I didn’t take it.I did see positive sleep changes but I cannot confirm if it was this product or other behavioral and diet changes I’ve made that helped.The bottle recommends a dropperful twice a day, I had just been doing it once a day before sleep.The manufacturer also recommends putting it in water or juice or something… and well, this girl is a rebel and puts the dropperful in her mouth and chases it with water. It is a spicy tincture but to me it’s tolerable.

column12: I have been using this herbal compound for 2 years now. column2: Chuan Xin Lian Tincture, Chuan Xin Lian, Andrographis (Andrographis Paniculata) Herb Liquid Extract, Herbal Supplement 4 oz
column3: Chuan Xin Lian Tincture, Chuan Xin Lian, Andrographis (Andrographis Paniculata) Herb Liquid Extract, Herbal Supplement 4 oz
column4: Chuan Xin Lian, Andrographis (Andrographis Paniculata) is native to India. The plant is also common in the tropical countries of Asia. Andrographis is an annual herbaceous plant, reaches a height of 30 to 110 cm. It has a thin, square, branching, dark green stem with longitudinal grooves. Small white zygomorphic flowers are dotted with pinkish-purple spots. The fruits of Chuan Xin Lian are thin 2 cm capsules containing many small yellow-brown seeds. The flowering period is from August to September. The plant mainly grows in hot and humid plains and hilly areas.

column12: I love this stuff. As a pediatric nurse, I take numerous measures to make sure I stay well and don’t bring any illnesses to my patients. One of those measures is a daily dose of high dose elderberry. I used to take Sambucus Immune, but I’ve recently started the keto diet and that particular liquid formula has 8 carbs per serving, so it’s a no go for me (but my daughter stays well on it)! This product is the highest strength I’ve found available in capsule form. I’ve been taking this product over 30 days and during that time, I’ve been in close quarters with several people with viruses like norovirus (stomach flu) and only once did I feel just a little queasy for one afternoon. I took a double dose that night and the next morning I felt at 100%. After that, I go ahead and double up when I’m knowingly around someone sick. Ultimately, I’m very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone.

column12: Black elderberry from GAIA is the real thing. I recommend this to all my family and friends if they are getting sick. column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2017
column12: ** UPDATED FOR JUNE 2017, scroll down to read ** Bought twice. The first time I ordered a bottle I got Liquid Phyto-Capsules, the second time I ordered I recived capsules that seemed to either have powder in them or the liquid has dried up. The date on the bottle says 10/19, so I'm pretty sure they're not expired. I've been taking them like I normally would, but it's just...odd, because I know they're not supposed to look like this (unless they've changed?). I will still order these, I'm just confused. Hopefully I won't get sick or anything, I have 34 capsules left and I take two every morning.UPDATE: 6/12/17So I ordered another bottle a few days ago and received the bottle, to which on the box it stated that it was a new and improved formula. The capsules looked exactly like the ones that inspired me to write this review, they looked like the capsules in the picture. So the company finally got around to making it official that they changed the formula, on the box. I can't say for sure if this new formula works better than the old one, as I was sure that they were onto something with the liquid inside the capsule. Oh well. I ordered the elderberry syrup as well (not the nighttime one) and I take that sometimes when I need the extra help and want the benefits of having the liquid. So I guess just be aware that there's the change to the formula. Too bad they couldn't have just made another version of this capsule and kept this one with liquid inside. But I guess they know what they're doing.

column12: My friend's twin sister, a midwife, recommended this to us two years ago and since then it's helped boost my immunity to every sniffle that comes around, and has made my allergies more manageable. I love this stuff. There's an increasing amount of scientific literature proving the efficacy of elderberry extract in immunity boosting. Amazon has the best prices on Gaia (60 for the price of 30 at Whole Foods), and the capsules are easy to swallow, whereas the syrup is very, very sweet and can be off putting. All of that being said, after six months of ordering it, I have to share this photo of the packaging to shame Amazon into a less wasteful shipping method. The box of capsules in a bubble wrap lined envelope would work just as well.

column12: I have an autoimmune disease called Sarcoidosis that affects my lungs.  I get a lot of mucus build up and non-stop episodes of coughing.  On a whim, I was doing some Google-ing and found the recommendation for black elderberry.  I of course headed over to my favorite store (Amazon) and found the Gaia capsules, ordered a bottle to give them a try.  Wow!  They seem work almost instantaneously to break up the mucus and help to suppress the coughing.  I don't need to take them every day but I have reordered them twice and will continue to order to keep them in my cabinet.

column4: Herb Pharm Certified Organic Valerian root extract works with the body's natural mechanisms to support relaxation and restful sleep*. Herb Pharm prepares Valerian extract from fresh (never dried) rhizome & roots of Valeriana officinalis plants which are Certified Organically Grown on our own farm. To assure optimal extraction of Valerian's bioactive compounds, the rhizome & roots are hand-harvested in autumn or spring and are then promptly extracted while still fresh and succulent. Valerian is bitter sharp and aromatic. It may be added to water or other liquid for taste and is easily absorbed into the bloodstream. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979. *These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.

Offering up to 42 nights of restful sleep support per 1 oz bottle, suitable for daily use.* | VALERIAN SLEEP SUPPLEMENT FOR ADULTS - Not just supporting your sleep, our Valerian root for sleep aligns with healthy lifestyles, supporting relaxation. It's free from additives and made from clean ingredients.*

column12: IDK if its placebo or what.. the moment I take drops of this thing I can sense a calmness and relaxtion. It has helped me calm my nerves and sleep like a baby. First day i took it three times a day.. second i felt better so i took it an hour before sleep and one more right before bed. Since then  I only need to take it before bed.. it has really helped me feel out of a funk i've been in for days. Currently buying my second bottle to keep at work.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2016
column12: I habe been taking valerian for a while intermittently to help me sleep. The liquid works better and faster than pill form. I was so thrilled to fund some affordable ones on amazon because it's difficult to justify a trip to sprouts for just one item and I have 2 small kids to tote around. This is a great quality product. It doesn't habe the alcohol burn like some Valerian liquids do. It does taste terrible when you first use it, but it doesn't really bother me. You kinda ha e to experiment with how much you need, I usually use about 1/4 to 1/2 of the dropper to get the effect I want.  This is also good for headaches and for relaxing as well. It works well for me as a sleep aid. I take it 30 minutes before I intend to go to sleep and it works amazingly!  No groggy feeling in the morning unless I took too much, but it's not like taking a sleeping pill or benadryl sort of groggy. I've never missed my alarm or slept til noon with this. Like I said experiment with how much you need. A while dropper full was too much for me and I'm slim,  5'6, in my mid 30s, for a reference, if size plays a part or just show tolerant you are with sleep aids.  Hope this helps!  Gove it a try, I promise it's worth it for a good night's sleep!!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
column12: I can't remember when I started using this Valerian product. I'm not a good flyer, and that's probably the reason I tried it the first time. If you get a bit anxious about getting locked into a "bus" with 200 strangers and taken up to 30 or 40 thousand feet, I suggest you try this Valerian. You will probably have to try how much to take depending on your size, height, etc. I would suggest you try it out on the ground first. And of course you should always check with your physician, and check out any interaction possibilities with anything else, medications, alcohol, etc. I find it helpful for many stressful situations; but anything like this, herbal or not, is a very personal choice. I find this to be a mild herbal helper for all types of stressful situations. Also, I have not found it to be addictive. It's just there when I need it. Honestly, sometimes i forget to take it, and I learn that I was more courageous than I gave myself credit for. Do your due diligence checking it out for yourself first. For some people it is a great help.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
column12: it isn't sweet like some others, but its not that bad. reading the reviews I thought it would be terrible tasting &/or bitter. It DOES taste a heck of a lot better than lemon balm in alcohol! I would describe it as neutral in terms of sweetness with a pronounced herby quality. For what I need it for, its great!Both bottle & dropper are glass.the 10:1 concentration is very strong; more than the 3:1 I used to use & way stronger than the 1:3 my neighborhood organic foods grocery sells. I cannot see throught the 10:1 in the dropper; it looks more see thru in the other concentrations, esp. in the 1:3the bottle reccomends 30 drops per serving which I've found is just shy of a 1/4 tsp (so about a 1/4 tsp measure full with a very concave meniscus)value-wise then, this stuff is a bargan.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
column12: There aren't many reviews for this product yet so I'm sharing my experience and the experiences of two other people I know that take this Cryptolepis because I believe that this is a high quality product that may help those with Lyme Disease or other infections.I was taking Montana Farmacy's Cryptolepis for Lyme Disease because that brand seemed to be a trusted source with plenty of positive reviews. I can't say that I noticed any difference while taking it myself. Fast forward a few months and someone I know was diagnosed with Lyme and asked me for some herbal recommendations. Amazon was out of the Montana Farmacy brand at that time so I searched and found this one instead. It's made in the USA and 3rd party lab tested so I felt that it was safe to try. This person had a definite herx reaction from taking this Cryptolepis.  The Lyme literate doctor that they see felt that this was a very positive sign that the Cryptolepis was working.I decided to try this brand myself and I can definitely tell that it's stronger and making a difference. It has a 1:3 menstruum ratio vs the 1:5 ratio of Montana Farmacy.  I noticed an increase in fatigue with this brand at first as it started fighting the Lyme bacteria. Now that I've been taking it for a few weeks, I'm feeling noticeably better and more energized even with a low dose.I've also recommended this brand to a second person with Lyme Disease and other coinfections. They were taking a different Cryptolepis and they feel that Secrects of the Tribe Cryptolepis is much better than what they were taking previously.I highly recommend giving this product a try if you're considering it. Just be careful not to take too much at first because it's strong stuff. Start as slow as one drop a day if necessary based on your reaction.

column12: Shame on these companies for watering down medicine.I have a debilitating, deadly illness and I have been buying this brand of cryptolepsis for a few weeks now. I have spent a good deal of money with this company.. It has been high quality medicine. This is not supposed to taste good, it's medicine.I purchased two bottles this time. One bottle was their regular high quality, bitter, highly effective product. The second bottle was watered down and I could barely taste it. I need more of this immediately otherwise I will start having seizures, difficulty breathing, lose my memory again and much more. It is very upsetting when these companies water down their products that we use as medicine.So now I am trying to figure out how to source a large amount of high quality cryptolepsis root in order to make my own tinctures. I've tried a few different brands of this tincture and they simply don't work. This brand had been the best, and I buy it because it ships quickly. I can't afford to wait a week or a week and a half.So I'm going to buy it one last time, and if the next bottle is similarly weak and watered down, and doesn't really taste that bitter, and doesn't really help my health, I give up.You guys are going to lose a loyal customer to try and what, save a few bucks?

column3: HawaiiPharm Rhodiola Liquid Extract, Organic Rhodiola (Rhodiola Rosea) Tincture 4 oz
column4: Rhodiola rosea is a perennial plant of the high altitudes of the northernmost reaches of Norway, Sweden, Finland, Iceland, China, Mongolia, and Russia, and also of Tibet. It bears spikes of blue-green leaves bearing a single yellow flower that blooms during the brief arctic summer. The plant grows in areas up to 2280 meters elevation. Several shoots grow from the same thick root. Shoots reaches 5 to 35 cm in height. Rhodiola rosea is dioecious – having separate female and male plants.
column5: Rhodiola tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality Rhodiola liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! Really the BEST Rhodiola extract on market! Made with love for plants and respect for Nature!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
column12: Bought this as a supplement to unwind after a long day and feel ready for bed a bit earlier than i tend to get to bed but unfortunately it didn't do anything and the taste was terrible. I tend to feel very wired after i get back from the office and it prevents me from getting to bed at the hour that I would prefer, so i was very hopeful that this could be the solution as I don't drink during the week.  Not only was it not enjoyable to drink but it had zero effect on my mood or my state of relaxation. I'm not sure what I'm missing from the people raving about it on the reviews but perhaps its a bit of a placebo effect for some?  I find much better results from taking Ashwagandha and Kava Tea and/or melatonin.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
column12: This product has a significant impact on putting me to sleep. 15 drops (3/4 serving) gets me ready to pass out in about 30-45 minutes. I have always been a good sleeper once asleep, but my smart watch is showing I'm sleeping deeper than normal since I started taking the product. So as a sleep aid it has been phenomenal.I need to take about a serving and a half (30 ish drops) to feel the tension relief in my muscles, and then I almost sleep too hard and have a harder time waking up in the morning. A non alcoholic hangover if you would? hahaI feel better in other ways too but it is hard to separate if I feel better because of the product or because I'm not drinking alcohol before bed.My skin looks great, mood is improved, focus is good. All the things.People complain about the price point, and yes, for 1.2 oz $30 seems steep, but if you figure it replaces one alcoholic drink a night, it's already breaking even or saving you money.I put it in a juice and sparkling water drink, and I've never noticed a taste.I'm excited to try their other flavors/versions.

column8: Not wine, but not NOT wine
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
column12: As I discovered when I was pregnant, there just is not a substitute for red wine. There are great AF beers and even mocktails, but they just can’t get the flavor of a great cab without the alcohol. Fast forward and I’m just trying to ease back on week day consumption (it’s gained some momentum since 2020) and this is not a bad stand in. It definitely tastes more like an herbal tea than wine, but it’s pleasant. I’m experimenting with adding 2 droppers full to some room temperature sparkling water and a splash of no sugar added cranberry juice. It looks pretty in the glass, tastes ok, and I do feel more relaxed after drinking. I would say if you’re hesitating because of the price, just go for it and play around with how to take it. It’s definitely cheaper than 6 bottles of wine.

column8: Liquid gold for generalized anxiety and panic disorder.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2020
column12: As the headline reads I have both generalized anxiety and panic disorder and I’ve been dealing with it all of my life. As someone who has been on many medications over the years with often negative repercussions I’m very much for the natural approach of diet, exercise, Therapy, and supplements.This is not my first herbpharm  tincture I first bought the chamomile and lemonbalm. I was already comfortable using this when I bought it I just didn’t realize how amazing it was for anxiety until recently when I started having crippling panic attacks again at the end of February. As someone who took Clonopin for more than six years, and then had to spend a year withdrawing and coming off of it I have to say this tincture gives me just as much relief. Without any of the side effects of withdrawal symptoms. That’s enough to be a win in my book. It’s reasonably priced it lasts a fairly long time you can also buy a 4 ounce bottle which I love as an option. I’ve known about this for years and like I said I’ve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however I’ve known about this for years and like I said I’ve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however. I originally bought this one for sleep. I have since ordered it two more times. I don’t actually noticed any sedative affects like some others have mentioned. Everyone is different And is affected differently so that’s important to keep in mind. It sucks to see the reviews bad mouthing these herb farm products for potency and what not. Your time would be better spent making a tincture of your own at home instead of writing reviews for products that work for hundreds of other people. I’m so happy I found this and it gives me hope that my anxiety and more so my panic attacks aren’t going to take over my life.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016
column12: This stuff is now a staple and a "need" in my home! My first time trying was a gift from my sister, who insisted I try it! So, this is my second bottle, and I must say, I am impressed!It's not a "cure all" for anxiety, of course. I have chronic anxiety so I knew going in this wouldn't be a cure for that. But it has helped tremendously. It definitely takes the edge off, helps me to be able to take deeper breaths, takes the chest pain away, and makes my heart stop racing! I usually take it 1-2 times a day. With such a small bottle I try to keep it to a minimum and use it only when I really need it.It does not taste good, but I dilute it in a small sip of water and down it fast. Chase it with another sip of water, and done. It does not leave a bad aftertaste, especially when you drink water afterward.I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone with any form of anxiety. Like I said, it's not a cure all, but it does take the edge off!

column8: Natural and for most folks, relaxing and perhaps sleep-inducing
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2018
column12: I know for some folks this product works marvelously. But I’m a difficult case when it comes to falling asleep. If it worked all the time for everybody, then it would be more like a drug. I use other similar products, such as Puritan's PrideCALM TABS that contains Valerian extract, Passion flower extract, hops, and a few other ingredients. Usually they help, but not always. And in the day if I have tension, I prefer a cup of hot tea with half-and-half, even black tea is soothing.Some folks claim that passion flower induces more vivid dreams. Maybe it does. But that’s the last thing I need!

column8: but not bad. I generally need a Trazadone to get me ...
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
column12: There's definitely a noticeable relaxant effect.The taste is... herbal, but not bad. I generally need a Trazadone to get me to sleep, and then I have to discipline myself into relaxing so it can work. With this, even more so than valerian, falling asleep is an eventuality more than a choice (although I used about 3x the suggested dose before I felt much).Like a lot of extracts, this has a heavy alcohol component. I put it in a glass of cheap bota box red; the flavor was very strong and herbal--I actually really enjoyed the taste but I'm a little weird about herbal flavoring in liqueur and wine, so don't trust me on that really.Bottom line, if sleep hygiene doesn't work for you, try melatonin on a strict regime. If that doesn't work, try it and Valerian. If that doesn't work, try melatonin and this.This is powerful in a normally adult way: you'll get sleepy, very sleepy. Nothing fun, just a kind of expensive alternative to waiting on insurance.If sleep I'd the goal, go forth. Otherwise? Just know this is a sleepy drug, not a party drug.

column8: It's more like a sleeping aide and I would not recommend for any other reason
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
column12: I took less than the recommended dose, and it did not have the effect of reducing anxiety. It did, however, include being drowsy and forgetful. I took this late in the morning, and after an hour, I got sleepy and took a nap at noon. I then woke up with a slight headache and slight confusion. Thus, this might be helpful for sleeping but not for reducing stress. I recommend looking up the side effects of taking passionflower. This paragraph did take me a while to write as I am still under the effects of it.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2014
column12:
I was prescribed this extract by my doctor to see if it helped with my hot flashes that were completely out of control. Within 2 weeks of twice daily usage they disappeared, yippee! As a side bonus, with continued use, it also seems to have taken care of heart palpitations I used to get around 3 am.m, upon waking and randomly during the day. My doc doesnt seem to think this is a normal response, but I will take it! I used 2 droppers 2x daily to have this effect, and the 4 oz bottle lasts me about a month at this dosage.Unfortunately I did not have as good luck with it helping my insomnia. I use 2 droppers ? ~40 drops at bedtime. Maybe more would show a benefit.As a side note, the extract works much better for me than taking capsules, even if I take the capsules apart and take the powder in some water.UPDATE Dec2014 - I found if I take 6 droppers half full at bedtime it works great on my insomnia. I just tried Gaia phyto-gels caps
  
Gaia Herbs Passion Flower Liquid Phyto-Capsules, 60 Count







  
  
    and am up to 3 at night with no success/sleepiness, so I may need to switch back to the HerbPharma liquid here.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
column12: I bought this as well as the Lavander oil from herb pharm. My friend who is a naturopathic doctor recommended me to pour three squeezes of each into my water/preferred beverage- she said 4 squeezes should be the maximum amount I use though. I decided to give this product four stars because for whatever reason, it does not calm my anxiety down ALL the time. Sometimes I feel as if it made absolutely no difference, whereas other times I DEFINITELY DO feel that it’s kicking in and working. That to me right there says a lot, because I have tried TONS of natural supplements before in the past to help cope with my anxiety, and NONE of them did a single thing for me & I'm not one to fall for placebos. I’m very satisfied with Herb Pharm’s lavander & Passion flower oils- I just wish they worked ALL the time. I feel like when I don’t take it after 2-5 days they work better. However, if I’m using it everyday, I don’t feel like the results are as great. Either way, something is better than nothing- definitely recommend! Lol

column2: Herb Pharm Herbs on The Go Portable Spray, Bed Time 1 Fl Oz
column3: Herb Pharm Herbs on The Go Portable Spray, Bed Time 1 Fl Oz
column4: Herbs on the Go: Bed Time works with the body's natural mechanisms to promote a quiet, calm and restful sleep while providing soothing support for the nervous system. Expertly formulated with California Poppy, Ziziphus, Lemon Balm, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lavender and Cardamom—the spray is designed to be easy-to-use and rapidly absorbed. Crafted with taste in mind, it has sweet and pleasantly floral flavors. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979.
column5: Promotes a quiet, calm and restful sleep, and provides soothing support for the nervous system. | Intuitive format makes it easier to include herbs in your healthy everyday habits. | It's sweet and pleasantly floral flavors engage your pre-digestive senses and helps your body recognize and use herbs. | Includes sweet California Poppy glycerite prepared from whole Eschscholzia californica plants (root, leaf & flower) which are Certified Organically Grown on Herb Pharm's own farm. The plants are hand-harvested while in full flower, then milled at the last moment before extraction. | This statement has not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
column8: The best sleep aid I've ever used
column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
column12: My acupuncturist recommended this blend, and I was worried it might leave me "hungover" in the morning, because I tend to be very sensitive to such things, but it doesn't at all! I'm in a stressful season of life and was having a hard time sleeping more than 4-5 hours a night, so I would feel really "crunchy" during the day, and then wired-tired at night. This spray has not only helped me look forward to good sleep every night, it has also "softened" my nervous system so even when I'm light on sleep (due to external circumstances now rather than internal ones) I don't get that crunchy feeling. I keep it next to my bed and take it nightly (along with magnesium glycinate). It tastes great! Like cardamom.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
column12: Everything in relation to your health is about chemistry. What works for one person doesn't work for another. Everything you ingest from drinks, food or medications it's all chemistry. I tried all kinds of herbals and prescription medications and nothing works without side effects. I get incredibly sick from Melatonin and other things I tried leave me feeling groggy or with a terrible migraine. I have a very sensitive system.I'm happy I found this because it works with my chemistry. One negative about it for me is bothers my throat a little. I wish it wasn't made with alcohol but maybe the herbs chemistry work better by being extracted with alcohol.The final result is ....I slept like a baby!

column8: Helps me fall asleep when I can't go to sleep
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
column12: Herb Pharm has another winner! I rated this five stars for the formula as opposed to the delivery mechanism. I take the sprayer out and use a dropper to add it to water. The suggested use is to keep it by your bed and spray without getting up. I prefer to mix it with a little water as the spray was a bit intense for my tongue. Otherwise, the formula is great! Most sleep herbs are bitter and unpleasant. This is the best I've used so far and the flavor is decent. When I'm tossing and turning and can't get to sleep or get back to sleep, this helps do the trick. Thanks, Herb Pharm! I'm happy to be supporting a "local" company here in Oregon.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
column12: Desperately wanted this to work. I have lifelong insomnia and have a closet larger than a pharmacy filled with sleep remedies from homeopathic, herbal, Chinese medicine, sprays, essential oils, and at least 15 other types of natural remedies to help me sleep. You name it -- it is in my closet.  I can get to sleep pretty well most nights without any help, but I wake up at 3:00 a.m. and then am up for the rest of the night. Doesn't matter if I hit the sack at 9:00 p.m. or 1:00 a.m.  I am up at 3:00 a.m. for the day. This was approximately my 20th try at a natural remedy for insomnia and it did not work for me. I am writing this after using it for 30 days -- every night as directed. The taste is OK for me since I am used to Chinese herbs which are horrible to taste. But this did not work -- I was up at 3:15 a.m. every night -- so maybe it gave me an extra 15 minutes before I was wide awake for the day.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2023
column12: If only I would have known about this decades ago. I have anxiety, racing heartbeat, never ending racing thoughts, etc. I actually bought this because it's a recommended antiviral for Epstein Barr which I was ordering a few things for, and I liked that it said it calmed the nervous system. Sounded too good to be true but I ordered, of course. It arrived last night and since then I haven't really been worried about much, in a good way lol. I used a full dropper in a 2 oz glass of OJ. After about 20-30 minutes, I felt my body change and relax. My heart slowed down and my mind was just blank. It gets better- when I went to bed, I woke up and something seemed different- I realized that I had gotten many, many hours of deep sleep. I felt like I was waking up from a black hole or something. I have not felt that feeling since I was a child.Order this to help your nervous system and it's antiviral!!!! It's very good for you, all good in my book!

column8: Concentrated and healed up Shingles flare
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020
column12: The only con I would say is the price and I wish this stuff, for the size offered, would be far less since this is technically a mint species that grows like a weed.The pros are, the product I received was concentrated and tasted like it should. I bought it for someone who gets shingles outbreaks during the winter season. It was used topically as needed right onto the shingles boils and in tea (few drops). Both worked well and reduced the outbreak and helped with healing.We usually hear that products from amazon are spiked with water or other fillers. Mine wasn't but that's not to say everyone will get a clean version. I took the chance because I had the liberty to return for full refund and so overall its a 5 stars from me.

column8: Proven helpful in a more restful night of sleep
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024
column12: I am always skeptical of supplements that claim to improve sleep or promote a more calm, relaxed feeling, but this product does assist in falling asleep better with a more relaxed overall composure.  Does it help keep you asleep all night? No, but it does provide longer periods of deeper sleep without the drowsy side effects that often accompany other over the counter meds like Diphenhydramine. Also, I don't rush to give a product review like some tend to do on Amazon - which are not truly helpful.  I usually review after I have used a product for a few months to provide honest and realistic insights. I purchased my first bottle on January 1, 2024 and just began using my 2nd bottle on April 29, 2024 using this product 98% of the time - so I would say it is a good value for the money, costing about $10 a month.

column8: Pura Herba Goldenseal Root Liquid Extract - organic, made in USA, very affordable
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
column12: We use more than a couple supplements. It's not always possible to know how well each is working individually when taken with others. Over the years I have learned to use the label and the ad to judge the quality of a supplement. I use not only what IS there, but also what isn't there.Pura Herba GoldensealPROS:Ingredients are organic.No fillers or chemical preservatives. (None are needed as glycerin is a preservative.)Gives a lot of info, a lot that many should but don't. Pure Herba used dried root and a menstrum ratio of 1:3. I've made extracts and I really appreciate the information.In an amber glass bottle.Extract is made in USA, and the information is on the label. No looking through a miles long ad or posting a question to find out.$15 for 85 servings is 18¢ per serving.CONS:Uses the term tincture to identify this glycerite. Glycerites are made with glycerite, tinctures are made with alcohol, so when they put say it's an alcohol free tincture on the label, it's an oxymoron , a sign of either an uninformed manufacturer or the manufacturer thinking their consumer is uninformed. Both tinctures and glycerites are extracts, but the terms are not interchangeable. Call it what it is, a glycerite extract.

column8: Pura Herba Goldenseal Root Extract - A Great Herb, Info Missing From the Manufacturer
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
column12: Goldenseal is a native plant of North America and has a long rich history of use by Native Americans who long understood the significance of this golden root. Rich in alkaloids mixed with flavonoids this herb is known to be antimicrobial, a natural antibiotic, anti-inflammatory and has many uses in herbal preparations. There are also concerns that due to its popularity, it is being over harvested. That being said this herb is a premier herb to have in your herbal cabinet.That being said, I can judge this bottle of Goldenseal only by the information given on the listing and on the bottle. It is said to be organic but is not certified and is prepared in the USA by Puraherba, a recently founded company out of Florida. Their website given on the bottle does not exist so it appears to be a startup working to get its products to market quickly through this site. While this lack of information raises some questions, I'm hoping that the information given about the product is accurate.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2015
column12: Skullcap is amazing.  I have severe social anxiety as well as anxiety for any other situation.  I was on anti-depressants from age 15 to 21, then I had a child and didn't want to get back on prescription medication.  I make my own gel capsules using the tincture and usually take one to two depending on the severity of the situation.  This does not make me feel groggy or fatigued in anyway, but i have heard that it can in some people.  In my opinion the feeling it gives you is sort of like taking a shot of alcohol, in the way that it calms your nerves.  I recommend this to everyone but some people are hesitant because it doesn't effect you the way prescription anti-depressants or anti-anxiety medication does, which is a good thing I think.  You really have to let your body "open up" and allow it to work to notice a difference.

column8: Excellent calming agent and pain manager
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2014
column12: Excellent calming agent and pain manager!!!  The quality of Herb Pharm is the BEST!!  Using this along with Crampbark by Herb Pharm, I have completely stopped using OTC pain medicine for everything.  The combination of the two can beat any pain that I've had...other than the nerve pain associated with my herniated disk.  It has worked for headaches, menstrual cramps, spastic colon/IBS...and on most of my back and joint pain.  It does not make me tired but does make me more relaxed.  The taste is not a problem.UPDATE: I have discovered Jamaica Dogwood from Herb Pharm and I highly suggest it to all pain sufferers!!! I combine it with cramp bark for severe pain. I still use the Skullcap...but more for pain when I'm trying to relax or sleep...or just to relax. Jamaica Dogwood works on all pain including nerve pain. I finally can live pain-free with my herniated disk. When I recently started to get a flair up of sciatica (caused by herniated disk), I combined it with willow bark also from Herb Pharm, which is an anti-inflammatory (not to be used with any NSAIDs), which caused my sciatica to almost completely go away in 1 hour of taking the first dose. With in 4 days of using the combination my sciatica was GONE...instead of 30 chiropractor visits and tons of physical therapy which used to take up to 4 months to heal. You gotta' love herbs!!!

column8: A great reliever for mild anxiety
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2016
column12: I've spent the last several years working very high stress, technical jobs in startups. And ooohhh man does the anxiety just get worse over time. Over longer periods of stress, certain minerals in your body can be depleted, leaving you more and more anxious and stressed out. Obviously mineral replenishment and the restoration of adrenal function is your end goal, but that takes time.In the meantime, I've found that a few drops of skullcap when I've stressed out helps take the edge off. As with anything, overuse can be problematic and have side effects. But a few drops of this helps calm me temporarily. It's not going to have prescription strength powers..... but it'll be safer and have fewer side effects and issues on your overall bodily symptoms if you have milder bouts of anxiety.I also like to use this before bedtime to help calm my racing mind and get to sleep. My preference is valerian, but using that too frequently can cause it to use it's effectiveness. So I like to alternate out between skullcap and valerian, combined with hops, to actually get a good nights sleep. Enough sleep can help your body better manage your cortisol levels (created as a response to stress).  Out of balance cortisol can lead to a host of other problems, including weight gain.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021
column12: I did quite a bit of reading/research on Skullcap, and the difference in American & Chinese. (This one is American). I started as per the directions: 1 dropper/dose, 3 times per day. I was feeling sleepy (pleasantly) too early in the day. I cut back to 2 doses per day, afternoon and evening. Still more sleepy than I wanted in the late afternoon. Now, if I'm not going out, I have 1 dropper before dinner, and 1 at bedtime. If I'm going out in the early evening for dinner or a gathering, I take only 1 dropper at bedtime. This works well for me. It definitely does feel somewhat "sedating", but in much more pleasant a manner than ANY pill. Plus, my favorite part is the feeling of refreshing wakefulness in the morning, no grogginess. One suggestion, I would avoid taking it at all if you have consumed any alcoholic beverages on that day.

column12: This is working great for me. I have migraines and tension headaches, and also have some trouble with insomnia. This has helped on all fronts. I do not take the full dose, but only about 7 drops at night. If I have a headache in the morning, I start with 5 drops, and sometimes add a few drops of Herb Pharm's White Willow Bark. OTC painkillers have never done much for my headaches, but this takes them right away. If I wake up in the middle of the night, I take about 5 drops along with some L-theanine, and usually can go right back to sleep.I would suggest starting with just 2-3 drops and working up from there. It seems to be pretty strong stuff.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2017
column12: I have tried for 3 years to get off Ambien sleep medication. I tried cuttapering back, but it never worked. Then I read about Skullcap, bought this and the loose tea, but I have yet to try the loosetea as this is so much easier. I began taking it, without lowering my dosage. I waited a week, and then I began cutting down my pills, each time taking that dosage for a week. What I noticed the first week and it continues this way, is I feel relaxed and sleep longer. If I awake in the middle to the night with any problems, I take another dropper full, but that is seldom. Last night I got down to just scraping off just  a little of my Ambien pill, that it was just psychological that I needed it. . Finally, I realize now that I can sleep without Ambien. I will continue to buy this to have when we take trips. This product needs to be advertised more. I found out about when I got on a forum where others were trying to get off sleeping pills. I have never had such good night sleeps and days where I felt energized. I have a new life.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2016
column12: I took this for the first time last night.  What a night!  I took it to help with sleep and pain.  I will say that it most definitely made me sleepy and I did find it calming.  However, for me it appears to be dangerous.  I woke up a couple hours after taking it.  I saw lights on under the bedroom doors (one leads to a hall and one to a laundry room).  It took me a long time to figure out where I was in the room.  I knew I was in the room in the bed, but didn't know where in the room the bed was located.  I then realized that I was upside down and half-off the mattress.  Not at all like me, I don't move much.  I got up and went to the bathroom and when I came back the lights under the door were not on.  I asked my husband who was in the basement playing a computer game and he said no lights were on to his knowledge.  So I don't know what happened!  I think I was half-asleep when I got up.  I ended up sleeping until 9 this morning but I have been groggy all day.  I should note that I am very sensitive to medications so it stands to reason that I would be with herbs as well.  But after reading about some issues with Skullcap and possible liver problems, I'm going to discontinue it.  Tonight I'm trying the Jamaican Dogwood.  I'll post about that one tomorrow.  By the way, I love Herb Pharm and have not been sick all year, which I believe is due to using their Mullein Blend.  I would not hesitate to purchase that one.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
column12: For past five years, I have struggled with organizational and mundane tasks such as laundry, making appointments for car service, getting air conditioning serviced, cleaning out junk, getting rid of things I don’t need, stopping the ridiculous spending on stupid items from Sephora, ulta, etc…. Found these drops, took for a week and was unimpressed but actually cleaned out a room that was a disaster filled with Christmas and old clothing. That was a month ago. As of today, car is serviced, house is cleaned out and estate sale is planned for next Saturday, house will be listed with broker as of next week, my stock portfolio is up to date, doc appointments have been checked off as of last week…..maybe it’s all in my head, but I feel the best I’ve felt in a decade and I’ve been more productive than I’ve been in years. Oh!!!! And I went through old receipts and statements and reorganized my filing cabinet. Have to say these are a miracle. I have a ways to go, but the progress in the last month is remarkable. I’ve tried Vyvanse, Wellbutrin, everything…. These drops work. Just give them a try for at least a month.

column2: Hawaii Pharm Graviola Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Graviola (Annona Muricata) Dried Leaf Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement 2 oz
column3: Hawaii Pharm Graviola Alcohol-FREE Liquid Extract, Graviola (Annona Muricata) Dried Leaf Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement 2 oz
column4: Graviola (Soursop) trees are bushy and low, only about 7.5-9 m tall. Young branchlets are rusty-hairy. The smooth, glossy, dark green leaves are oblong to elliptical and pointed at both ends. Solitary flowers emerge anywhere on the trunk, branches or twigs. They are cone shaped, the 3 fleshy outer petals are yellow-green, the 3 inner petals are pale-yellow. The fruit is more or less oval or heart-shaped, though it tends to be lopsided or curved.
column5: Graviola Alcohol-FREE liquid extract contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality Graviola Alcohol-FREE liquid extract- we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | Super concentrated Graviola Alcohol-FREE extract: dried material / menstruum ratio is 1:3! | We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST Graviola herbal glycerite on market!

column4: Graviola (Soursop) trees are bushy and low, only about 7.5-9 m tall. Young branchlets are rusty-hairy. The smooth, glossy, dark green leaves are oblong to elliptical and pointed at both ends. Solitary flowers emerge anywhere on the trunk, branches or twigs. They are cone shaped, the 3 fleshy outer petals are yellow-green, the 3 inner petals are pale-yellow. The fruit is more or less oval or heart-shaped, though it tends to be lopsided or curved.

column8: Resolving the It taste bad reviews!!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
column12: I've been taking herbal tinctures most of my adult life.  I've purchased different brands, I make my own alcohol-based tinctures using all sorts of herbs.  This product tastes exactly like an alcohol-based tincture with material from the earth, exactly what you'd expect a medicinal herbal to taste like.  It has no fillers, no preservatives, no taste enhancers like commercial cough syrup made to taste like cherry to accommodate the finicky consumer.  People writing reviews that says, it tastes awful, it made them "puke" are probably not accustomed to taking botanical tinctures.  There is NOTHING, absolutely nothing about this tincture that differentiates it from most other herbal tinctures.  If you want bad taste, try sage or valerian in a tincture.  If you never smelled valerian, give it a go then smell this.  Based on the reviews, I thought that the mushrooms might have exceptionally bad taste profile different from other tinctures.  No, it smells and tastes like alcohol because it's 30-40% alcohol, with raw mushrooms from the earth.  I can't say it tastes good, nor can I say it tastes bad.  Those are very subjective  reviews based on your experience and tolerance for taking medicinal botanicals.  There is no foul odor compared to other herbals, but not as nice as something like elderberry.  It is what it is.  You're taking a medicine designed to heal your body.  If you're a lush, you'll have no problems.  The fact that you personally can't tolerate the taste is not a reflection of the product.  It would be reasonable to say, I didn't tolerate the taste but it's stretch to say it tastes like anything other than what it is.  REvise your expectations if you're not experienced at taking herbal tinctures with alcohol and ensure when you review it you tell others that it might have more to do with you then the actual product.  You might want to find a product with vegetable glycerin because it's sweeter and will mask the musty, earth flavor of the mushrooms.  It is what it is and it wouldn't be worthwhile if it tasted like cotton candy.  Sheesh!!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2018
column12: My husband swears by this.  He has environmentally induced asthma, from burning out the bronchial hairs doing industrial painting, etc, without a quality mask.  (Please, I beg you, wear an OSHA qualified mask. He nearly died of pneumonia from not wearing one when he should have.  He was on prednisone, which ruined a hip joint, which led to a hip replacement - twice now.  Just wear the right mask and save yourself from possible repercussions down the road.)He used this all winter, along with a daily dose of Cordychi, (and a flu shot, which he gets yearly anyway) and did not get a cold this winter, first time in years.  Coincidence? Maybe.  But he thinks not.  Also, a relative of mine takes cordyceps and reishi, and is recovering from COPD.  He has been interviewed about this, and has been able to reduce his asthma treatments to just a couple a day from what I understand.  He's had asthma since he was a child, he's now over 60, was severely overweight for many years.  Between a massive weight loss and this stuff, and now being able to exercise, he is getting his life back. He recently walked across the province of New Brunswick in Sept of 2019. Google him.  Anything is possible.  Do your research, be informed, as always, about any supplements and their possible side effects and limitations.

column8: Get the benefits of mushrooms in a few drops
column10: Reviewed in Canada on May 20, 2024
column12: The benefits of mushrooms seems to be becoming more and more popular lately. Using a tincture like this is a great way to get the benefits of mushrooms, such as improving the immune system, sleep quality and stress response. They're easy to take; just a few drops under the tongue or in a small amount of water or other drink. However, tinctures are not known for tasting good. They're usually very UNpleasant. But I find putting the drops under the tongue prevents the taste from being too unpleasant. It also allows it to go straight into the bloodstream. I started off with a lower dose than recommended to be sure I didn't have any reaction to it. And gradually increased to the full recommended dose.  I've been taking a few tinctures and have found them to be beneficial. This is also made by a small Canadian company which I'm happy to support.

column10: Reviewed in Canada on January 8, 2024
column12: I have been reading some research on Reishi Mushroom for a while, and there are supposedly a ton of benefits, including cardiovascular benefits and antidepressant properties. I decided to try the liquid and this particular Tincture (mixed with a little alcohol). It's easy to administer, the package says 4 drops a day (or 4 ml), which means this bottle should last 15 days.  However, in the product description, it says to use 2 drops, which means the bottle will last 30 days. Based on my research, I suggest going with 1 or 2 drops a day so that one can analyze if there are any side effects and act accordingly. Once you assess the situation you can probably increase the dosage (or even stop it completely). I'm starting with 2 drops personally and am interested to see if it will affect blood sugar and cholesterol/triglycerides.I didn't taste the drops on their own, but I added them to my tea, I didn't notice any change in taste, though again I'm using 2 drops, so I'm not sure if there will be a difference if one uses 4 drops. You can also add it to food, like a salad, though you probably need to make sure that you eat all the salad serving to make sure you take the dose that you are on. I have high hopes for this product and will continue to consume it for 3 months and go for blood work to see if there are any benefits in the area I discussed above. Though there are other benefits as described in the product description, that I will keep my eye on as well.

column8: Made in Canada, Tastes Great, Easy to Use!
column10: Reviewed in Canada on December 31, 2023
column12: I love products made in Canada and even better when they come in a glass bottle. Includes a dropper (instead of a cap) and measurements up to 1ml so it is very easy to use and get the correct dosage. I'm a firm believer in natural products and using nature to not only sustain us but to repair us as well.It tastes surprisingly pleasant and while I add it to my morning coffee I wanted to know what the actual taste was on it's own and I'm happy to say it's tasty as well as a very light translucent golden colour. Adding it to my morning coffee the taste gets lost so I really don't notice its there.Promotes Better Immune System (which we all want) and Stress Response for a natural calm which in the busy season is a sure blessing! A win win in my book.I'm a little confused as to the dosage as the description says to take 2 dropper full's and each dropper holds 1ml so that would be 2ml. Yet the box it comes in says to take 4ml per adult dosage. And the bottle itself mentions a 4ml serving? So if I take 4ml per serving I would only get 15 servings per bottle. By taking 2ml per serving I will get 30 servings per bottle and if I only want to take 1ml per serving which for me seems reasonable I will get 60 servings so a 2 months supply. Anyhow which ever serving size you prefer to take I believe it will be helpful.I have a strong and healthy immune system as but the stress response for a natural calm is good as my husband says I'm grumpy before I get my coffee and as it goes in my coffee it's a win for both of us. I'm not so young anymore and finding something like this to help keep me calm, relaxed and healthy is great! Love it!Only time will tell as to the overall effect this will have on me and everything responds differently to different folks. But I've always felt mushrooms were good for me and to get the goodness in this tincture which is much more concentrated is wonderful!

column12: I really love this brand, they’re doing things right!  I can completely recommend the Forage brand and their tinctures, particularly the Lion's Mane and Reishi variants. If you read up about them on their site, you’ll see why and what I mean. The origin story and their work is awesome. Reishi in particular has an incredible history that’s worth reading up on. You can’t say too much about health benefits on sites in general, but if you take a look at it’s main uses, I feel this has been working to help things for me. I feel it has an ever so slightly minty taste to it. Main thing to know, don’t waste your money on any mushroom supplement if it doesn’t clearly specify it’s made of  fruiting bodies, and talks about beta glucans. I also don’t bother with supplements unless there’s an NPN number. Forage covers both of those angles. I also love the brown sunlight protected bottle, and the easy to read dropper.So.. yup! This is a great brand! Give em a try.

column8: Works!  Must have at all times...
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
column12: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

column8: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
column12: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I’m not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you’re too wound up to sleep.

column8: Feel benefits to relaxing for sleep.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
column12: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

column12: I was looking for something all natural for anxiety and sleep other than melatonin and kava kava. I was intrigued to try the California Poppy supplement as I've never considered it before.It arrived sealed and I checked the expiration date and it had a good year and a half or so before expiration.I used it for a week straight just at bedtime. It seemed to work most of the time. Then I decided to try one on a Saturday morning around 10am to see how it helped with anxiety. It didn't seem to have much of an effect,if any. However, that's not to say they won't work for someone else. I did continue to use it AM and PM for a couple of weeks and for me, it doesn't seem to have much of an effect during the daytime that I could tell. But for sleep, it helped most of the time.

column12: It’s a Friday night, and I’m staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I’d tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different—a bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I’d heard these were supposed to be nature’s way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn’t paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity—who knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I’m not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I’d hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn’t feel groggy or out of it—just calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

column12: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. 🙂)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

column12: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me. I sleep better now and that helps immensely!  I'll be back for more!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
column12: This Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract offers a high-potency blend designed to support relaxation and aid in sleep. Each bottle contains 120 capsules, each packed with a potent combination of wild lettuce and California poppy seed extracts. This formula is tailored for those seeking natural relief from discomfort and enhanced relaxation.The capsules feature a strong dosage, with each serving providing 560 mg of wild lettuce extract and 40 mg of California poppy seed extract. The use of extract forms of these herbs allows for a higher concentration of their active ingredients, which can enhance their effectiveness compared to standard forms.Wild lettuce is well-regarded for its soothing properties and is commonly used to help alleviate discomfort and promote better sleep. Its calming effects make it a popular choice for those struggling with restlessness or minor discomfort that disrupts their sleep.California poppy, on the other hand, has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its ability to promote physical and mental relaxation. It can help in enhancing mood and providing relief from physical discomfort, making it a valuable addition to the formula for overall well-being.From my experience with these capsules, I found them to be somewhat effective in promoting relaxation and aiding in sleep. The high dosage of wild lettuce and California poppy seemed to work well in calming the mind and easing discomfort, which contributed to slightly better sleep quality. The vegetarian capsules were a bonus, ensuring that the supplement aligns with plant-based preferences.The capsules are manufactured in the USA in a GMP-certified facility, ensuring a high standard of quality and adherence to strict policies.Overall, Parker Naturals’ Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract Capsules offer a potent, natural option for those seeking enhanced relaxation and sleep support. The high concentration of active ingredients and the vegetarian formulation make this a noteworthy choice for addressing discomfort and promoting restful sleep. It helped me a little, but not enough to purchase more. Others may see more pronounced benefits as everyone is different.Consulting a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement is advisable. Keep well (:

column8: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
column12: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

column12: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
column12: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2012
column12: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

column8: Very pretty and lovely. Wild flower.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
column12: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

column2: Metagenics Tran-Q Sleep - for Stress Management & Sleep Support - with California Poppy, English Lavender & Passion Flower Herb - Melatonin Free - 60 Tablets
column3: Metagenics Tran-Q Sleep - for Stress Management & Sleep Support - with California Poppy, English Lavender & Passion Flower Herb - Melatonin Free - 60 Tablets
column4: Metagenics Tran-Q Sleep supports individuals who are seeking a natural approach to improving their sleep quality and managing occasional stress. This herbal supplement is a blend of botanicals that supports the body's natural processes to foster relaxation and tranquility at bedtime.* The formulation includes 726 mg of passionflower extract, a well-known botanical that has traditionally been used to calm nerves and support relaxation.* In combination with 554 mg of jujube seed extract, this supplement provides a foundation for a calm evening routine. Tran-Q Sleep also features 250 mg of California poppy extract and 80 mg of English lavender flowering tops oil, both of which are highly regarded for their roles in supporting relaxation for a restful night's sleep.* The careful selection of these herbal ingredients results in a melatonin-free, drug-free, and hormone-free supplement, offering a pure option for adults seeking calm supplements. Take 1-2 tablets daily with evening meal or as directed by your healthcare practitioner. With a heritage of breakthrough science, innovative products, unsurpassed quality, practitioner education, and dedicated partnerships, it is clear why Metagenics has become one of the most trusted health and wellness brands worldwide. For over 40 years Metagenics has developed high-quality, science-based nutritional supplements, medical foods, and lifestyle programs to support the growing number of people seeking to improve their health and achieve their wellness goals.
column5: Sleep Support: Tran-Q Sleep combines the properties of passion flower with jujube seed to provide relief for occasional stress and sleeplessness* | 250 mg California Poppy Extract: Known for its calming effects, 250 mg California poppy and 80 mg lavender oil support relaxation and calmness* | Passion Flower: 726 mg passionflower and 554 mg jujube seed extract help calm nerves during bedtime to help you fall asleep* | 100% Melatonin-Free: Our supplement is a non-GMO, gluten-free, and vegetarian formula, and contains no melatonin, drugs, or hormones | Designed by Nature, Trusted by Doctors: At Metagenics, we connect people with products that help them live healthier, happier lives
column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2024
column12: Here are the facts that I do know. The item comes in a dark glass bottle, which is an ideal packaging for this supplement. It is a bit rare to find supplements in a glass bottle, and having them in dark glass will prevent or at least slow down Depreciation. I also do love the main ingredients in this supplement. There is a list of other ingredients and there are several of them I’m not a fan of including maltodextrin. So be aware of that. As for how these are working, it is a bit hard to tell.  There are many other variables that affect sleep. Clearly, this is not a supplement that will knock your socks off, but I’m not looking for that either. Will continue to take and time will tell.

column8: LOVE THESE- FINALLY, A Sleep Aid With Lavender Again
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2024
column12: I had a sleep aid I loved which had lavender essential oil in half the capsule and powder herbs in the other.  It was diluted, of course.  It worked better than anything else I used at the time.  Then they seemed to have stopped making it.  I have missed that.  This, however, is a close second!HOW THIS COMESThis comes in a bottle which is glass, not plastic.  I am partial to those.CAPSULESThese are pressed pills with a dividing line down the center if you want to cut them in half.  They break easily.CONTENTSI love what is in these, but did want to point out that sometimes certain herbs will register positive on drug tests.  I know of some people who ate poppy seed cookies or cakes that had false positives, so check on that prior to using these if that is a concern to you.  Otherwise the ingredients in this are pretty nice.SMELL/FLAVORThis has lavender in it.  I do occasionally burp up lavender after taking with a meal.  I love it so it does not bother me.  It might bother some people.DIGESTIONI had no issues with digestion other than occasional burps with lavender usually only once and that is it.DO THEY WORK?I must say these do seem to work well to not only help me sleep , but help me go back to sleep even after having to go to the bathroom at night.GROGGY?I don't feel groggy when I wake up, but I do feel rested.THE BOTTOM LINEI like these a lot.  I will definitely consider a repurchase.MY RATINGFIVE STARS.  These are my new favorite sleep aid for natural sleep assistance.  I am really happy to have found a lavender based supplement again as it does seem to help a lot.

column12: These don’t seem to work for me, true everyone’s system is different but my sleep was no better then when I didn’t take anything.
