column8: A somewhat effective sleep aid, but the taste is absolutely horrible
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
column12: I am someone who has always had trouble falling and staying asleep and I’ve tried countless products over the years.Something as basic as melatonin never really worked well for me, and I don’t like highly addictive medication‘s either, so I always look for a happy medium.When I came across this product, it had such a great list of high-quality ingredients and when I looked its contents up online, they seemed promising.I went ahead and placed an order for them and they arrived pretty quickly.They come in really heavy duty glass jar which almost shattered on the floor because I wasn’t expecting it to be so heavy when I slid it out of the box.As far as the pills themselves, they are a bit large in size.Normally, I would suggest breaking them in half, but the taste is so horrible to begin with that when you break them in half it’s even worse.They are very abrasive, and taking them with a lot of water, it’s still hard to avoid the harness of the flavor, at least for me.Some people may not have as big of an issue with it as I do, but for me, it’s just overbearing.I haven’t really noticed that much of a difference in my sleep pattern either.I don’t fall asleep any faster, but I seem to sleep a little more solid during the night so I maybe can chalk that up to these.But, for the little bit of difference and sleep, it’s not really worth the horrible flavor plus the high price tag.I do feel that for this price point There are much better supplements out there that will help you get a good nights sleep.I hope my review helps you to make a more well informed decision.

column8: Really hard to guage if it's working
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
column12: This glass bottle contains one month of supplements. The bottle says it's tested by a third party, but there's very little information about the product on the packaging itself. Instead, there's a QR code to give you that information. These do not contain any melatonin and use products including lavender and poppy seed to help lull you to sleep. It's important to note that none of these products' effectiveness has been studied or backed up by the FDA.On that note, I replaced my regular melatonin and sleep aid combo to see if I was able to get quality sleep. Unfortunately, after trying for a week, I went back to my old standby. The taste of the lavender was too much for me, but I thought it was worth it if I got better sleep. Unfortunately, this was not the case. I've since given these to my husband to try, but he rarely has sleep issues so these may expire before he gets the chance to use them.They might work for some, but they didn't do much for me (that I could tell, anyway).

column12: I don’t have a lab to analyze these chemically, but anecdotally they seem to work. I work 3rd shift and some mornings I just couldn’t get to sleep despite blackout curtains and several years of this schedule. Now when I get home I take one (haven’t tried two) of these and get in bed. No issues dozing off and no weird dreams like some sleep aids give. Even if it’s a placebo effect, if it works it works.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
column12: I ordered these in April 2024, and they came in a double-safety-sealed brown glass bottle with an expiration date of November 2025. I have taken them for about a week, and they do seem to relax me after about two hours.The smell/taste of lavender, which I use quite a bit of, is borderline overpowering. I don't mind it but it is very strong and other people might not have as much tolerance. The capsules are large, and some people may have difficulty swallowing them. The listing says these are 3rd-party tested, and that testing information is available for each batch; although it's not listed, I assume that is what the QR code is for.While they work for me, I feel the price point is very high. However, it's clearly a quality product.As always, you should consult your doctor before taking any supplement.

column8: High quality, calming properties but you have to be ok with heavy lavender smell & taste
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
column12: Metagenics is a supplement brand I trust for quality. I’ve purchased them thru medical practitioner initially, so I this melatonin-free formula intrigued me. Admittedly, falling asleep has never been my strong suit. And melatonin makes me feel terrible. I tried it for 2 nights. I started with one tablet. The challenge for me is that it really tastes like Lavender-it’s overpowering. The first night I took after my evening meal & tasted the lavender the rest of the night. I can say it seemed to having a calming effect. The 2nd night I took in the middle of my meal and the taste lingered less so. Again, felt calming effect without a groggy morning feeling. The fragrance from the bottle is so strong that I had to remove it from my kitchen where I store my supplement as it’s like having a lavender sachet in a drawer. So while I think I liked the calming effects of the formula, sadly I’m unable to continue taking, because the lavender is too disruptive. It’s really unfortunate- hope they consider reformulating with less lavender or no lavender as the other ingredient are compelling.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2024
column12: I was excited to see a Metagenics product to try as this is a very high quality brand. It has a good blend of ingredients, but way too many additives/excipients in my opinion. I’m also not a fan of the lavender as the taste is way too strong and it can affect estrogen levels.As an herbalist, I really appreciate the California poppy (mildly pain relieving in addition to sedating), passionflower (great for calming a racing mind and soothing the body), and jujube (which has similar properties to the passionflower).If this didn’t have the lavender and had cleaner/less excipients, this would be something I would enjoy taking more regularly. I also noticed I had to take extra on one particular night where I was struggling to sleep, but it did eventually help.

column8: For a Deeper More Relaxing Sleep
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
column12: On occasion I need a little something to put me in the mood for sleeping at night. I find that Hit the Hay is a product that helps me to get the quality sleep I need when those occasions arise. It is made from a soothing blend of herbs like kava kava, california poppy, and passion flower, which are designed to work harmoniously to relax my mind and muscles to help me achieve a calm state primed for deep, restorative sleep.  Happily, I find that the formula does work for me.  The serving size of just one teaspoon does the trick for me most nights.  If not, I take a second dose about an hour later.  With 12 servings per bottle, I find I have a sufficient supply to last a while.  I like this supplement, because it works, it is plant-based, sustainable, and non habit-forming.  Plus, it does not leave me with a hangover the next day.  I note for everyone that it does not contain Melatonin.

column12: I've been battling some occasional sleep problems lately, so I decided to give Urban Moonshine a try. It comes in a small 2 fl oz bottle with a dropper, which is nice for measuring doses. column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024
column12: I am a sucker for products that truly promote sleep support and relaxation. Unfortunately this product missed the mark. First red flag was the proprietary blend. For those who do not know, manufacturers use "proprietary blends" as a way of preventing someone else from reformulating their product by showing the ingredients but hiding the amounts of each. This is bad news in the supplement world for a couple of reasons: 1) you don't know how much of each ingredient you are getting, so there is no telling if you are getting a very underdosed or overdosed amount of any particular ingredient, and 2) because you do not know how much you are getting of each ingredient, you don't know if you are getting ripped off or not. This product is quite expensive at $36 before tax. You can deduce that the combined total of all these ingredients in the proprietary blend are less than half thanks to the disclosure of 48-53% alcohol which leads me to the next red flag.To help with this perspective, this product is "96-106 proof." Sure, the serving size is quite low, but alcohol is known to be neurotoxic and deleterious to sleep. Definitely not something I want to see in a sleep/relaxation product. But at least you might be able to take comfort in that this won't likely be abused for its alcohol content as the taste is unbearable.I really can get past things that are not the best taste if it means I am getting something of great benefit to my health. However, you almost cannot use this product after you try it for the first time because of how of putting the taste is.I wish I had one thing good to say, but they made it really hard. The branding of this product is enticing and creative maybe.But overall I think you are better of looking for something else at this price point. Something that tells you exactly what you are getting in your product.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
column12: Expiration date is stamped on the bottle, showing 08/2026.  This arrived to me 03/2024, so there's plenty of time here.Suggested serving shows as five droppers full, which works out to 12 doses per bottle.  That's  $2.75 per dose at the current price of $32.99.  Moreover, dosage recommendations call for a second round one hour after the first one "if needed", effectively doubling the price per dose.  Keep this in mind.This product is NOT marked with the location of manufacture, only that it's "Manufactured for" a company in Vermont.  The address listed seems to be a "co-working" facility, so that's obviously not where it's made at.  I'm docking a star for lack of transparency.The bottle has a plastic shrinkwrap over bottledropper/lid.  Given the nature of the product, that's about all you can expect.  Not an anti-tamper measure, but the package came with a good bubble overwrap to protect the product and to help avoid spillage.Product is marked as for "short term use only".  Probably just as well given the price tag per day.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
column12: Each of the featured ingredients of this supplement are important for good health - from joints, to circulation and to kidneys. I've really just started taking it. So still have to see how I benefit - or not (hence the 4 stars not 5 yet). And since I am not a large person, I am taking only one capsule though to get the full label dosage 4 are recommended. The capsules are relatively large. So it's easy to believe they contain all the ingredients listed. Despite their size, they are very easy for me to swallow. And I have not had any negative after effects - neither bad taste nor stomach burn. So I will continue to take the supplement and hope to benefit from all its excellent ingredients.

column2: California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 2x4 oz
column3: California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 2x4 oz
column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
column12: I originally bought this for my husband, who responds best to beer as a catalyst for sleep. He has always worked the late shift since he was 15 and recently got an early morning job, so his body isn't adjusting too well. Figuring that it was either the hops or the GABA in the beer that was making him drowsy, I tried making him some herbal tea blends with hops since I had some on-hand. It didn't do anything. So of course, to Amazon!I wasn't searching for a topical product but it aligned with his mentality that pills are bad, so I took a chance on it. Wowow this product W O R K S. Not just for my husband, but for me! I don't have trouble falling asleep, but I don't get good, deep sleep once I'm in that state. This cream fixes that issue completely! I feel so incredibly rested - provided I give myself time for 8 hours.I was sold on one reciew that mentioned they don't even remember falling asleep, and I must say that is exactly my experience as well! I started with 1 pump on my wrists and enjoyed the results, but the best rest comes from applying it to my temples! And I don't need very much when I apply it there compared to my wrists, so it's cost-saving too!If you are unsure on this one, I say take a chance. The worst that can happen is you lose some money, but I think that's better than losing sleep!!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
column12: This is a review for Healthy Gut Be Serene.I ordered this out of curiosity. I didn't believe that a cream could help you destress and relax or even help you get back to sleep. I was almost afraid to try it just in case it was true! So I did the safest thing possible, I used half the dosage before bedtime. As I sat in bed reading for a few minutes as I always do I was overcome by a feeling of "end of the day" relief. I never finished reading that page. In the morning, I found my book on the floor. I never have sleep problems but that night I had barely been in bed a few minutes before my lights went out and that was on half a dose. At the next opportunity I got brave and used a half dose in the middle of the day. It felt like i had a midday pause for a cup of tea! It did not make me sleepy but I did feel renewed and less stressed to continue the rest of the day.  From that point I experimented with dosing depending on how stressed I was feeling.I like the idea of a topical cream. I can keep it in my purse and not worry it's going to spill like liquid drops. HealthyGut products are non GMO, they have no fillers and they use a cGMP facility. However, I don't see information about 3rd party lab testing. In my opinion that is probably the most important certification. you can have. Lastly, unfortunately these supplements from Healthy Gut are very overpriced especially lacking some important certifications.  That really limits the customer base who will no doubt go elsewhere until they find an answer as the founders did in their 'story'. I am not so sure I will order this again but I can definitely recommend this "Be Serene Cream"

column12: If you have trouble taking melatonin as I do this product seems to relax your mind and body allowing you to fall asleep and stay asleep for hours.GABA is known to help with sleep as is l-theanine and this easy to apply cream has both plus California poppy and other ingredients meant to calm a racing mind. It is very lightly scented and I have had no negative effects from the cream ingredients (there is a lengthy list of ingredients). I apply it about an hour before I want to fall asleep although the instructions suggest ten minutes.I wish it wasn’t as expensive as it is but, in the end, you pay for what you get. This cream calms your mind allowing you to fall asleep and restore your senses without using melatonin. It would be a great aid for those who have daytime anxiety because it is so easy to use.

column12: So it definitely does something. I am giving it three stars for that. I was having a stressed out moment this morning from family where I literally felt like that Scream face painting, and I decided to try a pump's worth on my inner arm. The cream is an opaque brown color like a coffee with creamer. It is not oily and seems to absorb quickly without irritation, though stings very, very slightly (I am guessing from alcohol content in it and I have baby sensitive skin; on regular skin it is probably not noticeable). I appreciate there is no added fragrance or perfumes. I did experience palpitations about 15 minutes after I put it on, and I never usually get those. It may be that I should have used less than a full pump as I am a petite woman at 125 lbs. Be careful if you are sensitive, and test first with a small dot, to ensure it is suitable for you.

column4: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
column5: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
column12: i’m glad i got this “wine down” relaxation supplement, but i can’t tell if it has much of an effect on me for promoting sleep.  it arrived safely sealed, and the expiry date on the bottle is a year and a half away.  i like that it comes in a glass bottle with a dropper, and the ingredients seem good.  i’ve taken it a few times and had no bad reaction.  the taste is really mild when i mix it with water.  when i put it directly on or under my tongue, i find the taste pleasant, slightly sweet and herbal, with no aftertaste.  this is currently listed for $89 for 4oz, which makes it rather pricey.  there are many lower-cost similarly effective supplements available that i would buy rather than this, but if this is within your budget, i would suggest trying out their smaller bottle.

column2: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
column3: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
column4: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
column5: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
column12: The Apothekary Wine Down is an herbal liquid tincture supplement that is inspired by red wine. It has a bold, flavorful taste and is made with high-quality organic ingredients such as poppy from California, blue vervain, tart cherry, elderberry, and hawthorn. It has a bold flavor that is described as sweet and fruity, with a mild cinnamon undertone. The supplement comes in a 4.07oz bottle and has 100 servings.Overall, the Apothekary Wine Down is a natural supplement that can help individuals unwind and prepare for a restful night's sleep. Its unique blend of herbal extracts and lack of common allergens make it an attractive option for those looking for a safe and effective way to relax and improve sleep quality.I have to admit that when I first heard about Apothekary Wine Down, I was a bit skeptical about its claims of being "wine replacement" and promoting relaxation and improving sleep quality. I've tried other supplements in the past that promised similar benefits, but ultimately fell short of delivering on their promises. However, after giving Wine Down a try for several nights in a row, I was pleasantly surprised by how well it worked. I like the flavor and easy-to-take formula made it a breeze to incorporate into my bedtime routine, and I found myself feeling more relaxed and calm than usual. I noticed that I was sleeping better and waking up feeling more refreshed, which was a great bonus. While I still approach supplements with a healthy dose of skepticism, I have to say that Apothekary Wine Down has won me over - it's definitely a product that I would recommend to others looking for a natural way to unwind and improve their sleep. My only "complaint" is a steep price. But if you break it down per dose, it's definitely cheaper than wine :)

column12: I am someone who drinks wine, and sometimes likes to WINE DOWN with wine, and who is also in an area where weed is legal and sometimes like to WEED DOWN to sleep.  This has a high bar to clear.  First the packaging.  This is a well packaged product with a sturdy and secure box and a very strong container for the actual liquid.  The dropper is also nice and easy to use.  The liquid itself has a very sweet taste with an herbal tinge, which makes sense given the ingredient list.I used this a couple of times, always opting for the first delivery method: placing a droppers worth of liquid under/on my tongue for 10 seconds.In all cases I was able to sleep, and I would even categorize my sleep as "fine" or "restful" but I do not know how much this expensive tincture contributed to it.  I can say that one thing I did notice is that my dreams were much weirder when I took this.Be careful with this I guess, its very pricey.

column12: I have to admit that when I first heard about Apothekary Wine Down, I was a bit skeptical about its claims of being "wine replacement" and promoting relaxation and improving sleep quality.I've tried other supplements in the past that promised similar benefits, but never really lived up to the hype. However, after giving Wine Down a try for several nights in a row, I noticed it did provide a subtle relaxation effect. It by no means gives that "buzz" you get from wine, but in my opinion the relaxation effect is much better and my sleep deeper.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
column12: My husband and I have both tried this wine down herbal supplement.  He put a full dropper under his tongue as recommended and hated the taste.  He said it tastes similar to cough syrup.  I preferred to try it mixed with sparkling water.  My sparkling water is already slightly flavored, so even with 2 full droppers mixed with 12 ounces of water, I didn't really notice a taste difference.  It was good to me, but again it was mostly sparkling water which I enjoy.  I have to say neither one of us really noticed anything different.  We both took this supplement at night, when we were probably already a bit tired and relaxed, so I cannot tell if it had any kind of noticeable effect.  For that reason, I can't really recommend this due to the high cost.  Maybe it works on some, but I would have to be very sure before spending a lot of money.

column8: I love Wine Down to wind down ;)
column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
column12: After taking Apothekary's Wine Down for about a week, never in my life have I thought I'd say something like this, but this tincture tastes like autumn to me (even though I began taking it in summer ;). And this tincture, when it touches my tongue, spreads a wonderful taste over it- and a quick moment later, there is a slow burn that begins and remains for a bit after.Wine Down comes in a lovely dark white colored glass bottle (not see through, white glass) with a dropper attached to the cap. Both the bottle and dropper are glass and both, the very best quality. The directions tell you to squeeze one drop on or under the tongue and let sit for ten seconds. If you don't like the taste however, you can put it in a drink. You are told in these directions you can take this tincture up to four times a day.When I took Wine Down, I felt the effects quickly- within a couple minutes, and in all honesty, it does have a very good calming effect. It worked so well I took to taking it with me during the day and taking it when I needed to relax. I wouldn't  say Wine Down is terribly intense though, it's just something that actually helped me to relax- as if before I couldn't quote catch my breath and after- well, there was no longer that problem.Wine Down is something that I will definitely be using in the future, because, for me, there were so many positive effects- not only did the tincture relax me but when I took it before bed, it also helped to get me to sleep better- during my “wind down” time (and now this is my “Wine Down” time ;).I am really in love with this product, I don't go anywhere without it (just in case I need it) and have never been so happy to have chosen this product to review on Amazon as- it would have never been something that I tried on my own!

column12: The first time I tried it (sublingual), I sorta felt relaxed, but not like a buzz from drinking.  Don't get me wrong, after a long week, feeling relaxed is a big perk.  I waited a few days before trying it again and had zero affect.  Was on an empty stomach, but figured maybe it should be a once a week treat. Waited a week and tried it again, nothing.  Waited another week and took 1.5 of the droppers to see if I simply needed more, still nothing.  This led me to believe that I either had a placebo affect or ingredients just don't affect me.  Either way, I was disappointed because I was hoping for an addition to add to my rotation of some other products I use.  For the price, I could order 2 of my other supplements that work.

column12: The first time I used it (sublingual), I thought it worked and I was about as relaxed as a glass of red wine. column2: Gaia Herbs GaiaKids Black Elderberry Syrup - Delicious Immune Support Supplement for Kids - with Organic Black Elderberries and Honey - USDA Certified Organic Black Elderberry Syrup - 3 Fluid Ounces
column3: Gaia Herbs GaiaKids Black Elderberry Syrup - Delicious Immune Support Supplement for Kids - with Organic Black Elderberries and Honey - USDA Certified Organic Black Elderberry Syrup - 3 Fluid Ounces
column4:
Our delicious GaiaKids Black Elderberry Syrup is suitable for everyday use for the whole family. This popular formula is USDA Certified Organic and made with only organic black elderberries. Ideal for both daily and seasonal immune support, our Black Elderberry Syrup is a delicious and potent way to maintain your child's immune health all year long.
 Elderberries have been traditionally used for functions of the gastrointestinal tract, supporting a healthy body temperature and perspiration during an acute immune challenge, and for supporting the resilience of the body throughout the difficult winter months. Both elderflower and elderberry are rich in polyphenols, which have antioxidant activity. Oxidative stress is often produced during an immune response, and having sufficient antioxidant storage in the body may help to maintain the health and integrity of tissues. 
 From seed to shelf, Gaia is deeply committed to the purity, integrity, and potency of each product. Since Gaia Herbs was just a seedling in 1987, we have focused on connecting people, plants, and the planet to create healing. We use only organic methods to cultivate more than 6.5 million plants each year. That same organic approach continues throughout our manufacturing. We use patented technology to achieve the highest efficacy of each herb.
 We are a company devoted to transparency. We have created a Gaia’s MeetYourHerbs platform, one of the world’s first and only herb traceability programs, allowing consumers to learn about and engage with their organic herbs. We are able to source premium ingredients so you always know what's in your supplement. 
 As a Certified B Corporation, we are actively working toward building a more inclusive and sustainable world. We nurture healthy connections between plants and people by encouraging strong relationships and championing environmental sustainability within the communities that we work with around the world.
column5: Elderberry (Sambucus nigra) Immune Support: A delicious daily tonic to support kids' immune health* | An Antioxidant Support: Elderberry Syrup has often been used to maintain the body’s natural defenses | Powerful Elderberry Formula: Each serving has the equivalent of 7.25g of fresh elderberries | Purity-Tested: Our organic Black Elderberry Syrup is vegan, gluten-free and proudly made in NC, USA | Our Story: Since 1987, our purpose has been to connect people, plants, and planet to create healing
column10: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2013
column12: I give this to my 17 month old almost every day (very small dose), and it seems to keep her immune system strong. She thinks it is tasty and has had this and cod liver oil (orange/lemonade flavored) just about every day. She does not seem to get very sick, very often, though we do stay at home a lot. However, one week, we ran out of elderberry syrup, and she played at the mall one day and the library the next (they have a germ-filler toy kitchen haha) and of course, she came down with something the next day. As soon as I bought more elderberry syrup and gave it to her, she was almost instantly better (she was probably still fighting off the bug, but she felt and acted better).This is my holy grail!

column8: Trying our best to boost his immune system
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
column12: I can't quite speak to the efficacy of this yet since we started to give it to my toddler everyday as a preventative about two weeks ago. He has RAD (toddler asthma) and his trigger is a cold. Trying our best to boost his immune system. I did a lot of research on elderberry and this is the only brand I feel comfortable giving. It really is only elderberry and honey. Other brands include echinachea and while I am sure it works, I just don't want to give those mixtures to a toddler. He takes it in his morning almond milk like a champ so only time will tell if it works but from these reviews and others across the web, I am pretty confident and excited about it.

column4: Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops blend organic ingredients in an herbal sleep aid that help quiet the mind to support restful sleep. BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Drops are made with organic Valerian, Skullcap, Hops, Passion Flower, California Poppy and Chamomile for optimal wellness support. These liquid valerian drops are available in a compact vial and do not need to be refrigerated, making them ideal for those with active, on-the-go lifestyles. The BareOrganics Liquid Drops are developed without harsh chemicals or ingredients, and are proudly USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Kosher and Gluten & Alcohol-Free. This herbal supplement comes in a 1 ounce recyclable dropper bottle. The drops should be shaken before each use.

column12: Ive been on theses for a week. I was reluctant to use them. But my daughter who is in school for natural health. Explained the long term use bad effects of benadryl and melatonin.  And Ive been using benadryl for 2 plus years. I dont have a hard time going to sleep. My problem is staying asleep. And falling back to sleep once I wake up in the middle of the night. Well, i finally gave in and tried it. My daughter told me to give it a few weeks to build up in my system so it will help me sleep. Im sleeping! Im also not happy at the sudden jump in the cost. =( Hopefully thats to help fix their sticky capsule.  ....20 mins later, the capsule is still in my throat as im writing this. Maybe break open the capsule a pour it in a hot tea? 🤔

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column3: HawaiiPharm California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Certified Organic Liquid Extract 2x2 oz
column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.
column5: California Poppy tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality California Poppy liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! Really the BEST California Poppy extract on market!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020
column12: I'm still using my first bottle of Schisandra Berry so I can't say it's making a huge difference yet, but I have a chronic illness so it will take some time and most assuredly more than one bottle. However, I'm very pleased with the integrity of the product, namely being alcohol-free, gluten-free, and preservative-free. Alcohol in a tincture cancels out any benefit you would get from the supplement, so being alcohol-free is VERY important to me because I know I'm not wasting my money. I have a non-celiac gluten intolerance, which means I have, among other things, a compromised digestive system, so being gluten-free and preservative-free means I can rest assured that taking this product will not make me sick. I have had to get used to the taste as it is a little strong, but adding it to some water per the instructions helps. After taking the extract consistently for a little over a week, I'm now used to the taste and have no issue with it. Overall I believe this is a great product and have just recently purchased my second bottle so I don't run out.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
column12: I don’t write a lot of reviews, but if this product can help someone like it helped me, that would be great! A long story short, I have been struggling with menopause, I’m sure a lot of other people are having a really hard time with it like I was, but none of my friends had it that bad. I was having a hot flash every 20 min. All day long. When I wasn’t having a hot flash, I was sweating even when it was cold out! I also was going through major depression, even though I never struggled with depression before! I lost my job because I was so depressed I didn’t get out of bed, I was so sweaty and miserable.. this is terrible to say, but there were days where I thought it would be easier to die! I never ever knew menopause could be so horrible. I looked up stuff everyday that might give me some relief.. I’m not sure if we can mention other products, but I got Menoease, which helped a lot with the hot flashes.. it took about 3 weeks to notice a difference. While looking things up everyday, I read that Schisandra can help with your mood, fatigue and hot flashes.. So I ordered my first bottle and took some as soon as it came.. within 3 days, I felt like a brand new person.. I’m not sure if it’s also helping with the hot flashes since I’m still taking Menoease.. but it is 100 percent helping with the depression and fatigue. I get out of bed every morning now, my mood is Good and I have energy!!! I’m on my second bottle of this Schisandra and I will make sure I never run out! I know every product doesn’t effect everyone the same! But, if you are depressed and always tired.. I would honestly give it a try! I noticed a little difference in just one day.. but in about 3 days I noticed a huge difference! I put two half droppers full in about 2 oz of orange juice every morning!! Hope this helps, no one should have to struggle with menopause or depression!!

column2: Rainbow Light - Complete B-Complex, 90 Count, Food Based, Energy Support
column3: Rainbow Light - Complete B-Complex, 90 Count, Food Based, Energy Support
column4: Rainbow Light's Complete B-Complex' formula delivers a complete, high-potency B-complex plus added support for overall vitality and a healthy nervous system, with: Nervous System Support - from minerals such as calcium, magnesium and potassium, plus amino acids - all of which play important roles in supporting energy production and healthy nervous system function. Absorption Enhancing Co-Nutrients - such as zinc, manganese and 500 mg of vitamin C with bioflavonoids. Energizing Foods and Herbs - to calm and soothe (California poppy, orange essential oil), while supporting energy (gotu kola, American ginseng, ashwagandha), immunity (bee pollen) and overall vitality (spirulina, barley grass). This formula is designed for optimal assimilation and utilization.
column5: FOOD BASED FORMULA: With its Herbal Vitality Blend of gotu kola, American ginseng, California poppy, ashwagandha, and orange, the formula promotes overall vitality and vibrancy | NERVOUS SYSTEM SUPPORT: The formula's B vitamins, choline, calcium, magnesium, L-Theanine, and California poppy, work to nourish and support a calm, healthy nervous system | GENTLE & SAFE ENERGY: Delivers key nutritional support for chronic stress, depleted energy, and fatigued adrenal glands | SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING: 100% Post-Consumer recycled and recyclable bottles that are BPA-free, we take a stand for more ocean, less plastic | PURITY SAFEGUARD: Stimulant and Dairy Free made with natural, purity tested ingredients and NO artificial preservatives, colors, flavors or sweeteners | During the summer months products may arrive warm but Amazon stores and ships products in accordance with manufacturers' recommendations, when provided.
column8: Super effective.  The only B-complex I’m comfortable recommending, to date.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2017
column12: The best B-complex supplement I have found yet, in over 20 adult years taking b-complex supplements.  It smells bad and doesn’t taste good in just the right way, to indicate that it’s got the right vitamins and they are digestible.The only other concentrated B-complex vitamin source that comes close, is nutritional yeast... and some folks can’t handle the taste of that.This is currently the only b-complex vitamin I recommend.  I’m sure there are other good ones out there, but I’m no longer looking, ever since I found this one a few years ago.

column8: I was really hoping this would work for me.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
column12: I will start by saying that i think this is a quality product, very much so, that's why i purchased it. Unfortunately i cannot take this product. It bothers my stomach something awful, i mean pains and everything, to the point where i have to be still and/or lay down until the pain passes. This did not happen when i first started taking this product but after some months my body has built up an intolerance to it.I liked it because it was plant based and was a nice variety of B's but i have tried it with food and without.  I will have to go back to Douglas Laboratories® - B-Complex w/ Metafolin because that did not bother me in any way with or without food.  The ONLY reason i switched to this kind is that the other is 25$ and this product is several dollars less. I am very happy to switch back to the other brand i was using, which was prescribed by my acupuncturist.I do not like to give bad reviews and while i think this is a good product there is something in this that i just cannot tolerate, perhaps it's because it's missing the 'intrinsic factor' which i found to be lacking in, which helps my gut/body assimilate the b-vitamins.If you don't have a sensitive stomach and generally don't have a problem tolerating B vitamins go for it, but if you do try looking for a B vitamin that has intrinsic factor in it. Ofcourse do your research, it might help you as it has helped me.

column2: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 4x4 oz
column3: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 4x4 oz
column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August.The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

Really the BEST California Poppy and Saint John's Wort extract on market!

column2: Gaia Herbs Black Elderberry - Daily Immune Support Supplement to Help Maintain Well-Being - with Black Elderberries and Acerola Fruit for Antioxidant Support - 60 Vegan Capsules (30-Day Supply)
column3: Gaia Herbs Black Elderberry - Daily Immune Support Supplement to Help Maintain Well-Being - with Black Elderberries and Acerola Fruit for Antioxidant Support - 60 Vegan Capsules (30-Day Supply)
column4:
Primarily found in Europe and North America, black elderberries have long been used in traditional cultures to support immune function. Elderberry has an extensive history of being used during seasonal immune challenges. Regarded as an “Elder” plant in Native American herbalism, elderberry has been used collectively by many tribes as a tonic medicine and food to promote health and vitality.
Black Elderberry (Sambucus Nigra) is unique in providing both antioxidant and immune support due to its natural concentration of anthocyanins and other flavonoids. This Black Elderberry (Sambucus Nigra) product contains no sweeteners or fillers, and is just as concentrated as our best-selling syrup in the convenience of a capsule for immune system support on the go.
From seed to shelf, Gaia is deeply committed to the purity, integrity, and potency of each product. Since Gaia Herbs was just a seedling in 1987, we have focused on connecting people, plants, and the planet to create healing. We use only organic methods to cultivate more than 6.5 million plants each year. That same organic approach continues throughout our manufacturing. We use patented technology to achieve the highest efficacy of each herb.
We are a company devoted to transparency. We have created Gaia’s MeetYourHerbs platform, one of the world’s first and only herb traceability programs, allowing consumers to learn about and engage with their organic herbs. We are able to source premium ingredients so you always know what's in your supplement. 
As a Certified B Corporation, we are actively working toward building a more inclusive and sustainable world. We nurture healthy connections between plants and people by encouraging strong relationships and championing environmental sustainability within the communities that we work with around the world.

column2: Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better Organic Supplement, 90 Count
column3: Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better Organic Supplement, 90 Count
column4:
Enjoy a more restful night's sleep with Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better™ capsules. Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better™ capsules combine a powerful 300 mg of verified Non-GMO, Organic Skullcap tops, 250 mg Organic Valerian Root, 100 mg Organic Ashwagandha root, 100 mg Organic Passionflower tops, and 50 mg Organic Hops strobiles (per 2 capsules), to create a powerful, non-habit-forming herbal sleep aid that promotes tranquility, aids in relaxation, and supports a restful night's sleep. 
 Manufactured in Redmond, OR, Oregon's Wild Harvest was proudly founded in 1994 by a registered surgical nurse and farmer with a desire to create natural herbal supplements that give back to the earth through healthy soil, clean water, and the saving of our Non-GMO seeds. 
 Contained in natural bovine gelatin capsules and free of artificial flavors, colors, excipients, or stearates, Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better™ capsules are also gluten-free and dairy-free, contain no wheat, peanuts, soy, or corn allergens, and have been product verified Non-GMO by SGS, an independent third-party lab. As an herbal supplement, take 2 Sleep Better™ capsules one half-hour before bedtime, or as directed by your health care professional.
column5: Promotes healthy, restful sleep | No morning drowsiness | 100% Vegetarian | During the summer months products may arrive warm but Amazon stores and ships products in accordance with manufacturers' recommendations, when provided.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
column12: I was really wanting to like this sleep supplement since it’s organic and Family-owned & operated, but the three times I’ve tried it, I was up until 4am with 2 capsules, and 3am with 1 capsule. I tried it on separate days spread out, in case there was something else going on that could have caused this, but the last time I tried it, I took just one capsule, and it still kept me wide awake until 3am. So it’s definitely a surprising reaction. I’ve taken sleep supplements before, but this is the first I’ve tried that has Ashwaganda in it, which I usually take in vitality and energy supplements. But who knows which ingredient is the culprit for me. All I can say for certain is this does not work for everyone, and I was shocked how tired I felt all night, but my mind would not just sleep, which is so much worse than if I wouldn’t have taken this. I just like taking a sleep supplement to help me fall asleep faster, but I don’t have severe sleep issues. I don’t want to rate this product lower than 3 stars, because it does seem to be good quality ingredients, it just didn’t work for me.

column12: Homeopathic remedies are not regulated and you never really know then what's in them just a caveat for the following.I have used benadryl and THC/CBD products for sleep. Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better™ capsules combine a powerful 300 mg of verified Non-GMO, Organic Skullcap tops, 250 mg Organic Valerian Root, 100 mg Organic Ashwagandha root, 100 mg Organic Passionflower tops, and 50 mg Organic Hops strobiles (per 2 capsules), to create a powerful, non-habit-forming herbal sleep aid that promotes tranquility, aids in relaxation, and supports a restful night's sleep. 
 Manufactured in Redmond, OR, Oregon's Wild Harvest was proudly founded in 1994 by a registered surgical nurse and farmer with a desire to create natural herbal supplements that give back to the earth through healthy soil, clean water, and the saving of our Non-GMO seeds. 
 Contained in natural bovine gelatin capsules and free of artificial flavors, colors, excipients, or stearates, Oregon's Wild Harvest Sleep Better™ capsules are also gluten-free and dairy-free, contain no wheat, peanuts, soy, or corn allergens, and have been product verified Non-GMO by SGS, an independent third-party lab. As an herbal supplement, take 2 Sleep Better™ capsules one half-hour before bedtime, or as directed by your health care professional.
column5: Promotes healthy, restful sleep | No morning drowsiness | 100% Vegetarian | During the summer months products may arrive warm but Amazon stores and ships products in accordance with manufacturers' recommendations, when provided.

column4: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

column8: I was a skeptic, but this really works!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2018
column12: I get seasonal ragweed allergies, BAD! Every year starting in August until the first hard freeze my symptoms are horrible here in Northeast Wisconsin. Itchy & watery eyes, itchy throat & roof of my mouth, sneezing constantly, stuffed up and running nose, congestion.I never had allergies as a kid, but in my late teens to early 20’s I started getting them really bad. I took all of the over the counter meds, Zyrtec, Claritin, you name it. Those products worked, but had side effects. The OTC meds dried out my mouth and sinuses so bad. I would get nosebleeds, be super drowsy or tired. And I have read other bad things about anti-histamines that they can cause dementia after taking them over many years.My father-in-law is a big believer in natural products so he recommended Allerplex to me in combination with Fermented Cod Liver Oil by Blue Ice.I am a skeptical person and thought there was no way something like this could work. I was so wrong. I have read many reviews of this product and some are correct when they say it takes some time to start working. I believe it has to build up in your system to start making a difference. So don’t take two pills and say it doesn’t work. The dosage I read works best is 6-12 daily.I started my regimen August 1st. In Wisconsin this is before ragweed pollen was peaking. I would take 3 Allerplex pills with breakfast and 2 Fermented Cod Liver oil pills by Blue Ice I would repeat that dosage for lunch for the first 2 weeks.I had zero allergy symptoms. Then the ragweed peaked around August 16th with a very high count for a few days. I had slightly itchy eyes in the morning with a sneeze here or there. But nothing major. Had to blow my nose a little more than usual for a few days. So I started taking 3 pills for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and then with a snack in the evening for a few days.My symptoms are gone again. It’s August 21st now, and for the last 3 days, not one sneeze. No itchy eyes, stuffy nose, etc.  Nothing!So I lowered my frequency again only taking 3 Allerplex in the morning and 2 fermented cod liver oil for the last 3-4 days. Still no symptoms.I monitor the pollen count daily. And it is very high for ragweed.I saw my neighbor outside when I got home from work today and she was sneezing. I asked her if it was allergies. She said they were horrible for her right now. And my symptoms are gone! Naturally I had to tell her about Allerplex! So amazing! Standard Process has really changed my life in such a wonderful way. I tell my wife that I have to tell the whole world about this product!Just remember, let this product work through your body for a couple weeks. It may not work overnight. But it has been a game changer for me. I will never by an OTC allergy pill for the rest of my life. No side effects whatsoever! How could you go wrong?One last statistic I read about Allerplex in conjunction with fermented cod liver oil is that this combination works for 95% of people. As bad as my allergies were before Allerplex and as good as I feel now, I truly believe it. Allerplex 6-12 daily, Fermented Cod Liver Oil 3-6 daily. Everyone is different so monitor your body cuz no one knows it better than you. If no symptoms take less. If symptoms are bad take a bit more.

column8: LIFE CHANGING PRODUCT. NO MORE SUFFERING!!!!!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2014
column12: This product is a LIFE CHANGER!  I've had allergies my entire life. The past few years they have been so bad that I was in constant pain most of the year. No allergy medicine helped. I had intense pain behind my eyes, severe congestion that lead to daily migraines and jaw/teeth pain.  I went to a chiropractor a few months ago for a non-related issue and discussed my migraines and sever allergies to him. Much to my surprise he was able to literally cure my sinus/allergy issues simply by suggesting I start taking Allerplex.  The bottle says to take 3 per meal. He said I should just take 1 per meal (3x day). Immediately I started seeing and feeling results. I'm now down to ONE Allerplex a day and the chiropractor said I can probably eventually come off them for good because my system should stabilize and not over-react to allergens or even insect bites as drastically as it was.  Even more proof that this supplement works wonders - I got bit on my toe by a fire ant last week - in the past my entire foot would swell up so badly that I couldn't even get a shoe on. Now that I've been using Allerplex, the bit swelled up, but nothing more than like a mosquito bite. It did sting and was irritating for a few days, but, in comparison to how I used to react to one bite, that was minimal!!!!!!!  I can now mow my entire yard and there is no more suffering afterwards. I used to be so allergic to grass, dust, pollen that any time in my yard - especially mowing - would have me sick in bed the entire next day.  As I said, Allerplex is truly a life changer. I cannot thank my chiropractor enough for his recommendation of this product! Seriously, if you have any allergy issues, BUY THIS PRODUCT!  You will be so glad you did!

column12: I just came to amazon to buy my second bottle of Alleplex and I thought I might as well leave my two cents on the product too.  I always read reviews before purchasing on Amazon so I thought this might help someone who isn't convinced.  I purchased Congaplex a few years ago when a friend told me to use it for sinus issues...works like a charm when I feel a cold coming on.  I have always had sinus issues and then allergies to pollen/dust etc developed in my late 20's.  My 70 year old father has undergone 3 sinus surgery's in his lifetime (in fact I should buy him a bottle too!).  The reason for the background is that I feel i'm quite experienced when it comes to otc and prescription sinus medication, allergy meds, nasal irrigation, z packs, etc.So about a year ago I bought another bottle of congaplex and on a whim I read the reviews for Allerplex and bought a bottle.  It sat in my cupboard for the past year...I continued on my zyrtec and nasal sprays thinking this stuff really can't battle these springtime allergies.  About 8 weeks ago my nasal congestion was horrible...and I knew the instant my medication wore out...I couldn't breathe...so I got back on the nasal sprays...again I knew exactly when they wore out too.  Finally, I thought what the heck let's try the allerplex.  It really is amazing! no more nasal congestion!!! Funny I usually sneeze about 4 times around 10:30 in the morning and i'm fine the rest of the day. Plus I just read another review before writing this and they described their chronic watery eyes...I've always had that issue...EVERY spring...and completely forgot about it because I've had maybe one morning with watery eyes!  There are no side effects whatsoever.  I take 2 or 3 in the morning and 2 or 3 before bed.  If you have allergies give it a try...if it doesn't work you're out $30 but if it does...you'll be back for more, like me!

column12: I have bad allergies all the time due to immune system issues. The standard pharmacy meds or allergy shots don’t work for me. column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2013
column12: I've used this product for about 10 years to help with allergies that I've had my whole life. I did not want to go the "shot route" for expense and personal reasons and I could not be happier. At the recommendation of my chiropractor, I began using this product to assist in controlling my allergies. It works wonderfully and I feel confident in using it not only for the results but for the fact that it is natural and will not ruin my body like a chemical shot may/may not (don't want to get into politics here). Over the years, I have been able to lessen the doses I have to take and where I used to take many before/during/after mowing the lawn, playing baseball, or petting a cat, now I only have to take a few, if any, to control my symptoms. I don't believe I am growing out of my allergies, but I do believe that this product has helped my body to build up tolerances to the things that agitate my allergies (ragweed, hay, grass, pets, etc.). I now live comfortably with both a dog and cat and enjoy the outdoors when the weather is nice. I keep the Allerplex on hand just in case and have rarely had to use it this season. I find that a larger amount is needed in the begging of the season to help my body acclimate to the change in polen levels, but once that is over, I am usually good to go. Buy this product, it truly works.

column12: Might be a placebo, might be real. But my son and I have less allergy attacks than when not taking this supplement. No adverse effects. Just noticeable when we don't take this supplement after a few days (allergies come back: nasal dripping, itchy eyes, scratchy throat, dry cough). It takes about two weeks to notice the difference, but well worth the wait. I have severe allergies to pollen, grass, certain trees (basically the outdoors). And I finally am able to participate in outdoor activities with my kids thanks to this supplement. It's better than allergy meds because there are no apparent adverse effects. I like it! My son truly appreciates it too. He reminds me to re-order when we are almost out. Retailer, maybe you could add this supplement to the subscribe Amazon section???Be patient with this product. It's NOT Zyrtec or clartin. It takes a minimum or two weeks before we noticed a difference. Pricey, but expected with effective nutrition supplements. Ships quickly, well packaged with bubble wrap protection (thank you, I like that the item is intact upon delivery).I love Standard Process as a company. column12: I love Allerplex!I have 2 dogs, an 8 yr old Cocker Spaniel (Beau), and a 3 yr old Black Mouth Cur (Tank).The Cocker has suffered from severe food allergies since he was born.  Nasty- chronic- yeast- bacteria - ridden ear infections. Tank suffers from seasonal allergies and is allergic to Oak pollen.  He gets bloody raw all over his body and incessant scratching drives the entire family crazy.  After some extensive research I happen to find Allerplex.  Let me tell you that this supplement has done wonders for BOTH of my dogs.  It has helped Beau with his food allergies - no more yucky ears and his skin is cleared up - no more scabs and scratching.  Tank is doing exceptionally better with his seasonal allergies too.  If I stop giving this to my dogs they both go right back to the breakouts and miserable scratching.  I have spent hundreds of $ on Vets for Beaus allergies - ear cleaners - special food etc...  and nothing ever worked.  I was giving Tank & Beau both Benadryl with minimal results.  They were both frequently miserable.  Not anymore!Allerplex is going to be a staple in my house.  I 100% recommend this product!LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!  Not only does it work - but its affordable as well.Finally Something that works!

column12: Allerplex is composed of natural ingredients, which is why I purchased it.I have just begun taking it as Juniper pollen is already in the air due to earlywarm temps. column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2011
column12: As a practicing herbalist for many years (for personal use, not as a professional) and an advocate holistic practices I've found that Gaia herbs has always had quality products and I was happy to find this one available here on Subscribe and Save.  My family has been taking both formulas of the Black Elderberry syrup (the standard version and the Nighttime) as a supplements throughout the cold and flu season with excellent results.It's concentrated. You take one teaspoonful once a day, twice only if needed. I've found that it's not overly sedative which is a plus.  It has something of a mild relaxing effect keeping in mind that your mileage may vary.  The potency of the formula is focused in the immunity support that the Black Elderberries provide. It's manufactured in Italy where it's a traditional medicine with these additional organic ingredients:  Acerola, California Poppy, Lemon Balm, Grindelia, Sugar Cane (4g of sugar per serving), water, and Lemon Juice. I've come to really like this product and will be sure to keep a bottle of each formula on hand all year round, so I recommend it highly.

column12: My children were hit with a serious cold/flu thanks to flu vaccinated grandparents "shedding". I know this was the source because I homeschool and my children don't go to daycare. My parents went to the doctor to get antibiotics but my children were given Black Elderberry Syrup, Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup, vitamins, tea (lemon, honey and a little salt) and a small spoonful of diced garlic and honey. My children recovered within two weeks (that's how nasty the bug was) my parents were sick for nearly a month with the cough lingering even longer.I used this product sparingly at night to give relief from the nasty cough and put an oil diffuser in their room to help with nasal congestion.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
column12: We are all adults here (or should be) so let me tell you about my experience.I have had a fatty liver for years, verified everytime I get a CT Scan on my kidneys because of kidney stones (if you are unfamiliar with them, God Bless because they are the absolute worst pain, imagine sticking an umbrella in your Johnson and opening it)the doctor freaks out when I get blood work done because of my triglycerides because they are 239 (down from 2200 after I got out of the military) and tells me that I need to bring them down to under 150 (come on man! They used to be over 2200!).One of the signs of a fatty liver is floating yellow poo (now you know) which I had for years.I was researching natural cures for a fatty liver and ran across Bergamot, ordered a bottle and what a difference! (even though I am taking only 2 of the 3 tablets it recommends) No more floaters and back to a brown color.I had tried taking Milk Thistle extract but would get cramps from it and it didn't do away with the floaters, Citrus Bergamot did and I could see the difference in just a few weeks.I have labs again in a few weeks and will find out if it is lowering the triglycerides.

column8: Doesn't MAKE me sleep but helps me sleep and dream...
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
column12: I have joint pain and take a prescription medication that interferes with brain waves and sleep. Plus, I do part-time shift work which requires EARLY mornings. It was getting to the point that I could only sleep 4 hours at a time, plus still wake up in pain to drag around exhausted continuously no matter what I tried. I only take a capsule if I'm not working the next morning lest I oversleep. The capsules don't drug me to sleep but do let me relax and drift off. Also, I am aware that I dream more and get better quality sleep. I wake up feeling refreshed and able to accomplish the day's goals. I didn't get an okay from my doctor before trying these, but used myself as a guinea pig. I am not one bit sorry about that though I'm not advocating everyone do the same. Still, these seem gentle in their effect. I am happy I found them (did so because I'm a tea lover and saw this ingredient in multiple sleep teas). I intend to keep using them-- it's like multiple cups of sleep tea without all the liquid so I don't have to make bathroom trips in the middle of the night! LOL

Deep Sleep addresses this some but by itself is not effective for me in that I wake up early still but maybe an hour later than I have (after I have become tolerant to other prescription meds I have been trying.)  If you try it, know that the first couple nights will be very strange, with crazy dreams - this is the best I can describe it. But at least this is not an additive medication. I have since added back the other prescriptions meds one by one and Deep Sleep does seem to potentiate their effect. I have reordered another value-size four ounce bottle from Amazon. It is not the alcohol-free version but that does not bother me and Herbs Etc tells me that the amount of alcohol in the whole bottle does not equal a half glass of wine, if I remember correctly. You might want to check with them directly to be sure, if that is an issue for you.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2014
column12: I've written a positve review before on the soft gels, so I thought I'd give the liquid a try, as I also thought it might be more cost effective.NEVER AGAIN !While it has the same potency as the gels, it has the most god-awful taste, akin to licking the inside of tarnished spoon...which I did as a kid and remember vividly.The stopper didn't work well either, not completely filling to the maximum, but only about half-way. I took two of these droppers half-full and slept soundly. Doing so seems to use a greater amount than in the gels, obviously, to achieve the same effect of three gels.Once I'm finished with this review, and even though I have an almost full 4oz bottle left, I'm ordering the gels again. Less mess, no aftertaste, no burping it up to haunt you three hours later, and a better value.PLEEEASE, Herbs Etc., at least add a little pina colada taste to it to make it more palatable.

column12: Previously, I had been using the Sugar Free Mushroom Gummies/Gushrooms and the Tinies bears Gummies. Both of those tasted great without being too sweet (the Gushrooms were a nice strawberry flavor, while the Tinies bears were blueberry).But I noticed that the Tinies bears Gummies were a little bit chewier than the Gushrooms. The Gushrooms were on the softer side of a gummy: softer than a Haribo gummy bear, but not quite as soft as an Alban gummy bear.These gummies by Drops of Nature are great, too. There is a mix of different flavors to pick from in the pouch, and they all taste great.I would have continued getting the Gushrooms, but you seem to get more gummies in the pouch by Drops of Nature than with the Gushrooms. In the end, the price and value was the winning factor for me.

column12: Alright, so I gotta spill the beans on these Ashwagandha & Lion's Mane Supplement Gummies—spoiler alert: they're pretty darn interesting!First off, let's talk benefits. Now, I'm no scientist, but I swear these little guys did something good for my brain. My focus felt sharper, especially on those crazy busy days when my to-do list was longer than a CVS receipt. Lion's Mane is supposed to be the brain's best friend, and coupled with the chill vibes from Ashwagandha, it's like a match made in gummy heaven.But wait, there's more! They're not just for the brainiacs out there. Some days, I swear they helped with my memory, giving me that extra edge when I needed to remember where I left my keys or the name of that movie from the '90s.And let's not forget about sleep quality. These gummies didn't exactly knock me out like a horse tranquilizer, but I did notice I slept a bit more soundly on the nights I took them. Maybe it's the Reishi mushroom doing its thing—I don't know, but I'll take it!Oh, and mood? Yeah, they get a gold star for that too. I felt like I had a little pep in my step, even on those gloomy Mondays when the coffee just wasn't cutting it.Now, let's address the elephant in the room—smell. Okay, I won't lie, when you first open the bottle, there's a bit of a funky mushroom smell. But don't let that scare you off! Once you pop one in your mouth, it's all sweet, fruity goodness.And did I mention they're gummies? Yeah, you heard that right. No pills to swallow here—just delicious, chewy goodness. Plus, they're low carb, so you can indulge without feeling guilty about it.Now, don't get me wrong, these gummies aren't some magic cure-all. Some days, I felt like Wonder Woman after taking them, and other days, not so much. But hey, they're just one piece of the puzzle when it comes to feeling your best.When I started to take these it gave me a minor headache (could be possible side effects).Overall, if you're looking for a fun and tasty way to give your brain, memory, sleep quality, mood, and energy a little boost, these gummies might just be worth a shot!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
column12: I take B vitamins,  D3 and probiotic every day and have for a while to try and stay healthy and have energy. I think they help minimally but nothing super noticeable. I have tried those greens powders and could not notice any difference. I will try to post an update as I have only been taking for a few days but I can honestly say I think this is a game changer for me. I noticed a difference ever since the first day. As many others have stated I found I can only take 1 of these and it needs to be very early in the morning like by 7:30/8am. The first day I took it at 10:30am and then forgot I took it. Later in the afternoon I noticed I was not feeling sluggish at all and actually the opposite then it dawned on me I had take this supplement. I was not able to sleep well that night just wide awake and mind buzzing. I took it early in the morning the next 2 days and sleep was better. I am going to take a break from it over the weekend and see if I feel any different. Also I will add that I am neurodivergent (I don't take medication for this) and I honestly feel like it helping me be more focused and actually able to complete tasks instead of having decision fatigue. I have been very productive the last few days and very good mood. I do get seasonal depression and the daylight is quickly fading here plus it has been overcast and rainy for several days now so normally I would be very lazy and no energy but that has not been the case since taking this supplement. So far I am incredibly impressed. I have always thought I had some hormonal imbalances or something making me have lower energy and the past year I have put on weight that's been very difficult to lose (once I hit 30 it really hit). I am really hoping that continuing this supplement will help keep me more active and being able to complete more projects and tasks which I normally struggle with. I'm also hoping with the increased energy it will help me lose the weight I have gained over the last year. I'll try to post an update in a few weeks but I definitely recommend giving this a try, so far I really like it! I think I actually could use a lower dose. I am curious to see long term if its something your body gets used to and you need more to be as effective or not.

column8: Helped improve my stamina and reduce fatigue.  Pretty cool, subtle results
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2018
column12: I have used this product for about two weeks with subtle but good results. I take one capsule in the morning and on a few occasions I took a second capsule in the evening.  I have not tried two capsules at once and I’ll explain why further down.  For an understanding of my physiology and health, I eat very healthy (close to a paleo diet with a few changes) and I’m very active.  I take creatine and not on any health medication.  I also work and in school.This supplement has a subtle effect on me.  This does not have a strong or immediately noticeable result once taken.  However, I did notice an increase in stamina and less fatigue when I was doing fast, high incline, hiking (I would say results felt similar to creatine but much less effective).  I also felt it helped me feel less fatigued on a few days when I was getting less than my normal amount of sleep.  I would like to try this stuff on a night shift rotation but I haven’t had the chance yet.It is important to remember everyone’s physiology is different and other factors like diet and health will impact how a supplement will work for different people.  Not everyone is going to get the same result and that is not necessarily the fault of the product (or the person).  For me, I noticed a mild improvement in the stamina and reduced fatigue, but I didn’t notice until taking it for a few days.  I’m not sure if you need to build this up in the system for a few days for effectiveness but I’m trying to test that now and will update later if I have anything to add.I would caution that if you have a weak or sensitive stomach you should be cautious with Rhodiola Rosea Extract.  It doesn’t have a pleasant taste and even though it is in capsule form, it caused a little stomach gas for me on a few occasions and I could smell / taste it which is not pleasant. For this reason I never wanted to take more than one pill at a time.  I didn’t have this experience every time, but it happened at least half the time, on an empty stomach or with a meal.  Having said that, it is not terrible either and I would argue if you are burning the candle at both ends, this may be effective in helping you balance out.  I don’t feel I need this daily but would use building up for finals or as needed.Also, I did not notice cognitive benefits while taking this and studying.

column8: High-salidroside Rhodiola rosea inhibits bladder cancer and more?
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2022
column12: According to one study, high-salidroside Rhodiola rosea inhibits bladder cancer as well as others: "Rhodiola rosea L.: an herb with anti-stress, anti-aging, and immunostimulating properties for cancer chemoprevention".As well as a lot of other stuff, "Anti-Inflammatory and Neuroprotective Effects of Constituents Isolated from Rhodiola rosea", and "Salidroside promotes peripheral nerve regeneration based on tissue engineering strategy using Schwann cells and PLGA: in vitro and in vivo".It's important to know what you're getting because R. rosea can vary in content between rosavins and salidroside wildly, with Chinese R. crenulata having only rosavins, yet these also have their positives despite an early estrogenic effect: "Rhodiola crenulata induces an early estrogenic response and reduces proliferation and tumorsphere formation over time in MCF7 breast cancer cells".Doublewood's formula tells you exactly what you're getting, and it works for me because it's anti-fatigue for someone with fibro--not as a "stimulant"--it's anti-cancer, and it generates nerve growth in the memory-and-learning hippocampus.With all adaptogens, you should take them for a month to get the full effect, particularly with increases in memory.  However, as a serotonin promoter, R. rosea shouldn't be taken with SSRIs, 5-htp, or L-theanine, because excessive serotonin can cause "serotonin syndrome", the effects of which are the opposite of what you want out of it, such as insomnia.  It also lowers blood pressure, a positive for some but not all, and slightly increases heart rate; however, huperzine A (a promoter of acetylcholine) does the opposite.  I take a small amount of it along with Rhodiola once a day.Am I happy with Double Wood's creation?  Love it!

column12: I'm used to spending almost $55 on the same supplement.  The cost so much affordable for the same product.  I've used this brand before with ashwagandha and Irish Sea Moss. Will continue to buy!!!!

column12: My doctor suggested this sleep aide to me because I am in the throws of menopause and I was waking up every night, sometimes several times, and I would feel very unrestful and would toss and turn to go back to sleep.  I just was not getting a full, rested night of sleep.  I'm huge on using natural products like the essential oils in this product  (for example, I don't use hormone treatment -- I take maca supplements).  So I researched this stuff and decided to go for it.  I started with 1 pill and it helped.  My magic number is now 2.  I like that I don't feel groggy, I feel rested.  I have occasionally woken up but I fall right back to sleep -- I'm not tossing and turning every night.  So happy that my doctor suggested this to me.

column12: This product is an intelligent combination of melatonin, l-theanine and 6 herbs. All of the herbal ingredients act in a similar way to benzodiazepines (influencing GABA). You wake in the morning feeling refreshed without any Rx "hangover". I highly recommend Sleep Aide.

column12: This is a really potent tincture. I was doubtful that it would be, until I could barely get up the next morning. I recommend starting with a small amount.Does make me very sleepy, but it seems to give me a headache. Not sure if it’s causing it yet though. Everybodies body chemistry is different though. So if you’re looking for help sleeping I’d say this is definitely worth a try. I’d recommend taking it early in the evening not right at bedtime because the effects last a good while and could make it hard to wake up. Gives me a hangover if I take a full squeeze of the dropper, kind of slow and spacey feeling. Potent!

column8: Excellent brand and product – and a warning
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
column12: First – "Wild & Organic" is an excellent brand and my review is in no way about the company or their products (which is why I still gave 5 stars.)Second – a friendly warning – natural herbal remedies can be very powerful. Just one drop of this passionflower tincture, and I experienced severe headache, nausea, red face, sweating and stomach upset.However this is me... everyone is different. My advice with any herbal remedy would be "start low and slow" – try one drop the first dose and see what happens.Absolutely nothing wrong with this product. I'm only sharing my reaction because most people don't realize how powerful natural herbal remedies can be.
