column12: I buy this every month now, it works better than my prescribed Narcolepsy meds, ,I've been on quite a fw, including ritalin. While the ritaalin worked for about a week, now on month 2 it does nothing anymore, but I supplement with 1 or 2 of these, depending on how tired I am that day, and it works great. even with all my other meds, I needed this too. I could probably use just this, but it's a bit expensive since insurance doesn't cover it and I take it 4x/day every day. It's been 3 months and still works as well as the first day.So better, for me, than ritalin, sunosi, modafinil, a few others and better than drinking Sugar free Monster all day.  NOTHING has worked as well as these.WARNING:  IF YOU'RE NOT USED TO STIMULANTS, TAKE CAREFULLY, START WITH ONE.  You may feel a warm flush in your face and your entire body may get warm when this starts to work, but it goes away soon.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2022
column12: These energy pills get the job done but keep in mind they are VERY STRONG. The first day I took one, it was too much. I basically felt like a tweaker which is to say I did not feel good. However, you DO get used to them & by the 2nd day I tried again & they kept me going for the last few months when I was working 55-60hr weeks. Working that many hours, as anyone who has done so will attest can really mess with your body. You start to feel like you are being dragged down slowly no matter how much sleep you get. Now that things have slowed down, I am no longer using these but they will remain in my medicine cabinet just in case the day comes when I need an extra boost!

column8: Nice Lucid Dreams - Deeper Sleep - And Fall Asleep Faster!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
column12: The ingredient blend in this sleep aid is pretty unique as few have 100mg of California Poppy Extract. This also has the very relaxing Lemon Balm at 100mg and the reliable Chamomile Flower Powder at 50mg. Melatonin is only 2mg and Valerian 500mg. L-Tryptophan comes in at 500mg and GABA at 500mg.You take two capsules before bed with a glass of water.My experience was that this blend helped me go to sleep faster - I lay down and was out for the count. I slept deeper and woke up a little dreamy. I did have some unique lucid dreams which were very interesting.I'll take these anytime I need to have reliable sleep patterns and want to enjoy a few beautiful vivid dreams.As someone who takes a lot of different sleep pills to get a good night's rest I think these are some of the best I've tried.~The Rebecca Review

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2022
column12: The product description states that these are gluten-free, dairy-free, and non-GMO. It's also apparently free of any ingredients that work.I'd gladly take whatever animal products they left out, a glass of milk, and genetic modifications that'd do Mendel proud if this product actually worked as advertised. At the suggested dosage, it did absolutely nothing to help me fall asleep, or stay asleep. Mind you, this was also after watching my intake of sugar, caffeine, and chocolate during the day, staying off my phone before bed (blue light wreaks havoc on sleep cycles), and making sure the TV was off, so it's not like it can be blamed on factors having nothing to do with the product.Having gotten this as a Vine item, I'm merely disappointed; I can see being somewhat more than disappointed had I paid full price.

column8: Finally a sleep aid that works
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
column12: I haven’t been able to sleep for almost 2 years now. I have a 13 month old and well….. you get the picture. She’s at the age now to where she sleeps throughout the night but mamas still having a hard time getting a full nights sleep. I can’t even remember the last time I had an actual dream, I’d probably wake up scared if I did. For the last couple nights I’ve been taking 2 of these snooze pills an hour before bed time. The last two nights I closed my eyes, tossed and turned for about 20 minutes (amazing for me) and then I woke up to the baby crying in the morning. I actually slept throughout the night. I didn’t even wake up when my husband got up. He’s extremely quiet but I’m such a light sleeper. I woke up feeling good too. No grogginess. It was like I didn’t even take sleeping aids the night before. I would give these 5 stars but they’re really expensive. So, they get 4 stars due to being too pricy for most of us to afford. 3 capsules is the suggested amount to take. That means this $50 bottle would get you 20 nights of rest. I took 2 capsules to stretch it out to 30 days.

column8: Wow! Best Sleep Supplement I've Tried
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
column12: I was so surprised the first time I took this Abundant Earth Sleep Aid. It hit me so fast! Truth be told, I had had a glass of wine AND I took it with Melatonin. Whoa! I almost couldn't get upstairs to bed fast enough - my head hit the pillow hard!The next night, I had a glass of wine again, but skipped the Melatonin. Yes - I didn't have to rush right to bed quite as quickly, but still - wow! Did I sleep well!The third night I tried it without a glass of wine. I fell asleep and stayed asleep. This stuff is great.Let me tell you what I've had to take to go to sleep before trying this Minding Down supplement:1) Qunol Sleep Support 5 in 12) 15 mg Melatonin3) CBD (which I quit taking two months ago)4) I sleep with several palm stones in my bed. I have to hold stones in my hands or I can't sleep (something to try if you're desperate to sleep, but can't. Try amethyst, rose quartz, malachite, or selenite.)5) Theta wave binaural sleep music6) A humidifierNow it's just Minding Down and the palm stones (and the music and the humidifier - gotta have those). I can't believe how well this supplement works. Glycine! It also has other benefits, like it regulates your hormones, helps with digestion, and it's supposed to be good for your bones. What a winner! I'll keep taking this!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
column12: This product has a significant impact on putting me to sleep. 15 drops (3/4 serving) gets me ready to pass out in about 30-45 minutes. I have always been a good sleeper once asleep, but my smart watch is showing I'm sleeping deeper than normal since I started taking the product. So as a sleep aid it has been phenomenal.I need to take about a serving and a half (30 ish drops) to feel the tension relief in my muscles, and then I almost sleep too hard and have a harder time waking up in the morning. A non alcoholic hangover if you would? hahaI feel better in other ways too but it is hard to separate if I feel better because of the product or because I'm not drinking alcohol before bed.My skin looks great, mood is improved, focus is good. All the things.People complain about the price point, and yes, for 1.2 oz $30 seems steep, but if you figure it replaces one alcoholic drink a night, it's already breaking even or saving you money.I put it in a juice and sparkling water drink, and I've never noticed a taste.I'm excited to try their other flavors/versions.

column5: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 30 SERVINGS: one full dropper each day of the month to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
column8: Not wine, but not NOT wine
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
column12: As I discovered when I was pregnant, there just is not a substitute for red wine. There are great AF beers and even mocktails, but they just can’t get the flavor of a great cab without the alcohol. Fast forward and I’m just trying to ease back on week day consumption (it’s gained some momentum since 2020) and this is not a bad stand in. It definitely tastes more like an herbal tea than wine, but it’s pleasant. I’m experimenting with adding 2 droppers full to some room temperature sparkling water and a splash of no sugar added cranberry juice. It looks pretty in the glass, tastes ok, and I do feel more relaxed after drinking. I would say if you’re hesitating because of the price, just go for it and play around with how to take it. It’s definitely cheaper than 6 bottles of wine.

column5: Dr. Christopher
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2014
column12: I got this product from the local herbal store for my father. Since then I do believe I have ordered multiple bottles. I ordered one for myself, neighbors, had one sent to my mother, and extra bottles to have on hand. This extract makes using the valerian root more tolerable with the taste and smell while working in the same manner as the root tea, which I have to be totally truthful I still drink the tea version when I have a headache at home. This product has helped my with my father's medical problems. I can NEVER tell you how much it means to know that a loved, is no longer in the pain and that the pain is removed with a herbal product QUICKLY. I watched my father's shaking from pain visible go way in minutes. Everyone that I have told about this product is using it with success on the results.

column5: Dr. Christopher
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2022
column12: I did notice a difference with my sleep and it was better rest than without using this product.  I did however notice that after a few days of use it doesn't work as well as the initial use.  Gradually it becomes ineffective and you get no benefit from it.  If you stop using it for a few days and then try again it will work.This is most effective when used occasionally and not on a daily basis.  Your body will build a tolerance for it and it will not work after a week or two of daily use.  Once every 3 days seems to be the threshold for keeping it effective for myself.  You may find that it works differently for you.I do recommend this.  It did help me sleep well and continues to do so as long as I don't use it daily and only use it occasionally.

column12: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I’m enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
column12: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2022
column12: I bought this set after buying Nighty Night from the grocery store and absolutely falling in love with it. I wanted to try the extra strength version that the store didn't carry and decided to get the variety pack here. I'll return with my thoughts on each flavor as I try them but wanted to go ahead and leave my feedback because I've loved my experience so far.🌙Nighty Night: A very full tea with a delicious and refreshing minty lilt. Drinking this tea is one of the few things I look forward to eveyday and while it doesn't have a sleepy affect it does work well to calm my nerves before bed.💤Nighty Night Extra: Very similar to Nighty Night but also contains valerian root. Valerian root has a very distinct and rather unpleasant smell but it's flavor isn't unpleasant, it reminds me of dandelion tea. Extra had a bit more body than regular Nighty Night and had the same affect on my sleepiness.🍃Lavender mint: This makes me feel like I'm drinking camomile tea. The distinctive floral taste of lavender coupled with refreshing mint is absolutely glorious. Perfect balance of flavors where the lavender is not too flowery, the mint not too electric… overall a very smoothing experience 😌🧘Camomile Lavender: Unlike the Lavender Mint the Lavender is a bit too overpowering for the camomile. For me, it's a bit too flowery and bitter in a way I can only balance with another less floral tea. Ideally I'd use another camomile but I didn't have any so I used the Nighty Night and while the Lavender is still very strong it's less biting.🫖Cinnamon: I'll be honest, I was NOT looking forward to trying this one. While I love a spicy ginger tea, cinnamon ain my thing 𝓱𝓸𝔀𝓮𝓿𝓮𝓻, I paired it with a generous splash of banana pudding whisky, strawberry gin, a spoonful of jujubes in honey tea and it was absolutely heavenly, buttery even. The cinnamon alone is actually rather pleasant, I was expecting it to be overpowering but it's not at all, more of a twange than in your face. It can actually lean fruity if you want it to, maybe throw in some lemon juice or peach tea. It could also go floral but I went the more cakey route and think this would be great to deepen the flavor profile of a butter beer or hot cocoa. Though it stands it's own it's definitely a more subdued tea than the others.🍋Lemon balm: Though lemon balm is part of the mint family it's definitely more citrusy in flavor than minty. It does however have a slightly minty aftertaste that's closest to spearmint in flavor and is easier to detect if you exhale through your nose between sips. This is the mildest of the tea flavors in this variety pack though it absolutely does have its own charm the slight lemony taste of this tea had me craving more. It tastes very much like lemon zest so while it's distinctly lemony tasting it's not super tangy. I decided to add a bag of lemon ginger tea with a couple splashes of lime to deepen and round out the perfectly cirtusy experience.To sum everything up my favorite was definitely the Lavender Mint with Nighty Night coming in at a very close second. If you're having issues with insomnia these teas unfortunately are not the answer but they are certainly useful in setting the stage for a restful night's sleep which is a fundamental part of good sleep hygiene. I personally have found cbn and indica gummies to be very useful and will mix them in my tea to amplify the calming affect of the tea and the sleepy affect of the gummies in this oddly perfect synergy that has my eyelids drooping before I can even finish the cup. I hope my review was helpful, happy steeping 😌

column12: It's still far too soon to say what benefits this might give me but one thing is sure, it most CERTAINLY gets you going! Now it's not an immediate thing so be patient and use caution and DON'T do what I did.I had me a nice cuppa wen it came and waited several hours (5? 6?) and nothing had happened yet. I thought, maybe I brewed it too weak. So I made a second cup before I laid down to sleep. I slept about 3 hours and woke up to intense pain and the need to GO!I raced to the bathroom and it was not like other over the counter laxatives that makes things watery and loose. Nooo, this was solid and urgent and painful and I felt heat wash over me and like I was going to throw up at the same time. Almost as if I had food poisoning kind of feeling. I remember closing my eyes once I had some relief (after I'd been sweating because of it and not from strain, no no... one does not strain and push too hard or else you have other problems to deal with). The next thing I know I am half-way waking up and not sure where I was or how I got there or what day it was.I had fainted somehow. Passed out cold and fallen off the toilet over beside it wedged between the toilet and the sink cabinet. Even after finally deducing where I was you would think I would try to get up. No. I couldn't. I was utterly without energy and strength and felt drugged. I don't think my eyes even completely opened. I fell back to 'sleep' there for who knows how long since I was at home alone. When I finally could wake and move I had to 'go' again and feared passing out, again. Luckily I didn't. Once business was handled on the toilet I got a shower and laid down for a few more hours and was woken with pains again.No passing out this time and it wasn't as painful but there was still discomfort. Stool was more loose and liquid this time but briefer. And so it's been off and on all night/morning for me.Moral of the story....Drink one or even only half a cup the first time and wait... WAIT! Even if you have to wait overnight, for the love of all that's holy wait. Otherwise you too might feel like you are dying and end up passed out in your bathroom floor. it does what it says it does. It cleans you out but be patient with that process or suffer the consequences.

column12: These golden poppy seeds are absolutely SUPERB! I read online that poppy seeds required stratification for better and successful germination rate. So I stored in fridge for three weeks immediately after it was received. I loosen and prepared the soil prior before the rainstorm arrives in Southern California in early April, 2024. I carefully spray the seeds evenly by hand to covered the entire perimeter, then spray another very thin layer of good organic soil on top the seeds for good contact. The effort has paid off after just 13 days in ground. I read online that young juvenile poppy plants might not bloom on first year, but we will see!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2024
column12: I love this brand and keep all the flavors in stock in my cupboard. I go to the Pure Mind blend on days when I have a lot of tasks to do. I can’t say that it helps me focus specifically any better than I would have, but just starting my day drinking this with good intention does 100% help me motivate and stay on task.Some people comment about the powder in the packets that shake loose from the bags. I find this is always the case when I order it by mail… it always comes to me in a paper or plastic mailer that takes a beating in transit. I have never had this problem when I buy it in stores though, so definitely a shipping issue. But I don’t mind the excess powder.Be careful when opening the packets, my boyfriend has a habit of ripping it lower than the tear line sometimes and you will rip the tea bag open this way .Taste 2.5/5Ingredients 5/5I find the flavor bland with a light taste of oregano. To combat the bland flavor , I usually steep my bags in conjunction with other more flavorful tea varieties.Overall, Highly recommend

column8: Helps a little to soothe symptoms but tastes awful.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
column12: I go this tea because I was recently diagnosed with diverticulitis. I was kind of just looking for something to help relieve the symptoms in conjunction with the other preventative treatments. This tea contains peppermint, which is good to relieve an unhappy stomach. I can say that it does help a little to soothe the irritation and other stuff. But it isn't some kind of miracle elixer. One of the reasons I bought this was because lots of reviews said that it tasted great. That's just not true. I drink lots of teas. Being that my Wife is from China, I keep many different varieties at my house. This tastes far worse than any Ive had. It also leaves a very powerful aftertaste that doesnt go away easily. No big deal, we arent drinking this for pleasure. I just wanted to set the record straight on the flavor issue. The price is also very outrageous. Another reason I thought it either did a great job and might taste really good. It seems to be priced high for no reason at all. I think that after I finish this stuff off, I won't be buying more. It works just ok, taste bad and cost too much.

column2: Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer - Sarsaparilla Root Herbal Loose Leaf Tea; Blend of Flavors like Sarsaparilla Root, Burdock Root, and More! (2 Oz)
column3: Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer - Sarsaparilla Root Herbal Loose Leaf Tea; Blend of Flavors like Sarsaparilla Root, Burdock Root, and More! (2 Oz)
column5: CAPTIVATING ROOT BEER BLEND: Indulge in the nostalgic flavors of a classic root beer crafted to captivate your taste buds and evoke memories of old-time soda shops and delightful childhood treats. Experience the bold, naturally sweet and spicy notes that will transport you to a realm of pure tea bliss. Savor the essence of this ancient root, blended to perfection by Nelson's Tea.The robust and well-balanced combination of ingredients will make your taste buds enjoy its flavorful taste. | PREMIUM INGREDIENT MEDLEY: This exquisite blend features a thoughtfully selected array of premium ingredients, including Burdock Root, Sarsaparilla Root, Sassafras Root Bark, Birch Bark, Dandelion Root, Fennel Seeds, Anise Star, Ginger Root, Licorice Root, Cinnamon Chips, Juniper Berries, and natural flavoring. Each ingredient contributes its unique essence, resulting in a harmonious medley of flavors that delight and intrigue, delivers a symphony of flavors that will leave you craving for more. | SUPPORT WOMAN-OWNED BUSINESS: By choosing this product, you are not only treating yourself to a remarkable tea experience but also supporting a woman-owned business. The dedication and passion of the visionary entrepreneur behind this brand shine through in every aspect of this tea. You directly contributes to empowering female entrepreneurs, fostering a more inclusive and vibrant business landscape, and empower a dream nurtured with love. | EXPERTLY CRAFTED IN USA: Rest assured that every batch of this exceptional tea blend is crafted and packaged with great care in Indianapolis, IN USA. From sourcing the finest ingredients to handcrafting each batch, we ensure that every aspect of our tea production reflects our commitment to excellence. Experience the taste of authenticity and the pride of supporting locally made products. The meticulous attention to detail ensures that you receive a product of unparalleled quality and freshness. | EMBRACE THE TEA RITUAL: Beyond its delightful taste, this tea embodies the essence of what tea brings to people. It is a catalyst for connection, creating cherished moments of togetherness and shared experiences. It provides a comforting refuge, allowing you to unwind and find solace in the ritual of brewing and savoring a cup of tea. With each sip, you embark on a sensory journey that combines the pleasure of unique flavors with the profound rejuvenation that only tea can provide.

column12: I have purchased this with the intent of making a rootbeer mead. This has not disappointed. It tastes exactly like rootbeer, well like the best rootbeer. It has the classic rootbeer head and everything. Be aware if you plan on brewing with this, there is a substantial head, so you will want to leave more room than you think. Overall I cannot recommend this enough. Plus it came with a free sample. Definitely will buy this again when I make my Baldur the Kid rootbeer mead.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
column12: I decided to give Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer a try, intrigued by the idea of a tea that promised the classic taste of root beer in a loose leaf format. At first sip, the blend of sarsaparilla root and other flavors did remind me of the nostalgic beverage, offering a unique twist on my usual tea routine.The flavor profile is interesting, marrying the earthy notes of herbal tea with the distinct, slightly sweet essence of root beer. It's a novel concept that captures the essence of the soda without the fizz, making it a cozy, caffeine-free alternative for evenings.However, the price tag gave me pause. It's on the higher end for tea, which might make one reconsider its value, especially if you're an avid tea drinker looking for a daily staple. While the novelty and taste are commendable, the cost factor could be a deterrent for those on a budget or for whom tea is a frequent indulgence.In conclusion, Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer is a fun, flavorful experiment for those looking to spice up their tea collection. If the unique flavor combination calls to you and the price isn't a concern, it's worth a try. Otherwise, you might find better value in exploring other teas that offer both satisfaction and a more reasonable price point.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2024
column12: I’ve been using this to flavor the second fermentation (F2) of kombucha and water kefir.  I made the tea twice as strong as Nelson’s directions stated, strained and added a bit of sugar (@20g sugar per cup of tea).  Once cooled, I add two tablespoons of the sweetened rootbeer tea per 16 oz. of F1 kombucha (or water kefir) and bottle with a tight lid.

column12: I love this tea. I drink it almost every night. It’s delicious and also incredibly calming and soothing. I also LOVE that it doesn’t have stevia. column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
column12: Ladies, if you have horrible period cramps like me then you need to give this tea a try. I found a video on Tik Tok of a girl talking about ways to help period cramps and she mentioned raspberry tea. Honestly, I was skeptical. How is a tea going to help my cramps....A little back story, I decided to take a break from birth control. Doing so brought back my really really really bad cramps. We are talking about gagging, nausea, cramping, bloating, etc. I drink this tea the first few days of my cycle and really alleviated the pain. My most recent period was surprisingly easy to get through - almost no cramping. The taste is not my favorite, but I will easily look past it because of how much it helps me. Will continue to repurchase.

column2: Luxmi Estates - Valerian Dream - Organic Valerian Root Tea for Sleep - 25 Tea Bags | with Valerian Root, Chamomile & Lavender | Perfect Wellness Sleep Tea
column3: Luxmi Estates - Valerian Dream - Organic Valerian Root Tea for Sleep - 25 Tea Bags | with Valerian Root, Chamomile & Lavender | Perfect Wellness Sleep Tea
column5: SLEEP TEA - Sourced from the premium tea estates of India. Valerian root and Chamomile comes together in this soothing blend to gently lull you into a state of relaxation. Enjoy as a sleep aid at bedtime to support tranquility and relaxation. | TASTING NOTES - Earthy | Relaxing with Sweet, Floral notes - The valerian root also known as ‘sugandhbala’ in India grows on the rolling hills and deep valleys of Kalimpong in the temperate Himalayas. It is this tranquil terroir that produces ingredients that are blended together in this blend. The result is a cup of calm, light, earthy, and gently floral cup of tea that will steep you into relaxation. | USDA CERTIFIED ORGANIC - Luxmi Estates uses only the Highest Grade Organic ingredients grown in our own Estates for healthy flavorful brew. Our Herbal Teas are Kosher Free, Caffeine Free. | NATURAL INGREDIENTS, ALWAYS - All our blends are organic and made of natural ingredients with no additives. This tea includes Valerian Root, Chamomile, Licorice, Rose petals, Peppermint, Lavender. | TRY OUR OTHER FLAVORS: There's a tea for any time in the day. Try our English Breakfast, Masala Chai, Ashwagandha Tea, Earl Grey, Turmeric Tea, Organic teas and a variety of our herbal teas. | THE HAND OF ABUNDANCE - 1% of sales from this tea pack goes into supporting women and their communities across the 23 estates through access to education, healthcare and water. | A CENTURY OF TEA MAKING - From the Himalayas and the flood plains of Assam to the Nyungwe forest, our 23 estates are amongst the finest tea growing regions in the world. A true confluence of nature’s bounty, the rich biodiversity and unique ecosystems they form, Our teas are some of the world’s most unique brews. | ECO-CONSCIOUS TEA BAGS: Our premium tea bags are constructed of Non PLA bio mesh. They are free of dyes, adhesive, and chlorine bleach. No staples and extra waste, food grade environmentally friendly and non toxic - just delicious tea!

Enjoy larger quantities with 5g per serving for richer results, outshining the competition and savoring the goodness of our premium tea with every sip. | Unadulterated: At Pure & Easy Tea, we take pride in our commitment to unadulterated, all-natural premium teas, crafting blends with the highest-quality ingredients to deliver an authentic, pure tea experience. column8: Good-tasting herbal tea for immunity and wellness
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2024
column12: This cold & flu tea blend is easy to make and tastes good. It comes in loose pyramid tea bags packaged in a resealable retail standup bag. The tea bags are of the biodegradable, mesh type. You can see the individual ingredients inside. I steep one in a cup of freshly boiled water for 5-10 minutes. It is pleasant and soothing to drink. The herbal ingredients are supposed to help with wellness and boost immunity. Overall, a good-tasting herbal tea for immunity and wellness. For around $1.47 per tea bag, it seems a decent value for the money. I enjoy it. A good herbal tea.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
column12: I started drinking hibiscus tea after a friend recommended the Micro Ingredients Organic Hibiscus Flowers, and I’m so glad I did! Not only does it have a refreshing, slightly tart flavor that I love, but I’ve also noticed significant improvements in my overall health and well-being since I began incorporating it into my daily routine.After just a few weeks of drinking this tea, I’ve felt more energized, and my digestion has improved. But what’s truly remarkable is the impact it’s had on my skin—I've noticed a visible increase in skin elasticity and a healthy glow that I hadn’t seen before.The quality of these hibiscus flowers is excellent. They’re cut and sifted perfectly for brewing, and you get a generous amount in the 2-pound bag, which lasts a long time. It’s also great knowing that the product is organic, caffeine-free, and free from any additives or sugars.Overall, I highly recommend the Micro Ingredients Organic Hibiscus Flowers to anyone looking for a natural way to boost their health and enjoy a delicious cup of tea. It’s become a staple in my daily routine, and the benefits are undeniable!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
column12: I have been drinking this for four days now and Im pretty upset that I still haven’t seen or felt any changes. The tea tastes amazing though that’s the only reason I gave it above a one. But that could be the amount of honey I like with my tea. That being said I feel taken advantage of for a small box of tea bags costing over thirty dollars when I feel like I could get the same thing from a store for about $2.50-$4. I had been a smoker for 14 years and when I got this I had high hopes on clearing out my lungs of all those toxins. Granted I’m only on day four and tbh I will have two cups or more a day. (I really this enjoy tea) but that being said I should feel like my lungs are expanding, I should be coughing up mucus, or I should at least notice SOMETHING! Now I’m going to finish the whole box using one tea bag a day (reusing the tea bag for extra cups) and hope something happens but for now I’m disappointed. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT AND WASTE TOUR MONEY!!! It’s a placebo effect!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
column12: When it comes to finding the perfect tea to relax and unwind with, look no further than Buddha Teas Organic Calm Buddha Blend. This tea has quickly become a cherished part of my nightly routine, earning it a well-deserved five-star rating.From the moment you open the package, the wonderful aroma entices you. If you're in need of a gentle, calming beverage to sip on during the evenings, I can't recommend this tea highly enough. Its exceptional taste, alluring aroma, and soothing effects make it a standout choice for tea enthusiasts and anyone in need of a little relaxation.

column12: I’ve been drinking one tea a day and I’ve passed a few big creatures. When I sew them on my toilet paper, I just stared at them in total disbelief. Then, I got excited and searched for pictures on line for comparisons. It’s crazy that these ugly creatures are eating you inside. Hard to believe at first until you do!  Wish I could have done this sooner now that I’m 72. My skin tags are disappearing and itchy skin rashes are going away. I feel like doing this for a long time until I never see another speck or stringy worm again!!!!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
column12: Took a few weeks to receive. Kind of makes you wonder where it is coming from.The ingredients list looks good.  The name of the tea makes it seem great, but also says that it is a detox tea.  May give some folks the wrong impression.A small amount of tea is used when made according to the directions, so not sure of the potency.  The directions are to simmer the tea, rather than to steep it—which is a little unusual.The flavor of the tea is not overwhelming and it is easy to drink.Too early to tell if there are any immediate, short, or long term benefits and/or effects.

column2: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (6 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
column3: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (6 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
column4:
Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is a carefully crafted sleep tea, designed to help you unwind after a long day. It's a unique blend of Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine, all known for their soothing properties that aid relaxation and support good sleep.
This tea is made with natural ingredients. These ingredients, coupled with the added flavors of Vanilla and Caramel, create a tea that is not only beneficial for sleep but also offers a delicious and warming flavor.
Additionally, our tea bags are filled with Rainforest Alliance Certified Rooibos, which means that every sip of this delicious tea supports wildlife conservation efforts.
For over five decades, we’ve been making delicious, functional teas inspired by the ancient holistic healing philosophy of Ayurveda. Our diverse tea selection supports everyday well-being with specialized herbal formulas thoughtfully blended for both health benefits and appealing flavor.
 Yogi is a Certified B Corporation producing more than 40 tea blends from over 100 organic spices and botanicals sourced from around the globe. With every ingredient we source, and every tea bag we make, we strive to support environmental sustainability and social responsibility. We do so by following highly selective sourcing standards, performing rigorous quality tests, mandating environmentally sound farming practices, and partnering with local communities. Through such partnerships, we want to empower our entire tea ecosystem to live healthy, vibrant lives. It is our hope that our commitment to goodness shines through in every cup of Yogi tea.
column5: Organic Sleep Tea: Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is purposefully blended with Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine to support relaxation and good sleep | Delicious Calming Tea: Naturally sweet Rooibos combines with notes of Vanilla and Caramel for a delicious and warming tea; unwind from the day with a comforting cup | Tea Bag Instructions: Bring water to boiling and steep the tea bag for 7 minutes; for a stronger tea, use 2 tea bags; drink before bedtime | Premium Tea Ingredients: This Yogi tea is vegan and NON-GMO, so you can be sure you're getting the best in every cup | Uniquely Yogi: We believe in using the highest quality spices and botanicals, complementing them with intriguing, delightful flavors, qualities that make all of our teas uniquely Yogi
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
column12: I drink a cup of this tea literally every night before bed. It is so warming, slightly sweet, and just really satisfying. I don't know about the calming effects of it, but it has become part of my nighttime ritual and it definitely helps me to relax. It also doesn't need anything added to it and can steep for a while without ever getting bitter.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2014
column12: I have found that alternating my bedtime teas helps. This is my latest of 4 that I use, and it immediately became my favorite. The scent is rich and reminds me of Tiramisu. As it's cooling, I sit and breathe it in. The taste is the same and sweet enough, but sometimes I add a teaspoon of local honey.It helps me fall asleep easier. I also alternate several different forms of Melatonin (patch, liposomal, compound and sublingual) and some other natural supplements along with the teas. All in all, they're not perfect, but they make my nights restful, even if I don't sleep like a log straight through. I've done all the recommended things for getting restful sleep, including dark room, sleeping away from electrical outlets, early supper, and I don't drink coffee, tea or use refined sugars or gluten. So yes, I'm trying, and this tea makes it all a little easier. I'm at a stage in my life where I have to accept that my nights of falling into bed, going out like a light and sleeping 8 or 9 hours are past. I've read a few books on insomnia, and it helps to know that our ideal sleep schedule is a modern invention. People used to go to bed when the sun went down, sleep for 3 or 4 hours, get up and putter around, maybe even visit neighbors, then go back to bed and sleep till sunrise. It helps is you don't think of periodic wakefulness as a handicap. On the nights when I simply can't lie in bed, I get up, accompanied by my shih tzu, and pile up on the sofa with my iPad or watch TV for a couple of hours, then go back to bed when I'm sleepy.Thank you, Yogi, for your healthy, soothing teas. I use a lot of them.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
column12: So this is a great energizing tea. I have it every morning, and I'm definitely more alert and productive with it. No crash later on in the day. However, if I don't have it, I do get a massive headache. It says 'no headache', but I get the headache w/out it (just no crash the same day). Probably addicted to caffeine, but I didn’t have this problem before with just straight black tea.  And it's really expensive for tea, but I'm so energized and productive with it - I really like it. It's pepperminty-flavor. I had been doing straight black tea for years, but this is definitely better. I try some days to go back to black tea, and it's nice, but doesn't quite have the pick-me-up that this does. I add a little honey to it for sweetness. Yum! The price is a real drawback, but it's quality tea. If you purchase directly on website instead, you can subscribe and purchase more at a time (e.g. 60 bags every 2 months) and it's cheaper. I definitely use my subscription! Still love it. Update: Oh no! They're out of stock! I have tried in vain to find a good replacement (end up mixing mint and black tea...not the same...at all). Soooo sad! This is really the best tea out there. I love it. My favorite morning ritual. Will need to stockpile some when they are back in stock so I never have to run out again! :-)

column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
column12: First off, this product does EXACTLY what it's meant to do - help you fall asleep! I'm not a huge tea fan personally, but after a myriad of pills, supplements, and what felt like everything under the sun to try to fall asleep and stay asleep, I stumbled upon CogniTea. Finally, I was able to get a good nights rest after months!Initially, the scent of the bag itself is nice. It has a good, comforting aroma. However once you let the tea diffuse for around 8 minutes, it's different. The once comforting aroma is pungent and makes you wrinkle your nose. The taste itself is so bad, sour and unappetizing that you'll only be able to take a sip or two at a time, lest you risk an upset stomach. However, please note that I never put anything else in my tea. No sugar, honey, or creamer to help with the taste or smell.Overall, the tea itself helps you fall asleep but it's a doozy to drink, and is nothing short of an unenjoyable nightly battle.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
column12: We all know that getting a good night sleep can be a challenging endeavor.  My wife and I wanted to try a few tea options to see how they impacted our ability to fall asleep, stay asleep, and feel refreshed the next morning.  CogniTea’s DeepSleep product was one of the products we decided to try and I’m glad we did!I am a fairly heavy sleeper, but consider myself a night owl at times.  I want to go to bed early, but it just doesn’t happen.  I find that once I try to get back on track with an earlier bedtime, I lay there for what seems to be hours trying to fall asleep.  Recognizing these situations beforehand and having CogniTea’s Deep Sleep product has helped me relax, settle my mind, and ultimately get to sleep sooner.  I’m not an every day tea drinker but this product helps me when I need it most.  I especially like that I can leave the product in the mug and not come back to a bitter drink, regardless of how long I let it steep.My wife on the other hand is an extremely light sleeper.  If I so much as move during the night,  I’m waking her up unfortunately.  I convinced her to try Deep Sleep a week ago and she has been sleeping like a log since.  She’s now drinking it every day, has told me she isn’t waking up to use the restroom in the middle of the night, and says her sleep data is drastically improved.  While I may be a casual user of this product, I think my wife is hooked.I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to improve their sleep!

column12: This is a great sleep tea all around. I have been drinking it nightly for the past 3+ weeks and notice a significant decrease in the time it takes me to fall asleep, and an improvement in sleep quality. I use the Apple Watch sleep app and according to that I’m getting much better sleep…especially deep sleep which is what I need to feel rested.Not sure why all the hate on the flavor/ smell from other reviews - this tea definitely has a more robust smell and flavor than other sleep teas, but it is fantastic and is as described. It is slightly sweet with a kick of chamomile and vanilla. Super relaxing treat right before bed.

column12: This tea worked better for me than the pharmaceutical diuretics I was given.  The tea tastes good but moreimportantly it's effects are very gentle...Drinking it doesn't make me feel dehydrated as the medication did...It seems to settle my stomach as well as keep me from retaining fluid in my legs.  I've tried many different teas and herbs to help with fluid retention and this formula works far better than anything I've tried, including the drugs.  I don't want to take medication and if there is something natural that works better, why not just drink a cup of this every morning....I'm able to re-use my tea bag and have another cup after dinner...Just perfect!  I've re-ordered this a few times...I never want to be without it.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
column12: I purchased this tea for myself. I have had a hard time getting tired ,falling asleep, and staying asleep. I decided to look around for a natural tea without sugar to help me relax for I can actually get some good sleep , so when I saw this one I decided to try it and see if it does what it is supposed to do ..  The tea does indeed calm you down enough so that you are able to get groggy but not necessarily fall asleep. I like to drink this tea as well as take my  Alteril before going to sleep . I will usually drink the tea an hour before I take my meds , then I will attempt to go to sleep . You don’t get a lot of tea bags to be honest but if you use them wisely they are worth the price and the tea doesn’t taste bad either . If you have any stomach acid problems like me make sure to drink a lot of water with this tea because it has a tendency to mess with the stomach well maybe it’s just me . I do have a sensitive stomach but nevertheless I wanted to give a heads up just Incase .

column12: I LOVE this tea! Best purchase ever!!!Before I made this purchase, I was drinking 4 different kind of teas to help me sleep and I was taking melatonin as well and they did help, but they did not help as amazing as this tea does.I drink this tea with some fresh lime or lemon juice, it taste great and the effects are quick too. For me, within 10 minutes, I start feeling super relax and I start to feel tire and sleepy. By the hour of drinking this tea, I'm already knocked out and sleeping like a baby.With this tea, I have been sleeping anywhere between 6 - 9 hours a day and I love it! I don't wake up groggy or sleepy, I woke up refresh and ready for my day.I love this tea and plan on buying them and I've already recommended it to many of my friends and families.

column4:

About the Manufacturer:
For nearly forty years, we’ve been passionate about connecting people with plants and passing along the centuries-old wisdom of how to use them. So even though our packaging has changed, our aspirations remain the same: help you use plants to be healthy. Same great teas, same old us: devoted stewards of traditional herbal knowledge, practitioners of sustainable sourcing, meticulous judges of highest quality herbs, caring members of our communities, proud employee-owners of our independent company, herb nerds, and plant people who, without meaning to sound too hippie about it, feel like the plants are talking to us. We hope you will enjoy the fruits (or flowers, roots and leaves) of our labor.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2024
column12: Id sleep for a couple hours, then be up for hours in the middle of the night, sometimes even with melatonin in my system.My sister initially bought this tea for me from Whole Foods to help with that broken sleep.It works, and it works great!!!!!I went through the first box of tea and found this deal on Amazon.I had a friend try it bc he has broken sleep, too...  Not anymore!!!  It worked for him, too.  Gifted him a box bc of this deal... In the spirit of pay it forward, and bc I want my friend to get solid rest.  It is so important for us all.Anyway, I used to take melatonin.  Even with that, I'd wake up and stay up at times, then be groggy in the morning (only if I didn't get a full night of sleep).Anyway, I enjoy and appreciate drinking the tea instead of taking a pill.  It's a new evening ritual.Very important to let the tea steep for the 15 minutes as started in the directions.  Mild taste.Buy the tea and enjoy your rest. 😁🍵

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
column12: These were a gift for a very dear friend who has cancer.  I had previously given her a goodie box & included 1 box of the Nighty Night Tea.  A few weeks ago she told how much she liked it & she had used up that box.  I know that she has difficulty sleeping at times, so I looked at what you had available & I liked this bundle.  I ordered it for her & had it delivered to her.  She was so thrilled.  She told me how relaxing this tea is & how much she enjoys it.  I felt really good knowing I had given her something she really enjoys & that helps her get a good nights sleep.  I highly recommend this tea.  This is one of my favorite teas that I’ve enjoyed for about 5 years.  Traditional Medicinals makes fabulous teas, they’re so smooth, so flavorful & helps me relax.  I highly recommend this flavor because of it’s relaxing & calming effect at bedtime.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2011
column12: This tea is great!  I have been under a lot of stress lately, and this tea has definitely helped me get to sleep.  I have been drinking it for about a month now as needed.  I feel like I sleep a bit more deeply when I drink this, which I have attributed to being more relaxed at bedtime.  It is not a miracle, but I think that the tea itself along with the routine of having it before bed really helps me to relax.Make sure you steep it as directed for 10-15minutes.  I have noticed that if I do not cover my cup to keep the heat in the tea does not come out as strong.  I didn't give it 5 stars only because the flavor is not my favorite.  Its nice for sure, but a bit mild for me.  It is a better and more complex flavor than any other nighttime relaxation tea I have tried.  I prefer to either make a strong cup or sometimes I steep it with a bag of chamomile tea as well which makes a very nice flavor.  I typically have one cup an hour before bed and another while I sit in bed and read right before I go to sleep.  After the first cup I feel more calm, after the second cup I feel drowsy and ready for sleep! I bought the case of six because I have enjoyed this product so much!

This organic papaya tea has been cherished in various cultures for its soothing properties and delightful Tea flavor. | PREMIUM PAPAYA LEAF TEA BAGS; Akshit follows the International Standards Organic in our papaya processing. The papaya tea bags have no strings, staples, no dyes | CAFFEINE-FREE TEA: Our papaya leaf tea bags offer a caffeine-free alternative to coffee and other teas, allowing you to feel fresh, smooth, and rejuvenated every day. Enjoy the benefits of papaya leaf tea year-round, without the effects of caffeine, for a refreshing and youthful experience with every sip. Experience a celebration of flavors with premium papaya leaf loose tea—a party in a cup! Whether it's a tranquil morning, a serene afternoon, or a relaxing evening, savor the sweetness of papaya leaf in every sip. Perfect anytime, elevate your moments with each enchanting cup. | BENEFITS: Our Papaya Leaf Tea Bags offer a myriad of benefits beyond just a delightful beverage. Papaya tea is know for its numerous benefits. Enjoy the smooth, calming nature of papaya tea which may provide relaxation after a long day. | We ensure that you receive only the best of nature in every cup. We believe in harnessing the power of organic papaya leaves to enhance your health naturally. Steep the papaya tea bag in hot water, wait for it 3-5 mins, add a sweetener of your choice. Can serve the leaves tea hot or iced. | Our papaya leaf tea is versatile, perfect for enjoying either hot tea or cold. Whether you prefer it as a soothing leaf tea or evening beverage to unwind after a long day or a revitalizing morning pick-me-up to kickstart your day, it fits seamlessly into any lifestyle and occasion. | Embrace the caffeine-free enjoyment of our papaya leaf tea, a delightful beverage that complements your lifestyle and enhances your daily routine in multiple ways. column5: HERB TEA FOR REST: Say goodnight to tossing and turning. Steep a pot of our caffeine-free herbal blend and breathe a sigh of sweet relief as the bouquet of organic rooibos, soothing chamomile, passionflower and the mellowing properties of valerian gently lulls you toward blissful effects*. Valerian won't interfere with REM sleep, so you won't have to contend with the morning hangover that often results from sleep-aids. | ORGANIC RED ROOIBOS: The Wonder Herb of South Africa Full-bodied and aromatic, caffeine-free red rooibos is celebrated for its flavor and antioxidants. As the base for this tea, it's a natural friend to the immune system and can contribute to a healthier life.* All of our Be Well Teas are meticulously formulated for specific needs. We invite your to consider them all, and get what you need. | STEEPING INSTRUCTIONS: Steeping red tea is easy. Simply heat fresh, filtered water to a rolling boil. Then pour 6 oz of water over tea and steep for 5-7 minutes if using a tea bag or full-leaf. After steeping, add the used tea bags to compost or soil — they make gardens happy. | INGREDIENTS: Organic Rooibos (leaf), Orange (peel), Spearmint (leaf), Chamomile (flower), Passionflower (herb), Stevia (leaf), Valerian Root Extract. | Pregnancy and Lactation: Do not use during pregnancy or lactation without the advice of a healthcare practitioner.

column5: PURELY HIBISCUS: Ruby red Nigerian hibiscus blossoms shine in this juicy, herbal blend. Hibiscus delivers hints of berry and bright citrus flavors. This bold, tropical infusion is pure refreshment either served hot or over ice. Sip this pure effervescent hibiscus tea to enjoy your own summer day in the tropics. | STEEPING INSTRUCTIONS: Steeping herbal tea is easy. Simply heat fresh, filtered water to a rolling boil. Then pour 6 oz of water over the tea bag and steep for 5-7 minutes. | INGREDIENTS: Nigerian Hibiscus (flower), sweet blackberry (leaf), stevia (leaf) | CERTIFFICATIONS: This tea is gluten-free, so you can sip away without worry | Pregnancy and Lactation: Do not use during pregnancy or lactation without the advice of a healthcare practitioner.

column12: I enjoy this Hibiscus tea so much! I add a teaspoon of honey. It's flavor reminds me of a cross between fruit punch and lemonade. Delicious hot or cold. Love the pretty can these teabags come in. Keeps them fresh and flavorful. This brand's tea (no matter which selection) is very authentic tasting. One thing I didn't expect was the added bonus of Hibiscus lowering my blood pressure! My last checkup had my Doc asking me what I was doing differently. I drink 3 cups a day and enjoy every drop. I can recommend this brand and will be happy to purchase again.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
column12: I really enjoy a cup of tea in the evenings and have tried a number of different bedtime and calming tea. I have a couple favorites and tend to rotate through those and try others. I was excited to add this one into the mix. It's not bad... I'd say the flavor is less pronounced than some of my others, but it's okay. I usually use tea bags, so it's fun to try a loose leaf and compare. I did notice that some of the smaller pieces came out on the two different style tea holders I used. I'm not sure if this normal with loose leaf, but I don't care for sipping on those. As for a calming effect, it is probably comparable to the others I drink. It's a nice tea. I do think the price is a little steep (no pun intended) if you haven't already tried the tea to know you like it. It is a big bag though, so it'll last a while.

column8: A little goes a long way
column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024
column12: This tea looks great, the leaves and the blossoms and all of the ingredients look top notch.  I was expecting a more floral flavor, but it was much more earthy.  Not bad, just not what I was expecting.  I do recommend to be mindful of the steeping time; I found that 3 min makes a good cup. Too long and it can get bitter.That being said, this is A LOT of tea.  The entire bag will go a long, long way and make you a lot of tea.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
column12: The verdict is in! It's a yes for me! It takes about 30 minutes for me to feel the effects but once I do, wow! Over the last couple of months, I've drank it about 5 or so times to observe if it works. I sleep so soundly and even though tea usually makes me use the restroom in the same way as water, I get such sound sleep for like 4 - 5 hours after the effects hit. It makes me feel so fancy making it with all the ingredients, too haha. Would recommend on those nights you can't seem to sleep!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
column12: As someone who struggles with winding down after a long day, I'm always on the lookout for natural remedies to promote relaxation and better sleep. First and foremost, the aroma of this tea is absolutely divine. The blend of lavender, chamomile, and linden blossom creates a soothing scent that instantly calms my senses and prepares me for a peaceful night's sleep. With each sip, I can feel the tension melting away, allowing me to fully unwind and relax. But it's not just about the aroma – the ingredients in this tea are carefully selected to promote restful sleep. Valerian and passion flower work together to ease tension and quiet the mind, helping me drift off into a deep and rejuvenating slumber.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
column12: Not normally a fan of loose-leaf tea, I always have a hard time making it. But, with my wife and I having issues getting a good night's rest, I figured we could try this. So far so good. the taste isn't bad, it is very flowery though, so if you're not into that it likely won't be the tea for you. We've had some restful sleep after taking it, and we look forward to using it in the near future as needed.

column8: Good if you want a nighttime ritual!
column10: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2024
column12: I don't think there is anything about this tea that is specifically tuned to relaxation, etc. except that it doesn't have caffein and has a nice floral bouquet. It only is calm and relaxing, IMHO, if it becomes part of a routine/ritual where you can otherwise take some time and enjoy the taste and aroma experience in the right mindset. In that case, it's more about the other things than the tea, but this certainly fits the bill. There may be less expensive options, but this is a good one.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
column12: This is a nighttime tea with chamomile, lavender, linden blossom, valerian root, lemon balm, passion flower, and rose petals in it. As you can imagine, it has a floral scent/taste, which is very relaxing and soothing but might not be to everyone's taste. It is caffeine-free. It suggests on the back to use it with a filter bag, but I used it in a regular tea strainer with no issues. The leaves are large enough that I didn't get sediment in my tea.It is quite expensive but a large bag, considering you only need one heaped teaspoon for 8oz of water. There are an estimated 33 cups in the bag, so it is slightly less than a dollar a cup, but that's still more expensive than some other teas I've tried that come in at less than fifty cents per cup.The scent is quite strong and looks quite pretty, so if you don't want to drink this as tea, you could use it for potpourri. I liked it as tea but I think the lavender could be toned back slightly.

column8: I can't believe this is actually helping me sleep !
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
column12: I was having trouble falling asleep and didn’t want to use pills. I'm not going to say this tea is a miracle solution that puts me to sleep in 10 minutes, but I definitely feel more relaxed and prepared for bed after finishing my cup. Almost immediately, I start yawning.This tea doesn’t have valerian. I hate the smell and taste of valerian, so I’m happy about that. Instead, this tea has melissa, chamomile, and lavender, which are great for relaxation and sleep. It smells very good and tastes wonderful.

column8: It works! Relaxes and helps sleep
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
column12: I've been struggling with sleep issues for more than a year, often getting only 3-5 hours of sleep and taking hours to fall asleep. My nighttime routine has been inconsistent. My doctor prescribed several medications and I've tried many over-the-counter options like melatonin, zzzquil. I decided to establish a better sleep routine. Now, I shower, follow my skincare routine, have a cup of tea, and head to bed. I also use mood lighting and play relaxing music. After finishing the tea and lying down I fell asleep within 15 minutes. It also has a very pleasant taste. I’m happy with this product and going to order more.

column8: Lovely loose leaf tea, strong ginger flavor
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
column12: This is a new brand for me, and I couldn't be happier. The price is better than my usual brands, and you can buy small packets to try the flavor. I buy loose leaf tea, and always make ice tea, using the cold brew method. (put filter and water in pitcher, leave on counter for a couple hours, then refrigerate for 8-12 hours, or when it seems done) As you can see in the pictures, I have 2 pitchers going at once. The other pitcher has another tea from this manufacturer.This tea has a strong ginger taste, which probably is why it comes first in the name, lol! I'm used to ones that are peach first, then ginger, which isn't as strong. It's okay with me, but I'm glad I didn't add some fresh ginger pieces to it when it was brewing! I like to add frozen fruit to my tea when drinking it, to keep it cold, and add a little flavor.The first picture is of the dry tea before it is brewed, straight out of the packet. You can see big chunks of fruit in there, with other spices and tea. The aroma is magical.The second picture is the tea after it's been brewed. You can see the chunks have all expanded, letting out all of their goodness.  I haven't seen many other brands that have similar qualities. The third picture is of my two pitchers, both filled with Tiesta Tea, one being the Ginger Sweet Peach, the one on the right.Yes, I highly recommend this product.

column8: Good herbal loose leaf tea, bulk size lasts a long time
column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
column12: Costco used to sell this tea as an immunity tea.  My mom is obsessed with it and drinks it religiously anytime she feels under the weather or in general during flu season.  Given the ingredients list, it is probably a good source of vitamin C and antioxidants.  It is a loose leaf tea that definitely benefits from having a fine-mesh tea strainer.  It is also really strong and quite tart, but then again so is rose hip tea.  I like that it is non-caffeinated and in bulk, so you can decide how much you want to brew.  Each bag lasts a long time so we only reorder it a couple times a year.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
column12: I am very happy with this tea sampler!  The samples are very generous.  You can easily get 5+ cups from each sample.  I use a tea ball and make my cup a bit stronger, so there is PLENTY in each pouch.The flavors are very rich and deep.  The aroma is amazing.  This is probably the best tea I've had.  I got the 8-pouch sample pack, and am very pleased with the variety.  I'm also happy that there is no mint in the samples.  I don't care for mint at all.If you like good tea with lots of flavor, do yourself a solid and get this.

column5: DISCOVER A WORLD OF FLAVORS: This set features a delightful array of loose leaf teas, including Passion Berry Jolt, Chai Love, Victorian Earl Grey, Cherry Punch, Fruity Paradise, Pineapple Blues, Pomegranatopia, Blackberry Bellini, Peach Party, Fireberry, Maui Mango, Lemon Ginger Turmeric, Meyer Lemon Zest, Nutty Almond Cream, Orange Tango, Ginger Sweet Peach, Chamomile Mint, Lavender Chamomile, Blueberry Wild Child, Pineapple Sangria. (Samples may vary) | DRY FLIGHT SAMPLERS: Don't limit yourself to hot tea! Our loose teas are fantastic iced too. Dive into the 20 most beloved blends of our Discovery Tea Sampler.This diverse selection includes herbal, green, black, white, and rooibos teas, catering to both caffeine lovers and those seeking a caffeine-free sip. The samples provided may vary in size, typically ranging from 0.5 to 1 ounce in sample pouches. Each pouch brews 6 - 10 Cups, ensuring you have plenty to savor. | THE PERFECT TEA GIFT SET: Share the warmth of the season with the tea lovers in your life. Our Tea Blend Gift Sets are the perfect choice for teachers, bosses, neighbors, or anyone else who appreciates the gift of premium teas. Ideal for occasions like Christmas, Hanukkah, birthdays, and more. Give the gift of cozy, flavorful teas. | FINDING THE RIGHT TEA: At Tiesta Tea, we believe in simplifying the tea selection process. We offer 5 functional categories, each with a variety of flavors, caffeine levels, and health benefits, so you can easily find the perfect tea to match your taste buds and preferences. Discover the ease of finding the right tea with Tiesta Tea. | LIVE LOOSE + OUR IMPACT: We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we seriously love to give back; through the Tiesta Tea Foundation, we provide resources and relief to communities across the globe and in our own backyard; so join us and Live Loose!

column5: CALENDULA HERBS: We only selected vibrant and orange-red calendula flowers as raw material, which is 100% pure natural without any artificial additives. Although it may taste slightly bitter, it's more of a delicate and mellow flavor. Of course, you can also add honey or sugar as you like to get a better flavor; | PROMOTE RELAXATION: The aroma of warm calendula flowers tea is equally captivating. As the steam rises from your cup, be greeted by a gentle, floral aroma that will soothe your senses. Nutrition in every sip of calendula tea can relax you as well; | HEALTH BENEFITS: The benefits of calendula officinalis extend beyond their visual appeal. Packed with antioxidants and vitamins, calendula flowers tea not only supports digestion and improves skin health, it also helps to rejuvenate you and boost immunity; | EASY TO USE: 50 calendula flowers tea bags are placed in a resealable bag to keep them fresh. Just take one and place it in the cup, add 8 fl.oz of boiling water. Steep for about 3-5 minutes. Take out the tea bag then enjoy this calendula tea;

column12: These tea pouches have such a nice flavor and make a delicious iced tea. It is lemony with notes of lavender, but the lavender is not overpowering. It is sweetened (just a note if you need to worry about sugar grams) but not disgustingly so, just enough to bring out the flavors. Sometimes I get sidetracked while I’m waiting for my tea to steep, but this one does not get bitter like many teas do if you leave the bags in too long. It’s also not caffeinated, so it’s great to enjoy in the evening.

column4: Rest easy with this soothing bedtime blend that will send you off to dreamland so quickly, you won't have time to count sheep! We have crafted this sleep-saving tonic with sweet chamomile, valerian, rose petals, lemongrass, spearmint and passion flower. Valerian is a sedative herb that has been used for centuries to aid those suffering with insomnia. Passionflower and hemp leaves are naturally calming; it will help ease your mind. Bedtime is a mild blend that promotes calm, sound sleep, and will help you to wake up feeling well-rested. We recommended that you drink this infusion before bedtime to increase the quality of your sleep.

column12: I love this product.  I saw that some people didn’t find it effective and/or it didn’t taste great. I almost didn’t buy it but decided to give it a try. Now I drink it nightly to help me relax and drift off to sleep. I also take it with me traveling and it has been really helpful in that situation as well. I usually combine with another sleepytime tea from the supermarket that is chamomile vanilla. It’s part of my overall ritual of sleep hygiene including sleep music, a hot bath/shower and reading. It is a little pricey but well worth it in my opinion. I have tried chamomile tea alone and that is not as effective. You get what you pay for type of thing.

column8: Product amazing, Amazon shipping crushed it
column10: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021
column12: I am a huge fan of Rishi. They source THE BEST from around the world. This chamomile brews THE MOST AMAZING and satisfying elixir. I noticed the Egyptian source was replaced with another region but the quality remains superb. Unfortunately, Amazon does not understand the care required to protect the dried whole flowers during delivery and they put it in a plastic sleeve without even the slightest cushion. The result was a badly crushed product. Rishi packs their direct orders properly so Amazon needs to catch up in this area Most people wouldn't care but if I wanted dust, I would have ordered it. I ordered whole flowers and now I have to put them in paper filters to prevent the crushed bits from ending up in my cup...I don't like the taste of paper, I'm spoiled, I know. I tried my microperforated filter but it wasn't enough. But it doesn't stop me from enjoying this Superior product. I just might order direct next time if Amazon can't correct their poor handling. I will say in Amazon's defense they made it right when I complained about my product showing up the way it did. Amazon always makes it right for me. You can't lose on Rishi either way.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
column12: I have been drinking tea for several decades and I went to a small coffee shop in a small town and was blown away by there herbal tea. I asked what it was and they told me, so I ordered my own and my friend blueberry (I like the cinnamon plum) and I can't get enough of it! The longer you let it sit and brew the better! I usually make my tea, then pour hot water over the tea and let it sit for hours then come back and add water to it and I will get 30-40oz out of about 1/4 cup of loose leaf tea. YUMMY!

column10: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
column12: I wanted to try loose leaf tea and bought this flavor to replace the prepackaged Honey Vanilla Chamomile I usually buy. But this is even better! Open opening the package, immediately you can smell the freshness of the leaves. As this was my first time using loose leaf tea, it was fun just gently inhaling the scent, taking a moment to identify and appreciate each of the ingredients.Usually I can't wait for the bags to steep but this time I gave the leaves the appropriate amount of time, the recommended 4 minutes, excited to experience each flavor. While my cup usually has a generous helping of sugar and milk, this time I only added a splash to cool it down, and a small teaspoon. It did not disappoint. The flavors came together beautifully, without the usual bitterness that requires all the sugar to make it enjoyable for me. This time, I actually enjoyed the flavor of the tea itself, savoring each sip.Not only was the sup itself wonderful, but the packaging is aesthetically pleasing. Tightly pressed so no air gets inside keeping leaves fresh.The seller also included a complimentary sample of another flavor. I anticipate getting at least 3 or 4 cups from the sample alone!I highly recommend this tea, this seller, and will definitely be purchasing again.Thank you so much!EDIT- Even though the bag doesnt look like much at first, it goes a long way!We've had this bag for 2 weeks now, and had probably 10 cups worth.  We haven't even gone through a quarter of it. We used to have to use two bags of the pre bagged tea for each cup, so even though there were 20 bags, we would only get 10 cups out of it, and it's about $5 at our local store. This loose leaf not only taste so much better but it you end up getting more bang for your buck!

column3: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (4 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
column5: Organic Sleep Tea: Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is purposefully blended with Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine to support relaxation and good sleep | Delicious Calming Tea: Naturally sweet Rooibos combines with notes of Vanilla and Caramel for a delicious and warming tea; unwind from the day with a comforting cup | Tea Bag Instructions: Bring water to boiling and steep the tea bag for 7 minutes; for a stronger tea, use 2 tea bags; drink before bedtime | Premium Tea Ingredients: This Yogi tea is vegan and NON-GMO, so you can be sure you're getting the best in every cup | Uniquely Yogi: We believe in using the highest quality spices and botanicals, complementing them with intriguing, delightful flavors, qualities that make all of our teas uniquely Yogi
column10: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
column12: I recently discovered the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea, and it has quickly become my go-to drink for a serene and cozy evening routine. This tea has truly transformed my bedtime experience, and I couldn't be more delighted with its comforting flavors and soothing effects.From the moment you open the package, the aromatic notes of caramel fill the air, instantly creating a sense of warmth and relaxation. The delightful scent alone sets the stage for a peaceful and tranquil evening.The taste of this tea is simply divine. The caramel flavor is perfectly balanced, not overpowering, and it adds a delightful touch of sweetness to each sip. It's like indulging in a guilt-free treat that helps me unwind after a long day.What makes the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea truly special is its blend of herbs and botanicals. Infused with chamomile, roasted dandelion, and licorice root, this blend works harmoniously to calm the mind and relax the body. With every sip, I can feel the stress and tension melt away, paving the way for a restful night's sleep.Another aspect I appreciate about this tea is its commitment to using high-quality, organic ingredients. As someone who values natural and wholesome products, it brings me peace of mind knowing that I am nourishing my body with a tea that is free from artificial additives and pesticides.The tea bags are individually wrapped, ensuring optimal freshness and convenience. I appreciate the thoughtfulness that goes into each detail of the packaging, making it easy to enjoy a cup of bliss whenever the mood strikes.Whether you're winding down after a hectic day or simply craving a moment of tranquility, the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea is a true indulgence for the senses. It has become an integral part of my evening ritual, helping me relax, unwind, and drift into a deep, rejuvenating sleep.If you're seeking a delicious and comforting tea that promotes serenity and restfulness, I wholeheartedly recommend the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea. Treat yourself to this delightful blend and discover the blissful sip of serenity it brings to your bedtime routine.

column8: Yep.  It works!  Knocked me right out.
column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
column12: This is my second review;  I fixed a cup up and let it steep for ten minutes. I drank it at 10:00 PM.  It totally destresses/slows down your brain, relaxes your muscles and you fall asleep faster.  But getting up in the morning can be a challenge.  I had to take two naps the next day.  I'm in the over 65 age group and just had surgery so I am in recovery phase, but this was crazy.  I was actually wobbly on my feet!  I was groggy till 3:45 PM.  The next time I used it I REMOVED the tea bag after 3 minutes.  I was more alert the next morning.  You do have to pay attention to just how strong you want this tea.  Don't underestimate its power to work!  My daughter was sleepy to 3:30 the next day and her best friend said it knocked her out and she slept like a rock until nearly noon the next day. Here's the list of ingredients:Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea contains the following ingredients: Organic Chamomile Flower, Organic Rooibos Leaf**, Organic Roasted Chicory Root, Organic Skullcap Leaf, Organic Nutmeg Kernel, Organic Caramel Flavor, Organic Vanilla Flavor, Organic Cinnamon Bark, Organic Stevia Leaf, Organic Cardamom Pod, Organic California Poppy Plant, Organic Ginger Root, Organic Clove Bud, L-Theanine Suntheanine, Organic Black Pepper, Organic Cinnamon Bark Oil, Organic Cardamom Seed Oil, Organic Ginger Root Oil.

column8: Pleasant Herbal Taste & Good for Inflammatory Coughing Caused by Asthma
column10: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
column12: Somewhere I read that thyme tea might be beneficial for congestion and coughing spells.  I am asthmatic and get bouts of bronchial coughing spells that can be a nuisance and hard to control at times. My asthma is caused by inflammation to the airways and thyme is touted as possibly being beneficial for inflammation and soothing a throat irritated by coughing. So, hey, anything that might help I'll at least give it a try.  It does have a pleasant herbal taste, at least in my opinion, and is soothing on my throat. Since it is an herbal tea I can drink it anytime of day or even in the evening and not have to worry about caffeine disturbing my sleep. I can usually get two cups of tea from one teabag so for my personal use it lasts me awhile. I purchased this thyme tea online because I could not find it in any of my local stores. I would purchase it again as it would be good for allergy season as well when I get the sneezing and coughing spells from allergen irritants. Plus it just makes a nice warm soothing nightcap too.I have low blood pressure and am not on medication so I don't worry too much about  the thyme tea raising my blood pressure but those on blood pressure medication might want to take caution. Always, check with your doctor first when in doubt even about herbal products as sometimes they can interfere with prescription meds.
