column10: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
column12: This tea worked miracles for me.  I am not exaggerating one bit.I'm 71 years old with lots of allergies - to foods and environmental vegetation.In July there was a huge wildfire in the mountains near us.  I felt like I was hit with a ton of bricks.  The wildfire smoke wreaked havoc on my body.  My face swelled up badly.  I had difficulty breathing.  My blood pressure went up 21 points and stayed that way for 6 weeks.  I went to my primary care doctor and urgent care during this time.  I was a mess.Then I learned that the fine particulate matter from wildfire smoke settles in the lungs, gets into the bloodstream and can cross the blood-brain barrier.  I was on high doses of prednisone for 6 weeks.  I didn't get better.I finally learned that thyme tea is an anti-inflammatory. So, I bought some from Amazon.  I flavored it with cinnamon, ginger, a pinch of cloves and a little honey.  It tasted good.  After just half a cup, I started to feel better - finally.  After an hour, I was starting to feel 'healthy'.Now, after 3 days, my neighbors and friends are telling me that the swelling on my face is getting better.  When it's so noticeable that even casual neighbors are noticing the difference, you know something good is happening.  And, I just checked my blood pressure.  It's down by 15 points.This tea is really healing me.  And, a friend who is a chef dropped by and I asked him to taste the tea.  After 3 sips, he said that the tightness he had in his chest went away.  I wasn't even aware that he was having chest problems.  He said he hasn't been bothered by asthma in a long time, but that day his chest felt tight.  The tea helped him to feel better.These are true stories.  Take it for what you will.  I just know that I'm happy with the effects this tea has had on my health.

column5: North American Wildflower - This remarkable poppy, native to California, is both drought and heat tolerant. Mikado California Poppy flowers thrive as perennials in warm climates or as annuals in frost-prone areas. | Scarlet Blooms - Saucer shaped flowers have four petals and put on quite a show, especially when planted in mass. They open and close at nighttime or on a cloudy day. | Sustainable Living - Adding California poppy plants into your gardening benefits the local ecosystem and improves garden health. They add beauty to your space and are resilient North American widlflowers, native to the California region. The blooms also can provide needed habitat, pollen, and nectar for beneficial insects, promoting biodiversity in your garden. | The Info You Need to Grow - These non-perishable seeds are packed in a beautiful paper packet with instructions for successful growing and germination in your home garden. Each package also has instructions for saving seeds after harvest. Getting started is simple for both beginner and experienced gardeners. | Small American Family-Owned Business - We’re committed to providing fresh, high-quality seeds such as our kale mix seeds for you to plant now or store for future seasons. We pledge to sell only safe, non-hybrid non-GMO heirloom seeds that are always open-pollinated, untreated, and tested for the best germination rates. They will remain viable for years if stored properly in a cool, dry location.

column10: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
column12: This is the best tea! I am absolutely blown away by its exceptional quality and taste! From the very first sip, I could tell that this was not just any ordinary tea. The flavor is rich, aromatic, and perfectly balanced, providing a soothing and delightful drinking experience. I originally bought this to try when I wasn’t feeling well for the health benefits but I love it so much I drink it all the time, not only when I’m sick.Whether you’re a tea connoisseur or just looking for a healthy, delicious drink, I highly recommend this tea. It truly deserves every bit of this 5-star rating!

column12: This tea is amazing. It’s the next best thing if you can’t get your hands on the actual herbs. Within two days of drinking this tea I felt better. column12: A friend from the Caribbean posted a cocktail he made using this tea to fight off COVID19. I purchased it "just in case" and ended up using it to do the same (combined with a few other natural herbs). No drugs and pretty good health in general also helped. A nice blend even if you're not ill. Add just a tiny bit of cayenne and you will sweat out toxins and impurities. I have zero complaints and I purchased 2 boxes just to have on hand.
